CaptainCasa Demos - Documentation

This documentation contains all demos that are part of the CaptainCasa demo workplace.

The demos show how to implement dialogs using the CaptainCasa Enterprise Client framework.

A dialog is implemented by defining a layout (layout definition) as XML using a set of tags that is provided by the CaptainCasa framework. And it consists ouf of a Java class that reflectes the server side processing of this dialog.

General

Arranging Content

Popup Dialogs

Popup dialogs

Popup pages are just normal pages which are called as popups.

Opening popups is done through the methods "openModalPopup(..)" or "openModelessPopup(..)" that are available with any page bean implementation. The most important parameter to pass is an instance of the page bean that you want to open as popup.

The method returns back an instance of either "ModalPopup" or "ModelessPopup" - providing a couple of methods and properties to influence the popup's size, decoration and position.


There is a special popup handling which is included in the COMBOFIELD. The COMBOFIELD sends a special request to the server - this request can e.g. open up a popup in order to provide value help to the user. There is a preconfigured "IdTextSelection" popup which you can call using the static functions of the Java class "IdTextSelection".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoPopup}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="By pressing one of the following buttons a corresponding popup will be opened." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="e_118" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenBudget}" text="Open Budget" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenMiniSpread}" text="Open Mini Spreadsheet" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenFieldBackground}" text="Field" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenRendered}" text="Rendering" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopup.onOpenDemoRequestFocus}" text="Focus" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopup.onOpenDemoFileUpload}" text="File up/download" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="e_130" height="30" />
<t:row id="e_132" >
<t:textpane id="e_133" text="The control COMBOFIELD allows to open a modal popup (or any other type of valua help reaction) when the user either clicks on the icon or presses F4 inside the field." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onDepartmentAction}" text="#{d.demoPopup.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Default Popups" width="90" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenOKPopup}" text="OK Popup" />
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenOKPopup2}" text="...with Image" />
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenOKPopup3}" text="...with Headline" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenOKPopupWithCancel}" text="OK/Cancel Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" />
<t:rowline id="g_26" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_27" />
<t:row id="g_28" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenYESNOPopup}" text="Yes/No Popup" />
<t:button id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenYESNOPopup2}" text="...with Image" />
<t:button id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenYESNOPopup3}" text="...with Headline" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopup.onOpenYESNOPopupWithCancel}" text="Yes/No/Cancel Popup" />
<t:button id="g_34" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenChainedYESNOPopup}" text="Chained Yes/No Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:textpane id="g_37" text="By pressing the following button a modeless popup will be opened." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_38" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_39" coldistance="2" >
<t:button id="g_40" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenHelloWorld}" text="Hello World" />
<t:button id="g_41" actionListener="#{d.demoPopup.onOpenPane}" text="Panes" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_42" height="5" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoPopup 
    extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    ModelessPopup m_modelessPopupHW;
    ModelessPopup m_modelessPopupPanes;
    int m_chainedPopupCounter = 0;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPopup(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
        
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void setDepartment(String value) { m_department = value; }
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    
    public void onOpenBudget(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoBudget bean = new DemoBudget(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Budget Calculation",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenMiniSpread(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoMinispread bean = new DemoMinispread(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Mini Spreadsheet",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenActiveX(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoActivex bean = new DemoActivex(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"ActiveX",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenDemoRequestFocus(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoRequestfocus bean = new DemoRequestfocus(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Request Focus",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenDemoFileUpload(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoFileDownloadAuto bean = new DemoFileDownloadAuto(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Up/Download triggered by server",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenFieldBackground(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoCombofield bean = new DemoCombofield(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Field",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenRendered(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        final DemoRendered bean = new DemoRendered(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"RENDERED Attribute",800,600,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenHelloWorld(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_modelessPopupHW != null) return; // already opened
        final DemoHelloWorld bean = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_modelessPopupHW = openModelessPopup(bean,"Hello World!",800,300,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
                m_modelessPopupHW = null;
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenPane(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_modelessPopupPanes != null) return; // already opened
        final DemoPanes bean = new DemoPanes(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_modelessPopupPanes = openModelessPopup(bean,"Panes Demo",400,600,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
                m_modelessPopupPanes = null;
            }
        });
    }

    /*
     * COMBOFIELD management
     */
    public void onDepartmentAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        BaseActionEvent bae = (BaseActionEvent)ae;
        if (bae.getCommand().equals(BaseActionEvent.EVTYPE_COMBOFIELD_VALUEHELP))
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("SALES","Sales Department");
            idts.addLine("EXEC","Executive Board");
            idts.setCallBack
            (
                new ISetId() 
                {
                    public void setId(String id)
                    {
                        m_department = id;
                    }
                }
            );
        }
    }
    
    public void onOpenOKPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Please read","This is the content of the popup. Please confirm by pressing OK.",new OKPopup.IOKListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnOK()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("OK was pressed");
            }
        });
    }
    
    public void onOpenOKPopup2(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        OKPopup op = OKPopup.createInstance("Please read","This is the content of the popup. And an icon is shown on the left side as well.\n\n\nPlease confirm by pressing OK.");
        op.setIcon("/images/pictures/paper.png");
        op.getModalPopup().setWidth(500);
        op.getModalPopup().setHeight(270);
    }
    
    public void onOpenOKPopup3(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        OKPopup op = OKPopup.createInstance("Please read","This is the content of the popup. And a headline text is showw on the top as well.\n\n\nPlease confirm by pressing OK.");
        op.setHeadline("Some headline text");
        op.setTextAlign("left");
        op.getModalPopup().setWidth(300);
        op.getModalPopup().setHeight(250);
    }
    
    public void onOpenOKPopupWithCancel(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Please read","This is the content of the popup. Please confirm by pressing OK.",new OKPopup.IOKCancelListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnOK()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("OK was pressed");
            }
            public void reactOnCancel()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("Cancel was pressed");
            }
        });
        okp.setShowCancel(true);
    }
    
    public void onOpenYESNOPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance
        (
            "Please read",
            "This is the content of the popup. Please either select YES or NO - or leave the popup by clicking the corner-close button.",
            new IYesNoListener() 
            {
                public void reactOnNo()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("No was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
                public void reactOnYes()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("Yes was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
            }
        );
    }
    
    public void onOpenYESNOPopup2(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance
        (
            "Please read",
            "This is the content of the popup. Please either select YES or NO - or leave the popup by clicking the corner-close button. Now there is also an image on the left side.",
            new IYesNoListener() 
            {
                public void reactOnNo()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("No was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
                public void reactOnYes()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("Yes was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
            }
        );
        ynp.setIcon("/images/pictures/paper.png");
        ynp.getModalPopup().setWidth(600);
        ynp.getModalPopup().setHeight(270);
    }
    
    public void onOpenYESNOPopup3(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance
        (
            "Please read",
            "This is the content of the popup. Please either select YES or NO - or leave the popup by clicking the corner-close button. Now there is also a headline on the top.",
            new IYesNoListener() 
            {
                public void reactOnNo()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("No was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
                public void reactOnYes()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("Yes was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
            }
        );
        ynp.setHeadline("Some headline text");
        ynp.setTextAlign("left");
        ynp.getModalPopup().setWidth(400);
        ynp.getModalPopup().setHeight(300);
    }
    
    public void onOpenChainedYESNOPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_chainedPopupCounter++;
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance
        (
            "Iteration: " + m_chainedPopupCounter,
            "Press YES for next Yes/No popup. Or NO to abort.",
            new IYesNoListener() 
            {
                public void reactOnNo()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("No was pressed inside the popup.");
                    m_chainedPopupCounter = 0;
                }
                public void reactOnYes()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("Yes was pressed inside the popup.");
                    onOpenChainedYESNOPopup(null);
                }
            }
        );
        if (getWorkpage().getModelessPopupOfWorkpage() != null)
            ynp.getModalPopup().setOwner(getWorkpage().getModelessPopupOfWorkpage());
        else
            ynp.getModalPopup().setStartfromrootwindow(true);
        ynp.getModalPopup().setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }
    
    public void onOpenYESNOPopupWithCancel(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance
        (
            "Please read",
            "This is the content of the popup. Please either select YES or NO - or leave the popup by clicking the corner-close button.",
            new IYesNoListener() 
            {
                public void reactOnNo()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("No was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
                public void reactOnYes()
                {
                    Statusbar.outputMessage("Yes was pressed inside the popup.");
                }
            }
        );
        ynp.setShowCancel(true);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Popup sizing

When opening a popup you can explicitly pass the popup's position and size.

In addition the popup sends its actual position, which might be changed due to user operations, to the server.

The positions (left/top) are relative to the window's coordinates.

All size definitions (width/ height/ left/ top) are scaled automatically by the general scaling factor that is defined on client side (default 100%).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupControl}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Width" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" format="int" value="#{d.DemoPopupControl.width}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Height" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="int" value="#{d.DemoPopupControl.height}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Left" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_10" format="int" value="#{d.DemoPopupControl.left}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Top" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_13" format="int" value="#{d.DemoPopupControl.top}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Open maximized" width="120" />
<t:checkbox id="g_16" selected="#{d.DemoPopupControl.openMaximized}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupControl.onOpenPopup}" text="Open Popup" />
<t:coldistance id="g_21" />
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupControl.onClosePopup}" text="Close Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_23" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_24" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="Client Values" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_28" background="#00000010" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoPopupControl.clientValues}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupControl}")

public class DemoPopupControl
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    boolean m_openMaximized = false;
    protected int m_top = 0;
    protected int m_left = 0;
    protected int m_height = 800;
    protected int m_width = 600;
    ModalPopup m_popup;
    DemoHelloWorld m_bean;
    
    public DemoPopupControl(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public boolean getOpenMaximized() { return m_openMaximized; }
    public void setOpenMaximized(boolean value) { this.m_openMaximized = value; }

    public int getTop() { return m_top; }
    public void setTop(int value) { m_top = value; }

    public int getLeft() { return m_left; }
    public void setLeft(int value) { m_left = value; }

    public int getHeight() { return m_height; }
    public void setHeight(int value) { m_height = value; }

    public int getWidth() { return m_width; }
    public void setWidth(int value) { m_width = value; }

    public void onOpenPopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_popup == null)
        {
            m_bean = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
            m_popup = openModalPopup(m_bean,"Hello World!",m_width,m_height, new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
            {
                public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                {
                    onClosePopup(null);
                }
            });
            m_popup.setTop(m_top);
            m_popup.setLeft(m_left);
            if (m_openMaximized)
            {
                m_popup.maximize(true);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public void onClosePopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_popup != null)
        {
            closePopup(m_bean);
            m_popup = null;
            m_bean = null;
        }
    }

    public String getClientValues() 
    { 
        if (m_popup == null)
            return "Popup instance not available.";
        else
            return m_popup.getLeft() + ", " +
                   m_popup.getTop() + ", " +
                   m_popup.getWidth() + ", " +
                   m_popup.getHeight();
    }

}

Popup positioning

By default a popup is opened below the component that triggered the popup processing.

But you can fine tune by using one of the various setLeftTopReference*-methods.

You even can open a popup at a specific component (that is not the one triggering the popup processing) - and then again decide where to open this, relative to this component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenWithoutReference}" text="Open (default)" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenRight}" text="Open right" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenRightShifted}" text="Open right, some vertical Shift" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenLeft}" text="Open left" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenTop}" text="Open top" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenCentered}" text="Open centered" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenAtAAAAA}" text="Open at AAAAA" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenAtAAAAARight}" text="Open right of AAAAA" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenAtAAAAARightShifted}" text="Open right of AAAAA, some vertical Shift" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenScreenBottom}" text="Open at bottom of screen" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenScreenTop}" text="...top..." />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenScreenLeft}" text="...left..." />
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenScreenRight}" text="...right..." />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="25%" />
<t:label id="AAAAA" stylevariant="ccbig" text="AAAAA" />
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="75%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="100%;30" />
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:button id="g_26" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference.onOpenTop}" text="Open top" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupLefttopreference}")

public class DemoPopupLefttopreference
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoPopupLefttopreference(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onOpenAtAAAAA(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLefTopReferenceComponentId("AAAAA");
    }
    
    public void onOpenAtAAAAABottom(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLefTopReferenceComponentIdBottom("AAAAA");
    }
    
    public void onOpenLeft(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceLeft();
    }
    
    public void onOpenRight(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceRight();
    }
    
    public void onOpenTop(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceTop();
    }
    
    public void onOpenRightShifted(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceRight();
        popup.setTop(-100);
    }
    
    public void onOpenAtAAAAARight(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceComponentIdRight("AAAAA");
    }
    
    public void onOpenAtAAAAARightShifted(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceComponentIdRight("AAAAA");
        popup.setTop(-100);
    }
    
    public void onOpenAtBBBBB(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLefTopReferenceComponentId("BBBBB");
    }

    public void onOpenCentered(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }

    public void onOpenWithoutReference(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
    }

    public void onOpenScreenBottom(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopScreenBottom(true);
    }

    public void onOpenScreenTop(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopScreenTop(true);
    }

    public void onOpenScreenLeft(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopScreenLeft(true);
    }

    public void onOpenScreenRight(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup();
        popup.setLeftTopScreenRight(true);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private ModalPopup openModalPopup()
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld bean = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModalPopup result = openModalPopup(bean,"Hello world!",400,320,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
        return result;
    }

}

Auto sizing of popups
Example

When passing a width and height of "0" into a popup then the popup is automatically sized according to its content.

Pay attention: tpyically pages internally contain a ROWBODYPANE-component. This component internally provides a scroll area for its content. From sizing perspective a scroll area is quite "destructive": the purpose of a scroll area is to allow the user to scroll if its inner conntent is exceeding the scroll area's dimension. Result: if a scroll are is asked from outside what its minimum size is, it will return "something very small" even if its contained content is big - the inner content's size is hidden.

When using the possibility to automatically size a popup then the JSP page that is contained in the popup should not contain any scroll are as consequence.

If changing the content of a popup at runtime (as shown if clicking onto the link "Show/hide additional lines") you may retrigger the automated resizing of the popup by calling the method Modal/ModelessPopup.setWidthHeightToDesiredSize().

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupPacked}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default Position" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupPacked.onOpenDefaultPosition}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Centered" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupPacked.onOpenCentered}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="On the right" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupPacked.onOpenRight}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.DemoPopupPackedPopup.IListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupPacked}")

public class DemoPopupPacked 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    ModalPopup m_popup;
    
    public DemoPopupPacked(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onOpenDefaultPosition(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup();
    }
    
    public void onOpenCentered(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup();
        m_popup.setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }
    
    public void onOpenRight(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup();
        m_popup.setLeftTopReferenceRight();
    }
    
    public void openPopup() 
    {
        // screen navigation
        final DemoPopupPackedPopup bean = new DemoPopupPackedPopup();
        m_popup = openModalPopup(bean,"Packed Popup",0,0,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
        // data navigation
        bean.prepare(new IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnClose()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
                m_popup = null;
            }
            public void reactOnToBeResized()
            {
                m_popup.setWidthHeightToDesiredSize();
            }
        });
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        if (m_popup == null)
          ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Popup is closed");  
        else
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Popup is opened");  
        return false;
    }

}

Dealing with SCROLLPANEs

When passing a size of "0" as width and/or height of a popup dialog then the dialog is automatically sized by measuring the required height of its contained components.

If the content contains a SCROLLPANE (which also is implicitly contained in the ROWBODYPANE component) then there is a problem: it's exactly the task of a SCROLLPANE to hide the size of its contained content - by letting the user scroll through the content. So the required content of a SCROLLPANE is very small indeed!

To overcome there is an attribute SIZETOCONTENTINPOPUP. If defining as "true" then the SCROLLPANE indicates to take the full size of its content in case of being part of popup dialog.

Of course: if there is no sufficient screen space, then the SCROLLPANE will be shrinked accordingly - and then shows corresponding scroll bars.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open popup with scroll pane 1" width="250+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_13" background="#404040" contenttype="text/html" font="family:Courier New" foreground="#C0FFC0" text="&amp;lt;t:rowbodypane id=&#34;g_4&#34; rowdistance=&#34;5&#34; sizetocontentinpopup=&#34;true&#34;&amp;gt;&lt;br&gt;......&lt;br&gt;&amp;lt;/t:rowbodypane&amp;gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_24" text="(the same attribute is available with SCROLLPANE)" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller.onOpenPopup2Action}" text="Open popup with scroll pane 2" width="250+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_20" background="#404040" contenttype="text/html" font="family:Courier New" foreground="#C0FFC0" text="&amp;lt;t:rowbodypane id=&#34;g_4&#34; rowdistance=&#34;5&#34;&amp;gt;&lt;br&gt;......&lt;br&gt;&amp;lt;/t:rowbodypane&amp;gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller}")

public class DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupscrollpanecaller.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupScrollpaneCaller}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupScrollpane ui = new DemoPopupScrollpane();
        openModalPopup(ui,"Popup containing scroll pane",0,0,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,ui));
    }

    public void onOpenPopup2Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupScrollpane2 ui = new DemoPopupScrollpane2();
        openModalPopup(ui,"Popup containing scroll pane",0,0,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,ui));
    }

}

Positioning on top of component

When pressing the button "Open popup" a modal dialog is opened. It is placed directly on top of the "Some content"-area.

Please check the JavaCode - there are two methods which cause this behavior:

1. the method "setLefTopReferenceComponentIdCentered("<id>")" positions the popup on to of the center of the referenced component.

2. the method "setWidthHeightToSizeOfReference()" automatically sets the size of the popup to the size of the referenced area.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupSizingByReference}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupSizingByReference.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open popup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:pane id="REF1" background="#FF000010" height="300" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_6" height="100%" text="Some content" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupSizingByReference}")

public class DemoPopupSizingByReference
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupSizingByReference(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupsizingbyreference.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupSizingByReference}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld ui = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModalPopup mp = openModalPopup(ui,"Hello world",0,0,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(ui);
            }
        });
        mp.setLeftTopReferenceComponentIdCentered("REF1");
        mp.setWidthHeightToSizeOfReference();
        mp.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }
}

Pass Values into Popup

This example demonstrates how data is passed between the calling page and the popped up page.

The calling page creates the popped up page and calls "prepare" method, passing all the information that the popped up page requires to exist.

Especially take a look onto the management of closing the popup via the explicit "close" button: the button invokes an action listener within the page bean of the popup, the action listener calls back via an interface the page bean that opened the popup.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPassValueCaller}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="The values that you define below will be passed into the popup." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoPassValueCaller.firstName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoPassValueCaller.lastName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoPassValueCaller.onOpenPopup}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPassValueCaller}")

public class DemoPassValueCaller
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected String m_lastName;
    protected String m_firstName;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPassValueCaller(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
    public void onOpenPopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPassValuePopup bean = new DemoPassValuePopup(getOwningDispatcher());
        openModalPopup(bean,"Demo Popup",300,300,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
        bean.prepare(m_lastName,
                     m_firstName,
                     new DemoPassValuePopup.ICloseListener()
                     {
                         public void reactOnClose()
                         {
                             closePopup(bean);
                         }
                     });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

/* Code of popup page:
package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPassValuePopup}")

public class DemoPassValuePopup
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public interface ICloseListener
    {
        public void reactOnClose();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ICloseListener m_listener;
    protected String m_lastName;
    protected String m_firstName;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPassValuePopup(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void prepare(String lastName, String firstName, ICloseListener listener)
    {
        m_lastName = lastName;
        m_firstName = firstName;
        m_listener = listener;
    }
    
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
    public void onClose(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_listener != null)
            m_listener.reactOnClose();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}
 */

Chained popups

Select one or more items from the grid (hold down the ctrl- or shift-key for multiple selection). Then remove the selected items. A popup will show up for each item, letting the user confirm if the items really is to be removed.

The example shows how to use a sequence of popups. Be aware about the separation between UI client and server side processing. The processing is not managed within a loop, as you may expect when coming from fat client applications. But the processing is managed by a chained server side algorithm.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupChain}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupChain.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" width="20" >
<t:checkbox id="g_5" enabled="false" selected=".{selected}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_9" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupChain.onRemoveSelected}" text="Remove Selected Items" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupChain}")

public class DemoPopupChain
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        
        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    protected MyRow m_selectedRow = null;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPopupChain(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("First " + i);
            r.setLastName("Last " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void onRemoveSelected(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        removeNextSelectedItem();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void removeNextSelectedItem()
    {
        // check if there is a selected item. Do not use m_gird.getSelectedItems()
        // because this returns a set. In this processing we want the items 
        // to be processed in the sequence they appear in the grid.
        m_selectedRow = null;
        for (MyRow row: m_rows.getItems()) 
        {
            if (row.getSelected() == true)
            {
                m_selectedRow = row;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (m_selectedRow == null)
            return;
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance(m_selectedRow.m_lastName + ", " + m_selectedRow.m_firstName,
                                                   "Do you really want to remove this item?",
                                                   new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
        {
            public void reactOnNo()
            {
                // do not remove ==> deselect so that is is not processed with next
                // removeNextSelectedItem()
                m_rows.deselectItem(m_selectedRow);
                removeNextSelectedItem();
            }
            public void reactOnYes()
            {
                // remove
                m_rows.getItems().remove(m_selectedRow);
                removeNextSelectedItem();
            }
        });
        if (getWorkpage().getModelessPopupOfWorkpage() != null)
            ynp.getModalPopup().setOwner(getWorkpage().getModelessPopupOfWorkpage());
        else
            ynp.getModalPopup().setStartfromrootwindow(true);
        ynp.getModalPopup().setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }

}

Undecorated Popups

Popups can be opened in various modes.

This example shows a nice mode of usage: the popup is opened as modeless popup, with additional parameters:
(.) it is opened "undecorated" - i.e. there is no title, no explicit border
(.) it is opened with "closeonclickoutside" - i.e. it automatically closes once the user clicks with the mouse outside the popup.

As consequence you can build nice add-on-dialogs in which you arrange optional functions, that you do not want to add to your main screen.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_5" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupUndecorated}" >
<t:rowheader id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupUndecorated.onOpenSearch}" contentareafilled="false" horizontaltextposition="left" image="/images/icons/magnifier.png" text="Search..." />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdistance id="g_1" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Press the &#34;Search...&#34; button!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupUndecorated}")

public class DemoPopupUndecorated
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    
    public DemoPopupUndecorated(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onOpenSearch(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupUndecoratedSearch bean = new DemoPopupUndecoratedSearch(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModelessPopup popup = openModelessPopup(bean,"Search",250,300,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
        popup.setUndecorated(true);
        popup.setSizeableIfUndecorated(true);
        popup.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }
}

Moving window by titlebar

This example shows a window that is popped up when pressing the button. The window is an undecorated window - but sill can be moved by the user dragging & dropping the mouse onto the titlebar of the window.

In the window that is popped up, the titlebar is defined to be one that is abled to move the whole window. Use the ROWTITLEBAR-ISWINDOWMOVER attribute correspondingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupTitlebar}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Open Popup" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupTitlebar.onStartPopup}" text="Open..." />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupTitlebar}")

public class DemoPopupTitlebar
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoPopupTitlebar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onStartPopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupTitlebarPopup bean = new DemoPopupTitlebarPopup(getOwningDispatcher());
        bean.prepare(new DemoPopupTitlebarPopup.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnClose()
            {
                closePopup(bean);
            }
        });
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup(bean,"Moveable titlebar",400,300,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,bean));
        popup.setUndecorated(true);
    }
}

Animation during opening

There are two types of animations that can be applied to a popup dialog when opening up:

1. the "size animation" is the most visible one: this one controls how the dialog finds its position and size, e.g. you may define some rotation or scaling.

2. the "content animation" is some animation effect that is executed on top of the content are of the dialog: here you have different animation types, e.g. you may define some shading that disappears into a certain direction.

Please pay attention: there is a global definition (CLIENTCONFIG-ANIMATE and/or URL-client-parameter "?ccanimate=false") that you might use to switch off all animations. This switch overrides individual definitions, that you apply for popup dialogs.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combobox id="g_2" labeltext="Size animation" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation.sizeAnimationTypeVVS}" value="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation.sizeAnimationType}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:combobox id="g_9" labeltext="Content animation" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation.contentAnimationTypeVVS}" value="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation.contentAnimationType}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupSizeAnimation.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Popup" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemopopupsizeanimationUI}")

public class DemoPopupSizeAnimation
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_contentAnimationType;
    String m_sizeAnimationType;
    ValidValuesBinding m_contentAnimationTypeVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    ValidValuesBinding m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupSizeAnimation(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("scalein","scalein");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("topdown","topdown");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("bottomup","bottomup");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("leftright","leftright");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("rightleft","rightleft");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("rotatehorizontally","rotatehorizontally");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("rotatevertically","rotatevertically");
        m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("noanimation","noanimation");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("hidetotop","hidetotop");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("hidetobottom","hidetobottom");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("hidetoleft","hidetoleft");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("hidetoright","hidetoright");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("shrinktocenter","shrinktocenter");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("foglight","foglight");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("fogdark","fogdark");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("fogred","fogred");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("shake","shake");
        m_contentAnimationTypeVVS.addValidValue("noanimation","noanimation");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupsizeanimation.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemopopupsizeanimationUI}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getContentAnimationTypeVVS() { return m_contentAnimationTypeVVS; }
    public ValidValuesBinding getSizeAnimationTypeVVS() { return m_sizeAnimationTypeVVS; }

    public String getContentAnimationType() { return m_contentAnimationType; }
    public void setContentAnimationType(String value) { this.m_contentAnimationType = value; }

    public String getSizeAnimationType() { return m_sizeAnimationType; }
    public void setSizeAnimationType(String value) { this.m_sizeAnimationType = value; }

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld ui = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModalPopup p = openModalPopup(ui,"Hello world",600,400,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setAnimationtype(m_contentAnimationType);
        p.setSizeAnimationtype(m_sizeAnimationType);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Opacity of Popups

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupOpacity}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Opacity = 50" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOpacity.onOpacity50}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Opacity = 75" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOpacity.onOpacity75}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Opacity = 90" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOpacity.onOpacity90}" text="Open" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupOpacity}")

public class DemoPopupOpacity
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{    
    public DemoPopupOpacity(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public void onOpacity90(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup(90);
    }

    public void onOpacity75(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup(75);
    }

    public void onOpacity50(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup(50);
    }

    public void openPopup(int opacity) 
    {
        ModalPopup mp = OKPopup.createInstance("Test Opacity","This popup is rendered with an opacity of "+opacity+".").getModalPopup();
        mp.setOpacity(opacity);
        mp.setUndecorated(true);
    }

}

Adapting Popup Size

This example opens a popup with a certain height.

The popup shows information about a Java error - both a short text and a long text (the stack trace).

Within the popup a FOLDABLEPANE is contained. When opening this FOLDABLEPANE then the popup height is adapted accordingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMessagePopupStarter}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoMessagePopupStarter.onShowMessageAction}" text="Show Message" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMessagePopupStarter}")

public class DemoMessagePopupStarter
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoMessagePopupStarter(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomessagepopupstarter.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMessagePopupStarter}"; }
    
    public void onShowMessageAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoMessagePopup dmp = new DemoMessagePopup();
        ModalPopup popup = openModalPopup(dmp,"Message",0,0,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(dmp);
            }
        });
        dmp.prepare(new Error(),popup);
        popup.setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }

}

Tooltip Popups

You may explicitly take over the tooltip management by a server side implementation. To do so define the attribute TOOLTIP as "server:true". As result you will receive two corresponding events for opening and closing the tooltip.

The popup dialogs that you may open up, can be designed without any restrictions. - Of course you may not open up a popup at all, but e.g. also show some information in another area of the screen as reaction on the tooltip processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Move the mouse over the fields..." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_10" text="In this example the popup disappears immediately when the user moves the mouse out of the componnent area." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true;closedelay:1000;opendelay:300" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_17" text="In this example the popup disappears after a certain period of time when the user moves the mouse out of the componnent area. The period of time is defined by the definition &#34;closedelay:xxx&#34; in the TOOLTIP attribute." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_18" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true;keeppopup:true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_24" text="In this example the popup does not disappear if the user navigates into the popup itself - but it only disappears if the user moves the mouse either out of the field or out of the popup. This is done due to 2 definitions: 1. the definition &#34;keeppopup:true&#34; in the TOOLTIP attribute and 2. the defintion setCloseOnMouseExit(true) in the code when opening the tooltip popup." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEventTooltipEnded;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEventTooltipStarted;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}")

public class DemoToolTipByServer
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DemoToolTipByServerPopup m_tooltipPopup = null;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoToolTipByServer(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotooltipbyserver.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onFieldAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventTooltipStarted)
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Tooltip started");
            if (m_tooltipPopup == null)
            {
                m_tooltipPopup = new DemoToolTipByServerPopup();
                ModelessPopup mp = openModelessPopup(m_tooltipPopup,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
                {
                    public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                    {
                        closePopup(m_tooltipPopup);
                        m_tooltipPopup = null;
                    }
                });
                mp.setUndecorated(true);
                mp.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
                mp.setCloseonmouseexit(true);
                mp.setLeftTopMousePosition(true);
            }
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventTooltipEnded)
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Tooltip ended");
            if (m_tooltipPopup != null)
            {
                closePopup(m_tooltipPopup);
                m_tooltipPopup = null;
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Sticky Popup Position

Press the button - and a corresponding dialog will show up.

When nowing scrolling/moving the screen then the popup will always follow the position relative to the button, where it was started from.

Inside the Java code you see that the method "ModelessDialog.setStickyPosition(true)" is called when opening the dialog.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupStickyPosition}">
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textpane id="g_5" text="This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button. This is some information on top of the button." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pane id="g_7" height="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupStickyPosition.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:pane id="g_11" height="2000" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupStickyPosition}")

public class DemoPopupStickyPosition
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupStickyPosition(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupstickyposition.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupStickyPosition}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    public void onOpenPopupAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupStickPositionPopup popupBean = new DemoPopupStickPositionPopup   ();
        ModelessPopup popupDialog = openModelessPopup(popupBean,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(popupBean);
            }
        });
        popupBean.prepare(new DemoPopupStickPositionPopup.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnClose()
            {
                closePopup(popupBean);
            }
        });
        popupDialog.setUndecorated(true);
        popupDialog.setStickyPosition(true);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Opening of value help dialogs by code

When selecting a value in the popup for department thent directly the value popup for the employee is opened.

By default a dialog is opened at the point of last user activity - so in this case you want to explicitly position the employee popup to be located at the employee field - though not being opened from there. That's the reason why explicit component ids are used an referenced when opening the employee popup.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="When selecting the department then the dialog for the employee will be opened automatically." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="CFDEPARTMENT" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence.onDepartmentAction}" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Employee" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="CFEMPLOYEE" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence.onEmployeeAction}" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence.employee}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence}")

public class DemoComboFieldPopupSequence
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_employee;
    String m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------


    public DemoComboFieldPopupSequence(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democombofieldpopupsequence.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboFieldPopupSequence}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getEmployee() { return m_employee; }
    public void setEmployee(String value) { this.m_employee = value; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onEmployeeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            idts.addLine("EMPL_00"+i,"Employee 00"+i);
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_employee = id;
            }
        });
        idts.getPopup().setLefTopReferenceComponentIdBottom("CFEMPLOYEE");
    }

    public void onDepartmentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
            idts.addLine("DEP_"+i,"Department "+i);
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_department = id;
                onEmployeeAction(null); // maybe not the nicest way to call...
            }
        });
    }
