    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Screen background color

By using method ModalPopup.setScreeBackgroundColor() you may define the background color of the shadow that is drawn behind the popup. If not defined then the color is taken from the CSS style.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground.onOpenDefault}" text="Open popup - default" width="1%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground.onOpenAttention}" text="Open popup - attention!" width="1%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground.onOpenOK}" text="Open popup - OK!" width="1%;200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground}")

public class DemoPopupScreenBackground
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupScreenBackground(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupscreenbackground.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupScreenBackground}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenOK(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup("#00800040");
    }

    public void onOpenAttention(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup("#80000040");
    }

    public void onOpenDefault(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup(null);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void openPopup(String backgroundColor)
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld ui = new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModalPopup mp = openModalPopup(ui,"Hello world",700,400,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(ui);
            }
        });
        mp.setScreenBackgroundColor(backgroundColor);
    }
}

Guided tour

By pressing the button "Start guided tour" a sequence of popup dialogs is started that explains certain parts of the screen.

The demo shows how to use certain features in the area of opening dialogs on top of components.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGuidedDialog}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoGuidedDialog.onStartAction}" text="Start guided tour" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" group="POSITIONING" refvalue="ONTOP" text="On top of area" value="#{d.DemoGuidedDialog.positioning}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_6" group="POSITIONING" refvalue="BELOW" text="Below area" value="#{d.DemoGuidedDialog.positioning}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_7" />
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="10" >
<t:foldablepane id="PART1" enabled="false" height="200" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Person" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Title" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_11" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="First name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Last name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_17" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="PART2" enabled="false" height="200" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Address" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Street" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_20" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_23" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Zip code" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_26" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="City" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_29" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Country" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_32" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:foldablepane id="PART3" height="100%;200" text="Comment" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:textarea id="g_35" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGuidedDialog}")

public class DemoGuidedDialog
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String[] m_areaIds = new String[] 
    {
        "PART1",
        "PART2",
        "PART3"
    };
    String[] m_areaInfoTexts = new String[] 
    {
        "The first name and the last name are the most important fields to input!",
        "The address part is only needed in case of shipping goods to the user. You may input or not input - it's up to you.",
        "Here you can specify any additional comment."
    };
    int m_currentAreaIndex = 0;
    DemoGuidedDialogInfo m_currentInfo = null;
    String m_positioning = "ONTOP";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGuidedDialog(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoguideddialog.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGuidedDialog}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onStartAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_currentAreaIndex = 0;
        showCurrentDialog();
    }

    public String getPositioning() { return m_positioning; }
    public void setPositioning(String value) { this.m_positioning = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void showCurrentDialog()
    {
        if (m_currentInfo != null)
        {
            closePopup(m_currentInfo);
        }
        m_currentInfo = new DemoGuidedDialogInfo();
        m_currentInfo.prepare(
           m_areaInfoTexts[m_currentAreaIndex],
           new DemoGuidedDialogInfo.IListener()
           {
               public void reactOnNavigation(int delta)
               {
                   m_currentAreaIndex += delta;
                   m_currentAreaIndex = (m_currentAreaIndex + m_areaIds.length) % m_areaIds.length;
                   showCurrentDialog();
               }
           }
        );
        ModalPopup p = openModalPopup(m_currentInfo,"",0,0,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,m_currentInfo));
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        if ("ONTOP".equals(m_positioning))
        {
            p.setWidthHeightToSizeOfReference();
            p.setLeftTopReferenceComponentIdCentered(m_areaIds[m_currentAreaIndex]);
            p.setScreenBackgroundColor("#FFFFFF00"); // transparent
        }
        else
        {
            p.setWidth(400);
            p.setHeight(200);
            p.setLefTopReferenceComponentIdBottom(m_areaIds[m_currentAreaIndex]);
            p.setTop(-30);
            p.setLeft(100);
            p.setHighlightReference(true);
            p.setScreenBackgroundColor("#00000060"); // darker gray
        }
    }
}

Closing popup by moving mouse

Open the popup - you will see: the popup will close when moving the mouse.

Use this mode in order to define popup dialogs e.g. containing some message to the user, which should not interrupt the user too much - but which need some minimum level of user acknowledgement.

Please note: the internal listening to mouse-move-events starts after a short duration of time (1000 ms). This duration ensures that the user actually is able to register the message in scenarios in which he/she is working with the mouse. Without this the user would sometimes only see some short flickering of the dialog, without any change to check the content.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity.onOpenOwnPopupAction}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Close on mouse activity" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Message Popup" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity.onOpenOwnPopupAction}" text="Open own popup" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Close on mouse exit" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity.onOpenPopupExitAction}" text="Open Message Popup" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity.onOpenOwnPopupExitAction}" text="Open own popup" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity}")

public class DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupcloseonmouseactivity.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupCloseOnMouseActivity}"; }

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Message Popup","This popup will be closed when moving the mouse some pixels. - Use this type of closing for \"ultra-lightweight\" dialogs.");
        okp.getModalPopup().setCloseonmouseactivity(true);
        okp.getModalPopup().setUndecorated(true);
    }

    public void onOpenOwnPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld ui= new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"Hello world!" ,800,480,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setCloseonmouseactivity(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }

    public void onOpenPopupExitAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Message Popup","This popup will be closed when moving the mouse out of the area of the popup dialog.");
        okp.getModalPopup().setCloseonmouseexit(true);
//        okp.getModalPopup().setUndecorated(true);
    }

    public void onOpenOwnPopupExitAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoHelloWorld ui= new DemoHelloWorld(getOwningDispatcher());
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"Hello world!" ,800,480,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setCloseonmouseexit(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }

}

Own style class for popup dialogs

By default the popup dialog is styled using the style class "riscdialog_popup" - which in the default style is defined as area with white background and with a certain shading.

But you can also extend this style class by own style classes - and then pass the name of the style class by calling method Modal/ModelessPopup.setStyleseq(...).

There is a default style "riscdialog_popup_transparent" which defined the background with transparent color and with no shading.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq.onOpenActionDefault}" text="Default style" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq.onOpenActionTransparent}" text="Style &#34;transparent&#34;" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq.onOpenActionBorder}" text="Style &#34;border&#34;" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq}")

public class DemoPopupStyleSeq
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupStyleSeq(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupstyleseq.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupStyleSeq}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void onOpenActionDefault(ActionEvent event)
    {
        openPopup();
    }
    
    public void onOpenActionTransparent(ActionEvent event)
    {
        ModalPopup mp = openPopup();
        mp.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_transparent");
    }

    public void onOpenActionBorder(ActionEvent event)
    {
        ModalPopup mp = openPopup();
        mp.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_border");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private ModalPopup openPopup()
    {
        final DemoPopupStyleSeqPopup ui = new DemoPopupStyleSeqPopup();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupStyleSeqPopup.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnClosed()
            {
                closePopup(ui);
            }
        });
        ModalPopup result = openModalPopup(ui,"Title",0,0,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,ui));
        result.setUndecorated(true);
        return result;
    }
}

Popup style selection

This example shows how to open a dialog that points to the component starting the dialog. Note, that the popup's styling is changing when clicking the button at the bottom.

The popup is opened with using style class "riscdialog_popup_pointer".

When taking a look into style class definitions then you find three style classes:

1. "riscdialog_popup_pointer"
2. "riscdialog_popup_pointer_alternative"
3. "riscdialog_popup_pointer_else"

The selection of styles is done in the following way:

A. A dialog popup is opened at a preferred location - which is normally directly below the control that triggers the creation of the popup. If this preferred location really is the one which is used then the "normal" style class is used, that is assigned to the dialog popup.

B. If the dialog does not fit at its preferred location due to missing screen space, then an alternative location is defined - which is normally directly above the triggering control. If a style with the extension "_alternative" is defined then this style is used.

C. If also the alternative location does not fit, then the popup is positioned "somewhere else" - and the style class with extension "_else" is used, if available.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:pane id="g_4" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_2" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default positioning bottom/top" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_23" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicit positioning left/right" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:button id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupRightAction}" text="Open Popup" />
<t:coldistance id="g_34" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupLeftAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_32" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicit positioning mouse position" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_49" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:button id="g_43" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow.onOpenPopupRightOfMouseAction}" text="Open Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_47" height="20" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_10" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow}")

public class DemoPopupWithArrow
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupWithArrow(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupwitharrow.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupWithArrow}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupWithArrowPopup ui = new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"",300,0,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        p.setLeftTopReferenceBottom();
        p.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_pointer");
    }

    public void onOpenPopupRightAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupWithArrowPopup ui = new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"",300,0,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        p.setLeftTopReferenceRight();
        p.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_pointer_right");
        p.setSizeAnimationtype("leftright");
    }

    public void onOpenPopupLeftAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupWithArrowPopup ui = new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"",300,0,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        p.setLeftTopReferenceLeft();
        p.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_pointer_left");
        p.setSizeAnimationtype("rightleft");
    }

    public void onOpenPopupRightOfMouseAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupWithArrowPopup ui = new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupWithArrowPopup.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(ui,"",300,0,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(this,ui));
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        p.setLeftTopMousePosition(false);
        p.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_pointer_right");
        p.setSizeAnimationtype("leftright");
        p.setTop(-38);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Lightweight side popups

This examples shows some lightweight popups that are attached to some side area of the dialog.

The attributes of the popup are defined in the following way:

1. setUndecorated(true)
2. setAlwaysOnTop(true)
3. setLeftTopScreenTop/Right(true)

The size is passed as width=0 and height=0 so that the size is automatically calculated on frontend side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSidePopups}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSidePopups}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoSidePopups.onOpenTopPopupAction}" text="Open top message info" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoSidePopups.onOpenBottomPopupAction}" text="Open bottom message info" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoSidePopups.onOpenLeftSidePopupAction}" text="Open info on the left" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoSidePopups.onOpenSidePopupAction}" text="Open info on the right" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSidePopups}")

public class DemoSidePopups
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    DemoSidePopupsPopup m_topBottomUI; 
    DemoSidePopupsSideIcons m_sideUI;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSidePopups(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            @Override
            public void closeForced()
            {
                if (m_topBottomUI != null) closePopup(m_topBottomUI);
                if (m_sideUI != null) closePopup(m_sideUI);
                m_sideUI = null;
                m_topBottomUI = null;
                super.closeForced();
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosidepopups.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSidePopups}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenTopPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openTopBottomPopup(true);
    }
    
    public void onOpenBottomPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openTopBottomPopup(false);
    }
    
    private void openTopBottomPopup(boolean top)
    {
        if (m_topBottomUI != null)
        {
            closePopup(m_topBottomUI);
        }
        m_topBottomUI = new DemoSidePopupsPopup();
        m_topBottomUI.prepare(14,new DemoSidePopupsPopup.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClosed()
            {
                if (m_topBottomUI != null) closePopup(m_topBottomUI);
                m_topBottomUI = null;
            }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(m_topBottomUI,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                if (m_topBottomUI != null) closePopup(m_topBottomUI);
                m_topBottomUI = null;
            }
        });
        if (top == true)
            p.setLeftTopScreenTop(true);
        else
            p.setLeftTopScreenBottom(true);
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setAlwaysOnTop(true);
    }

    
    public void onOpenLeftSidePopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openSidePopup(true);
    }
    
    public void onOpenSidePopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openSidePopup(false);
    }

    private void openSidePopup(boolean left)
    {
        if (m_sideUI != null)
        {
            closePopup(m_sideUI);
        }
        m_sideUI = new DemoSidePopupsSideIcons();
        m_sideUI.prepare(new DemoSidePopupsSideIcons.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClosed()
            {
                closePopup(m_sideUI);
                m_sideUI = null;
            }
        });
        ModelessPopup p = openModelessPopup(m_sideUI,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                if (m_sideUI != null) closePopup(m_sideUI);
                m_sideUI = null;
            }
        });
        if (left == true)
            p.setLeftTopScreenLeft(true);
        else
            p.setLeftTopScreenRight(true);
        p.setUndecorated(true);
        p.setAlwaysOnTop(true);
    }
}

Own popup title bar (PBC)

By calling a popup dialog and setting the property "undecorated" to "true", the dialog will not show its default title bar. You can design some own one, just using normal components.

In the addons-component-library (eclnt_pbc), there is a predefined extended title bar component "CCPopupDialogTitle":

The component renders a normal popup title bar, but allows to add additional content, for example additional icons, menus or other components.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open popup" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller}")

public class DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccpopupdialogtitlecaller.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitleCaller}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitle ui = new DemoPBCCCPopupDialogTitle();
        ModalPopup p =openModalPopup(ui,"This is a popup dialog",500,300,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(ui);
            }
        });
        p.setUndecorated(true); // own titlebar!
        p.setSizeableIfUndecorated(true); // still size-able
    }

}

Hide close/maximize icon

By calling ModalPopup/ModelessPopup.hideCloseIcon() you can influence the title bar of the decorated dialog.

In addition to the optical removing of the icon, the user also cannot close the dialog by pressing "escape" on the keyboard.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon.onPopupDefaultAction}" text="Open popup - default" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon.onPopupWithoutCloseIconAction}" text="Open popup - no close icon" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon.onPopupWithoutMaximizeIconAction}" text="Open popup - no maximize icon" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon.onPopupWithoutIconAction}" text="Open popup - no icon at all" width="300+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon}")

public class DemoPopupHideCloseIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupHideCloseIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher) 
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopuphidecloseicon.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupHideCloseIcon}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onPopupDefaultAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // here the popup is used by using a default popup...
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance("Default closing","By default users can close a dialog by a close icon - and, in case of modal dialogs, by pressing the escape-key.",new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() { }
        });
    }

    public void onPopupWithoutCloseIconAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // here the popup is used by using a default popup...
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance("No closing!","There is no closing by some close icon and no closing by pressing escape on the keyboard! You have to either press Yes or No.",new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() { }
        });
        ynp.getModalPopup().hideCloseIcon();
    }

    public void onPopupWithoutMaximizeIconAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // here the popup is used by using a default popup...
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance("No maximizing!","There is no maximize icon inside the title bar of this popup.",new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() { }
        });
        ynp.getModalPopup().hideMaximizeIcon();
    }

    public void onPopupWithoutIconAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // here the popup is used by using a default popup...
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance("No icon at all!","There is no icon inside the title bar of this popup.",new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes() { }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo() { }
        });
        ynp.getModalPopup().hideCloseIcon();
        ynp.getModalPopup().hideMaximizeIcon();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Close popup with inconsistent client data

There are situations in which you do not want data resets to block the next roundtrip.

Example: any processing that cancels some operation. In this case: the current user input anyway is not processed on server side.

Pay attention: ignoring roundtrip vetos is dangerous for all other situations. When e.g. a "Save"-operation is called, then you want a data-reset to veto the next roundtrip! Otherwise the data that is reset is immediately passed into the "Save"-processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Client side input" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_2" format="int" labeltext="Integer value between 0 and 10" maxvalue="10" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.intValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:field id="g_9" labeltext="String value with regular expression" regex="[01]+" regexhint="Only input &#34;0&#34; and &#34;1&#34;" regexmode="1" text="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.stringValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="10" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.onOKDefaultAction}" text="OK - Default" width="150+" />
<t:button id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.onOKIgnoreAction}" ignoreroundtripvetos="true" text="OK - Ignore vetos" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:textpane id="g_33" text="Key in some invalid data - then either press one of the OK buttons: the default processing will reset field values and will veto the round trip to the server. The processing with ignoring vetos will reset field values and will perform the roundtrip." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_14" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Server side values" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" labeltext="Integer value" text="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.intValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" labeltext="String value" text="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.stringValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" foreground="#800000" labeltext="Roundtrip counter" labeltextforeground="#800000" text="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.roundtripCounter}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" stylevariant="ccbig" text="The same with popup dialogs" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" coldistance="10" >
<t:button id="g_40" actionListener="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.onPopupDefaultAction}" text="Popup - Default" width="150+" />
<t:button id="g_41" actionListener="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos.onPopupIgnoreAction}" ignoreroundtripvetos="true" text="Poup - Ignore vetos" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos}")

public class DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_roundtripCounter;
    String m_stringValue;
    int m_intValue;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoignoreroundtripvetos.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetos}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getRoundtripCounter() { return m_roundtripCounter; }
    public void setRoundtripCounter(int value) { this.m_roundtripCounter = value; }

    public String getStringValue() { return m_stringValue; }
    public void setStringValue(String value) { this.m_stringValue = value; }

    public int getIntValue() { return m_intValue; }
    public void setIntValue(int value) { this.m_intValue = value; }

    public void onOKDefaultAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_roundtripCounter++;
    }
    
    public void onOKIgnoreAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_roundtripCounter++;
    }

    public void onPopupDefaultAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        openPopup();
    }
    
    public void onPopupIgnoreAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ModalPopup p = openPopup();
        p.ignoreRoundtripVetosOnClose();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private ModalPopup openPopup()
    {
        final DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetosPopup ui = new DemoIgnoreRoundtripVetosPopup();
        ModalPopup result = openModalPopup(ui,"Input some incorrect data...",0,0,new IModalPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(ui);
            }
        });
        return result;
    }
}

Visibility of parent hotkey definitions

By default hotkey definitions within the parent of a popup dialog are not visible inside the dialog itself. The dialog forms a "hotkey sandbox".

You can override by calling Modal/ModelessPopup.setParentHotkeysActive(true) - in this case the hotkey definitions of the parent are processed in the dialog as well.

In the example the first dialog is following the default hotkey processing - i.e. there is no visibility of parent hotkeys in the valid-values-dialog.

In the second example the parent hotkeys are visible.
Please note: due to the fact that the popup internally is defined with "closeonclickoutside", the dialog immediately closes after invoking one of the hotkeys.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}" />
<t:rowheader id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onHotkey1Action}" hotkey="ctrl-shift-49" text="Invoke action 1" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_11" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:textpane id="g_8" text="There are two &#34;hotkey&#34; definitions in this dialog, both triggering some output within the status bar:1. ctrl-shift-1 invokes action 1 - the hotkey is defined as global hotkey2. ctrl-shift-2 invokes action 2 - the hotkey is defined as popup menu item hotkey" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combofield id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onDepartmentAction1}" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="Open the popup behind the combo-field and press the ctrl-shift-1/-2: the hotkeys are not processed. - By default hotkeys are only activated inside a dialog." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:combofield id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onDepartmentAction2}" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" text="Open the popup behind the combo-field and press the ctrl-shift-1/-2: the hotkeys are processed. So the hotkey definitions are &#34;visible&#34; also in the popup dialog. - Please check the Java code: a function setParentHotkeysActive(true) is valled with the dialog popup that is opened." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onHotkey2Action}" command="IA2" hotkey="ctrl-shift-50" text="Invoke action 2" />
</t:popupmenu>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}")

public class DemoHotkeyAndPopup
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoHotkeyAndPopup(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demohotkeyandpopup.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onDepartmentAction1(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = createValidValuesPopup();
    }

    public void onDepartmentAction2(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = createValidValuesPopup();
        idts.getPopup().setParentHotkeysActive(true);
    }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onHotkey1Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Action 1 triggered: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    public void onHotkey2Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Action 2 triggered: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private IdTextSelection createValidValuesPopup()
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        idts.addLine("SALES","Sales");
        idts.addLine("PRODUCTION","Production");
        idts.addLine("QA","Quality Assurance");
        idts.addLine("FINANCE","Finance & Controlling");
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            @Override
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_department = id;
            }
        });
        return idts;
    }

}

Test / Demo page for nesting popups

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1}" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:pane id="g_4" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@dialogBackground@&#39;]}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:pane id="g_25" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.onReopenModelessAction}" text="Open popup - modeless" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.onReopenModelessWithClickOutsideAction}" text="Open popup - modeless - close on click outside" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.onReopenModalAction}" text="Open popup - modal" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.onReopenModalWithClickOutsideAction}" text="Re-Open this popup - modal - close on click outside" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.onOpeneStatusbarPopup}" text="Output statusbar popup" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_2" labeltext="Page" text="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.pageName}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" labeltext="Class" text="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.class.name}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1}")

public class DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public interface IListener
    {
        public void reactOnClose();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    IListener m_listener;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1()
    {
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopuponcloseoutsidenestingpopup1.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }
    
    public void onReopenModalAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1 ui = new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModalPopup modalPopup = openModalPopup(ui,"Level 1",0,0,new IModalPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
    }
    
    public void onReopenModalWithClickOutsideAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1 ui = new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModalPopup modalPopup = openModalPopup(ui,"Level 1",0,0,new IModalPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        modalPopup.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }
    
    public void onReopenModelessWithClickOutsideAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1 ui = new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup modelessPopup = openModelessPopup(ui,"Level 1",0,0,new IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        modelessPopup.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
    }

    public void onReopenModelessAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1 ui = new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1();
        ui.prepare(new DemoPopupOncloseoutsideNestingPopup1.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnClose() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
        ModelessPopup modelessPopup = openModelessPopup(ui,"Level 1",0,0,new IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser() { closePopup(ui); }
        });
    }

    public void onOpeneStatusbarPopup(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessageWithPopup("Some message via status bar.");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

OK- / Yes-No popup with HTML text

By default the text that you pass into the OK- and YESNO-Popup is treated as plain text.

Use method setTextContentType(...) to indicate that the text that you pass is some formatted HTML text.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml.onOkPopupDefaultAction}" text="OK popup - Default" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml.onOkPopupHtmlAction}" text="OK popup - HTML" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml.onYesNoPopupDefaultAction}" text="Yes/No popup - Default" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml.onYesNoPopupHtmlAction}" text="Yes/No popup - HTML" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ICCServerConstants;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml}")

public class DemoDefaultPopupsHtml
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDefaultPopupsHtml(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodefaultpopupshtml.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDefaultPopupsHtml}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void onOkPopupHtmlAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String html = createHtmlText();
        OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Some html text",html);
        okp.setTextContentType(ICCServerConstants.TEXTPANE_CONTENTTYPE_HTML);
    }

    public void onOkPopupDefaultAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String html = createHtmlText();
        OKPopup.createInstance("Some html text",html);
    }

    public void onYesNoPopupHtmlAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String html = createHtmlText();
        YESNOPopup ynp = YESNOPopup.createInstance("Some HTML text",html,new IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("Yes! ...was pressed...");
            }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("No! ...was pressed...");
            }
        });
        ynp.setTextContentType(ICCServerConstants.TEXTPANE_CONTENTTYPE_HTML);
    }

    public void onYesNoPopupDefaultAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String html = createHtmlText();
        YESNOPopup.createInstance("Some HTML text",html,new IYesNoListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnYes()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("Yes! ...was pressed...");
            }
            @Override
            public void reactOnNo()
            {
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("No! ...was pressed...");
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private String createHtmlText()
    {
        String html = "Lorem ipsum dolor <span style='font-size:20px;font-weight:bold'>sit amet</span>, consetetur sadipscing elitr, "
            + "sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et "
            + "dolore magna aliquyam erat, <span style='font-size:20px;font-weight:bold'>sed diam voluptua</span>.";
        return html;
    }
}

Includes

Dynamic Page Includes

The demo shows an outer page showing some inner pages.

The component for including one page within another page is the ROWPAGEBEANINCLUDE component.

In the page the ROWPAGEBEANINCLUDE is bound to the "contentBean" property. This property either holds an instance of the "Mini Spreadsheet" page bean or of the "Budget" page bean.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoInclude}" >
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoInclude.onSetPageSpread}" text="Mini Spreadsheet" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoInclude.onSetPageBudget}" text="Budget Calculation" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:pane id="g_9" background="#C0C0C0" height="1" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="10" />
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_11" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoInclude.contentBean}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoInclude extends PageBean
{
    IPageBean m_contentBean = null;
    
    DemoMinispread m_miniSpread;
    DemoBudget m_budget;
    
    public DemoInclude(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_miniSpread = new DemoMinispread(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_budget = new DemoBudget(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_contentBean = m_miniSpread;
    }
    
    public IPageBean getContentBean() { return m_contentBean; }

    public void onSetPageSpread(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_contentBean = m_miniSpread;
    }
    
    public void onSetPageBudget(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_contentBean = m_budget;
    }
}

Simple page navigation

This example demonstrates a simple page navigation: when double-clicking into the list then the corresponding item is opened in a subsequent screen.

Internally there is...
(.) an outer page, including other pages by using ROWPAGEBANINCLUDE
(.) two inner pages, one for the list, the other for the detail screen

The navigation is done through the outer page.

The full sources of all 3 pages and beans classes are available within the /tomcat/webapps/demos folder:
(.) /workplace/demonaviouter.jsp and /workplacesrc/DemoNaviOuter.java
(.) /workplace/demonavilist.jsp and /workplacesrc/DemoNaviList.java
(.) /workplace/demonavidetail.jsp and /workplacesrc/DemoNaviDetail.java

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoNaviOuter}" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_2" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoNaviOuter.contentBean}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.DemoNaviList.Person;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoNaviOuter}")

public class DemoNaviOuter
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    IPageBean m_contentBean;
    
    DemoNaviList m_naviList;

    public DemoNaviOuter(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_naviList = new DemoNaviList(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_naviList.prepare(new DemoNaviList.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnSelection(Person p)
            {
                switchToPerson(p);
            }
        });
        m_contentBean = m_naviList;
    }

    public IPageBean getContentBean() { return m_contentBean; }
    
    public void switchToList() { m_contentBean = m_naviList; }
    
    public void switchToPerson(Person p)
    {
        DemoNaviDetail detail = new DemoNaviDetail(getOwningDispatcher());
        detail.prepare(new DemoNaviDetail.IListener()
                       {
                           public void reactOnBackToList()
                           {
                               switchToList();
                           }
                       },
                       p);
        m_contentBean = detail;
    }

}

/* Code of the popup page beans:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoNaviList}")

public class DemoNaviList
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public interface IListener
    {
        public void reactOnSelection(Person p);
    }
    
    public static class Person
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_town;
        public Person(String firstName, String lastName, String street, String town)
        {
            m_firstName = firstName;
            m_lastName = lastName;
            m_street = street;
            m_town = town;
        }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { m_firstName = firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { m_lastName = lastName; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setStreet(String street) { m_street = street; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
        public void setTown(String town) { m_town = town; }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Person m_p;
        public GridItem(Person p)
        {
            m_p = p;
        }
        public Person getP() { return m_p; }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            showPerson(m_p);
        }
    }
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    IListener m_listener;
    
    public DemoNaviList(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            Person p = new Person("FN " + i,"LN " + i,"STR " + i,"TWN " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(p));
        }
    }
    
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() {  return m_grid; }

    private void showPerson(Person p)
    {
        if (m_listener != null)
            m_listener.reactOnSelection(p);
    }
    
}


package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import workplace.DemoNaviList.Person;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoNaviDetail}")

public class DemoNaviDetail
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public interface IListener
    {
        public void reactOnBackToList();
    }
    
    Person m_person;
    IListener m_listener;
    
    public DemoNaviDetail(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public Person getPerson() { return m_person; }
    
    public void prepare(IListener listener, Person p)
    {
        m_person = p;
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    public void onBackToListAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_listener != null)
            m_listener.reactOnBackToList();
    }

}


 */

Page Beans

Example

This demo shows the usage of the Page Bean Modularization.

Each page implements two methods:
(.) getPageName - returns the page that is managed by this bean
(.) getRootExpressionUsedInPage - expression that is used within the jsp definition

By doing so, you can now integrated such "page beans" into other pages very simply, using component ROWPAGEBEANINCLUDE.

All the issues like rightsizing expressions that you normally, with ROWINCLUDE, have to explicitly manage on your own, are now managed automatically. Building scenarios, in which one page contains one or multiple other pages as result is now much simpler.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBean.onOpenVacationAddress}" text="Open Vacation Address - Usage in popup" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBean}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_6" text="#{d.DemoPageBean.firstName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_9" text="#{d.DemoPageBean.lastName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="First usage of page bean - as &#34;Business Address&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:pane id="g_24" border="#C0C0C0" width="100%" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_11" clientname="BUS" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPageBean.businessAddress}" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Second usage of page bean - as &#34;Home Address&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:pane id="g_21" border="#c0c0c0" width="100%" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_12" clientname="HOME" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPageBean.homeAddress}" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBean}")

public class DemoPageBean
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    protected String m_lastName;
    protected String m_firstName;
    
    DemoPageBeanAddress m_homeAddress = new DemoPageBeanAddress();
    DemoPageBeanAddress m_businessAddress = new DemoPageBeanAddress();
    DemoPageBeanAddress m_vacationAddress = new DemoPageBeanAddress();
    
    ModalPopup m_popup;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPageBean(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initPageBeans();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebean.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBean}"; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPageBeanAddress getHomeAddress() { return m_homeAddress; }
    public DemoPageBeanAddress getBusinessAddress() { return m_businessAddress; }
    
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    public void onOpenVacationAddress(ActionEvent event)
    {
        openModelessPopup(m_vacationAddress,"Vacation Address",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(m_vacationAddress);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void initPageBeans()
    {
        m_homeAddress.setTitle("Home Address");
        m_homeAddress.setStreet1("Home Street 1");
        m_homeAddress.setStreet2("Home Street 2");
        m_businessAddress.setTitle("Business Address");
        m_businessAddress.setStreet1("Business Street 1");
        m_businessAddress.setStreet2("Business Street 2");
        m_vacationAddress.setTitle("Vacation Address");
        m_vacationAddress.setStreet1("Vacation Street 1");
        m_vacationAddress.setStreet2("Vacation Street 2");
    }
    
}

Navigation

This example demonstrates how to switch from one page to the next by using page beans.

There is an outside page - with an embedded inside page. Dependent on pressing the buttons the inside page is updated with the corresponding page bean instance on server side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_4" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside.currentStep}" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside.onPrevious}" enabled="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside.previousEnabled}" text="Previous Page" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside.onNext}" enabled="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside.nextEnabled}" text="Next Page" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside}")

public class DemoPageBeanNavOutside
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    int m_currentStepIndex = 0;
    List<IPageBean> m_steps = new ArrayList<IPageBean>();
    
    public DemoPageBeanNavOutside(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_steps.add(new DemoPageBeanNavStep1());
        m_steps.add(new DemoPageBeanNavStep2());
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebeannavoutside.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBeanNavOutside}"; }
    
    public IPageBean getCurrentStep() { return m_steps.get(m_currentStepIndex); }

    public boolean isPreviousEnabled() { return m_currentStepIndex > 0 ? true: false; }
    public boolean isNextEnabled() { return m_currentStepIndex < (m_steps.size()-1) ? true: false; }
    
    public void onPrevious(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_currentStepIndex > 0)
            m_currentStepIndex--;
    }
    
    public void onNext(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_currentStepIndex < (m_steps.size()-1))
            m_currentStepIndex++;
    }

}

Opening Dialogs

This demo shows how to open dialogs (in this case: modal dialogs) when using page beans.

The procedure is very simple: the bean to be opened is built up and passed into the openModalPopup-method.

It is VERY IMPORTANT to properly implement the listener, that is called when the dialog is closed by the user!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupCaller}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupCaller.onOpenPageBeanInPopup}" text="Open Page Bean in Popup" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupCaller}")

public class DemoPageBeanPopupCaller
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoPageBeanPopupCaller(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebeanpopupcaller.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupCaller}"; }
    
    public void onOpenPageBeanInPopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // create page to be opened in popup
        final DemoPageBeanAddress address = new DemoPageBeanAddress();
        address.setTitle("nice title");
        address.setStreet1("nice street 1");
        address.setStreet2("nice street 2");
        // open popup (width & height are set to 0, so that popup is sized
        // by its content
        final ModalPopup mp = openModalPopup(address,"Title of popup",0,0,null);
        mp.setPopupListener(new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            // This method is called when the user explicitly
            // closes the popup by alt-F4 or by clicking
