            // onto the right-top close-icon
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                mp.close();
                Statusbar.outputMessage("Modal popup was closed!");
            }
        });
    }

}

Closing Dialogs

This demo shows the basic code to open - and to close a popup.

In principal it is very simple: a page bean is opened as popup, there is a corresponding openModalPopup-method and a closePopup-method. So it's just an issue to call these methods the right point of time.

The pattern used here is some kind of event-pattern. The page bean that is called as popup sends an event via its IListener-interface that something happened in the bean. In the example the page bean sends an event if the user pressed the Close-button. The calling bean registers for the event and closes the popup.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Press the button to open the popup." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing.onOpenPopupAction}" text="Open popup" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing}")

public class DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebeanpopupopeningclosing.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosing}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOpenPopupAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosingPopup popupUI = new DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosingPopup();
        openModalPopup(popupUI,"A nice popup",0,0,new ModalPopup.IModalPopupListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
            {
                closePopup(popupUI);
            }
        });
        popupUI.prepare(new DemoPageBeanPopupOpeningClosingPopup.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnClosed()
            {
                closePopup(popupUI);
            }
        });
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Java API between Page Beans

Press "Select..." to open a dialog popup

This example shows a typical Java API between an outside page bean and inside page bean that is called as popup dialog.

The inside page bean is created and configured through a prepare-method.

Inner events of the inside page bean's processing are passed to the outside bean using an IListener call-back interface.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:box id="g_4" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Department" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_7" placeholder="Department Id" text="#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside.department}" width="200" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="20" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside.onDepartmentSelectAction}" text="Select..." />
</t:row>
</t:box>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside}")

public class DemoPageBeanOutside
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPageBeanOutside(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebeanoutside.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBeanOutside}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onDepartmentSelectAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final DemoPagebeanObjectSelection os = new DemoPagebeanObjectSelection();
        String[] ids = new String[] {"0001","0002","0003"};
        String[] texts = new String[] {"Sales","Production","Management"};
        os.prepare(ids,texts,new DemoPagebeanObjectSelection.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnSelection(String id)
            {
                m_department = id;
                closePopup(os);
            }
            @Override
            public void reactOnCancel()
            {
                closePopup(os);
            }
        });
        openModalPopup(os,"Department selection",400,600,
                       new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,os));
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Page Beans opening up content areas

This is an example for a page bean that internally opens up some area in which the dialog can place own content:

The scale management is taken over by the page bean - and the content of the scale area is directly defined in the page.

Take a look into the page bean definition (/workplace/demopbwithexit.jsp): a PARENTEXIT component is used to indicate the place in which parent content is added.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser}" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_3" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser.content}" shownullcontent="true" >
<t:contentpane id="g_4" exitid="HEADER" padding="0" >
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="5" >
<t:menubar id="g_6" >
<t:menu id="g_7" text="File" >
<t:menuitem id="g_8" text="Open..." />
<t:menuitem id="g_9" text="Save" />
</t:menu>
<t:menu id="g_10" text="Edit" >
<t:menuitem id="g_11" text="Undo" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
<t:button id="g_12" text="Save" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_13" text="Open..." width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:contentpane>
<t:contentpane id="g_14" exitid="BODY" padding="0" >
<t:rowheader id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser.onAction}" text="Update names" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_18" text="Inner pane" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:field id="g_20" labeltext="Vorname" text="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:field id="g_22" labeltext="Nachname" text="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:contentpane>
</t:rowpagebeaninclude>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser}")

public class DemoPBWithExitUser
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DemoPBWithExit m_content = new DemoPBWithExit();
    String m_lastName = "Casa";
    String m_firstName = "Captain";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBWithExitUser(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbwithexituser.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBWithExitUser}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_lastName += "?";
        m_firstName += "?";
    }

    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { this.m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { this.m_firstName = value; }

    public DemoPBWithExit getContent() { return m_content; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Starting Page Bean in Wokrplace
Page Bean Component

This demo shows the usage of a page bean component.

A page bean component is a special form of a page bean. All information that is required by the page bean at runtime is contained in the JAR file of the bean - there are no dependencies to other resource (e.g. JSP-files).

A page bean can be configured by defining its class name and by defining the initialization parameters.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanComponent}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_3" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPageBeanComponent.multiText}" pagebeanclass="democontrols.DemoPBCMultiText" pagebeaninitdata="height:300;width:300" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.pagebeancomponents.ComplexValueEditor;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import democontrols.DemoPBCMultiText;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPageBeanComponent}")

public class DemoPageBeanComponent
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DemoPBCMultiText m_multiText = new DemoPBCMultiText();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPageBeanComponent(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        List<String> texts = new ArrayList<String>();
        texts.add("This is some existing text which is already avaiable.");
        m_multiText.prepare(texts,new DemoPBCMultiText.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnUpdate()
            {
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopagebeancomponent.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPageBeanComponent}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCMultiText getMultiText() { return m_multiText; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Master-Detail Navigation

This demo demonstrates a master-detail scenario.

When CLICKING an item on the left then a corresponding detail screen is shown on the right. The detail screen is in display mode.

When DOUBLE-CLICKING an item on the left then the detail screen is shown in edit mode. The user may change the data. While editing the grid-navigation on the left is blocked so that there is no confusion between editing on the right and navigation on the left. After pressing OK/Cancel the right detail screen is brought back to display mode - and the blocking on the left side is released.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMaster}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" border="#f0f0f0" dividerlocation="350" height="100%" orientation="horizontal" width="100%;700" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:paintarea id="g_6" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:paintareaitem id="g_7" bounds="0;0;100%;100%;1" movetofrontonmouseover="false" >
<t:blockablearea id="g_8" blocked="#{d.DemoMaster.justEditingDetail}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_9" border="0" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMaster.grid}" sbvisibleamount="40" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Last name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{employee.lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_12" text="First name" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_13" text=".{employee.firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="Birth date" width="100%;80" >
<t:label id="g_15" format="date" formatmask="short" text=".{employee.birthDate}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Perm." width="50" >
<t:checkbox id="g_17" enabled="false" selected=".{permanent}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:blockablearea>
</t:paintareaitem>
<t:paintareaitem id="g_18" bounds="50%;50%;200;100;6" boundsanchor="centermiddle" movetofrontonmouseover="false" rendered="#{d.DemoMaster.justEditingDetail}" >
<t:textpane id="g_19" align="center" background="#FFFFC0E8" border="#c0c0c0" height="100%" text="Editing detail..." valign="middle" width="100%" />
</t:paintareaitem>
</t:paintarea>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_20" >
<t:captureanimator id="g_23" animationtype="fogdark" trigger="#{d.DemoMaster.animationTrigger}" />
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_21" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoMaster.detailUI}" />
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import workplace.DemoMasterLogic.Employee;
import workplace.DemoMasterLogic.PermanentEmployee;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMaster}")

public class DemoMaster
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Employee i_employee;
        public GridItem(Employee employee)
        {
            i_employee = employee;
        }
        public boolean isPermanent() { return i_employee.getClass() == PermanentEmployee.class; }
        public Employee getEmployee() { return i_employee; }
        // single click / cursor selection
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            showEmployee(this,i_employee,false);
        }
        // double click / return selection
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            showEmployee(this,i_employee,true);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    IPageBean m_detailUI;
    boolean m_justEditingDetail = false;
    Trigger m_animationTrigger = new Trigger();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMaster(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        List<Employee> employees = DemoMasterLogic.findAllEmployees();
        for (Employee employee: employees)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem(employee);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomaster.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMaster}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public IPageBean getDetailUI() { return m_detailUI; }
    public boolean isJustEditingDetail() { return m_justEditingDetail; }
    public Trigger getAnimationTrigger() { return m_animationTrigger; }

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void showEmployee(final GridItem gridItem, Employee employee, final boolean editMode)
    {
        // in case of editing: create a clone so that the user does not work
        // on the original object
        if (editMode == true)
        {
            employee = employee.createClone();
            m_justEditingDetail = true;
        }
        final Employee detailEmployee = employee;
        // open up the right detail screen
        final DemoMasterDetailEmployee ui = createUIForEmplyoee(employee);
        ui.prepare(detailEmployee, editMode, new DemoMasterDetailEmployee.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnSave()
            {
                // take over cloned instance into grid
                gridItem.i_employee = detailEmployee;
                ui.setEditMode(false);
                m_justEditingDetail = false;
            }
            public void reactOnCancel()
            {
                // put the original instance of the grid item into the detail
                ui.setEmployee(gridItem.i_employee);
                ui.setEditMode(false);
                m_justEditingDetail = false;
            }
        });
        m_detailUI = ui;
        m_animationTrigger.trigger();
    }
    
    private DemoMasterDetailEmployee createUIForEmplyoee(Employee employee)
    {
        if (employee instanceof PermanentEmployee)
            return new DemoMasterDetailPermanentEmployee();
        else
            return new DemoMasterDetailWorkingStudent();
    }
    
}

Blockable Area

Basics

The BLOCKABLEAREA is a container component in which you can arrange exactly one other component as content.

When setting the attribute BLOCKED of the component to value "false" then the content of the BLOCKABLEAREA is completely blocked for user interaction. In addition some shading is arranged in front of the content so that the user receives some visual feed back.

BLOCKABLEAREA components can be nested.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockableArea}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Outer block" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.onBlockAction}" text="Block / unblock" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="50" />
<t:checkbox id="g_6" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.blocked}" text="Blocked" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Inner block" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.onInnerBlockAction}" text="Block / unblock" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="50" />
<t:checkbox id="g_11" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.blockedInner}" text="Blocked" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:blockablearea id="g_13" blocked="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.blocked}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_14" enabled="false" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Outer block" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_17" text="Some field" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_20" text="Some field" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_23" text="Some field" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:coldistance id="g_25" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_26" text="Some button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:blockablearea id="g_28" blocked="#{d.DemoBlockableArea.blockedInner}" >
<t:pane id="g_29" border="#c0c0c0" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Inner block" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_34" text="Some field" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_37" text="Some field" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:blockablearea>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:blockablearea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBlockableArea}")

public class DemoBlockableArea
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    boolean m_blocked = false;
    boolean m_blockedInner;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBlockableArea(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoblockablearea.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBlockableArea}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public boolean getBlocked() { return m_blocked; }
    public void setBlocked(boolean value) { this.m_blocked = value; }

    public boolean getBlockedInner() { return m_blockedInner; }
    public void setBlockedInner(boolean value) { this.m_blockedInner = value; }

    public void onBlockAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_blocked = !m_blocked;
    }
    
    public void onInnerBlockAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_blockedInner = !m_blockedInner;
    }

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Use case: Grid with Detail Area

This example shows a typical usage scenario for the BLOCKABLEAREA: when the user selects an item in the grid then the item is opened for editing. While editing, the area around the grid is blocked so that the user first must finish editing the item.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Double click an item of the grid for editing." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="20" >
<t:blockablearea id="g_5" blocked="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.boolGridBlocked}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_6" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_8" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Number" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_10" text=".{article.number}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Text" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{article.text}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="UoM" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{article.baseUnitOfMeasure}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onCreateNewArticle}" text="Create new article" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:blockablearea>
<t:pane id="g_17" rendered="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.boolDetailAvailable}" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Number" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_20" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.number}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_23" height="100" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.text}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Unit of Measure" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_26" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.baseUnitOfMeasure}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:coldistance id="g_28" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onDetailOKAction}" text="OK" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_30" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onDetailCancelAction}" text="Cancel" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid2}")

public class DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Article implements Cloneable
    {
        String i_number;
        String i_text;
        String i_baseUnitOfMeasure;
        public String getNumber() { return i_number; }
        public void setNumber(String number) { i_number = number; }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; }
        public String getBaseUnitOfMeasure() { return i_baseUnitOfMeasure; }
        public void setBaseUnitOfMeasure(String baseUnitOfMeasure) { i_baseUnitOfMeasure = baseUnitOfMeasure; }
        @Override
        protected Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException { return super.clone(); }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Article i_article;
        public GridItem(Article article)
        {
            i_article = article;
        }
        public Article getArticle() { return i_article; }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            try
            {
                m_selectedArticle = (Article)i_article.clone();
                m_selectedArticleIsNew = false;
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                throw new Error(t);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    Article m_selectedArticle;
    boolean m_selectedArticleIsNew;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            Article a = new Article();
            a.setText("Article " + i);
            a.setNumber("53000"+i);
            a.setBaseUnitOfMeasure("kg");
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(a));
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoblockableareawithgrid2.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid2}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public Article getSelectedArticle() { return m_selectedArticle; }
    public boolean getBoolDetailAvailable() { return m_selectedArticle != null; }
    public boolean getBoolGridBlocked() { return getBoolDetailAvailable(); }

    public void onDetailCancelAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_selectedArticle = null;
    }

    public void onDetailOKAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_selectedArticleIsNew == false)
        {
            m_grid.getSelectedItem().i_article = m_selectedArticle;
        }
        else
        {   
            m_grid.getItems().add(0,new GridItem(m_selectedArticle));
        }
        m_selectedArticle = null;
    }

    public void onCreateNewArticle(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_selectedArticle = new Article();
        m_selectedArticleIsNew = true;
    }
}

Use case: Grid with Detail "Popup"

This example shows a typical usage scenario for the BLOCKABLEAREA: when the user selects an item in the grid then the item is opened for editing. While editing, the area around the grid is blocked so that the user first must finish editing the item.

In this example the dialog is internally layered using the PAINTAREA component: in this component there is the base layer covering the whole area and there is the detail layer serving as "pseudo-popup-dialog". The detail layer has a higher z-index than the base layer, so it is displayed on top if rendered.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid2}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Double click an item of the grid for editing." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:paintarea id="g_5" height="100%;400" width="100%;500" >
<t:paintareaitem id="g_6" bounds="0;0;100%;100%;5" movetofrontonmouseover="false" >
<t:blockablearea id="g_7" blocked="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.boolGridBlocked}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_8" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_10" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.grid}" sbvisibleamount="30" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Number" width="80" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{article.number}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_13" text="Text" width="100%;100" >
<t:label id="g_14" text=".{article.text}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="UoM" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_16" text=".{article.baseUnitOfMeasure}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onCreateNewArticle}" text="Create new article" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:blockablearea>
</t:paintareaitem>
<t:paintareaitem id="g_19" background="#FFFFFF" bounds="50%;50%;400;300;6" boundsanchor="centermiddle" movetofrontonmouseover="false" rendered="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.boolDetailAvailable}" >
<t:pane id="g_20" >
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_21" text="Article Detail" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:pane id="g_23" border="#c0c0c0" height="100%" padding="10" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Number" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_26" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.number}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_29" height="100%;100" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.text}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Unit of Measure" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_32" text="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.selectedArticle.baseUnitOfMeasure}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:coldistance id="g_34" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onDetailOKAction}" text="OK" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_36" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_37" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid.onDetailCancelAction}" text="Cancel" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:paintareaitem>
</t:paintarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid}")

public class DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Article implements Cloneable
    {
        String i_number;
        String i_text;
        String i_baseUnitOfMeasure;
        public String getNumber() { return i_number; }
        public void setNumber(String number) { i_number = number; }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; }
        public String getBaseUnitOfMeasure() { return i_baseUnitOfMeasure; }
        public void setBaseUnitOfMeasure(String baseUnitOfMeasure) { i_baseUnitOfMeasure = baseUnitOfMeasure; }
        @Override
        protected Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException { return super.clone(); }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Article i_article;
        public GridItem(Article article)
        {
            i_article = article;
        }
        public Article getArticle() { return i_article; }
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            try
            {
                m_selectedArticle = (Article)i_article.clone();
                m_selectedArticleIsNew = false;
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                throw new Error(t);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    Article m_selectedArticle;
    boolean m_selectedArticleIsNew;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            Article a = new Article();
            a.setText("Article " + i);
            a.setNumber("53000"+i);
            a.setBaseUnitOfMeasure("kg");
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(a));
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoblockableareawithgrid.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBlockableAreaWithGrid}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public Article getSelectedArticle() { return m_selectedArticle; }
    public boolean getBoolDetailAvailable() { return m_selectedArticle != null; }
    public boolean getBoolGridBlocked() { return getBoolDetailAvailable(); }

    public void onDetailCancelAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_selectedArticle = null;
    }

    public void onDetailOKAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_selectedArticleIsNew == false)
        {
            m_grid.getSelectedItem().i_article = m_selectedArticle;
        }
        else
        {   
            m_grid.getItems().add(0,new GridItem(m_selectedArticle));
        }
        m_selectedArticle = null;
    }

    public void onCreateNewArticle(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_selectedArticle = new Article();
        m_selectedArticleIsNew = true;
    }
}

Dynamic Layout

Direct XML Integration

Press the Flip-Button - the layout below will change accordingly.

The most simple and efficient way to embed dynamic content is to use the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component. The component binds to a server side property in which you pass the layout to be rendered.

There are two ways of passing the layout: either you pass the layout as XML string or you pass it as a tree of ComponentNode-objects that are assembled in a very simple way.

We strongly recommend to use the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component for all types of dynamic content because it is more abstracted way to deal with the JSF component tree. Within the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT usage, we recommnd to use the ComponentNode tree version of specifying the dynamic content.

If using the XML string version then please pay great attention to form a proper XML string - e.g. the attribute values must not contain any reserved characters as "<", ">", etc.!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent}" popupmenu="FLIP" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_4" text="Change Content" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.onFlip}" hotkey="119" text="Flip" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_7" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_9" contentbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.content}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="FLIP" >
<t:menuitem id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.onFlip}" command="Flip" hotkey="118" text="Flip" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent}")

public class DemoRowDynamicContent
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_content = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    String m_firstName = "First";
    String m_lastName = "Last";
    
    boolean m_toggle = false;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRowDynamicContent(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        renderDynamically();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return m_content; }
    
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    
    public void onOK(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_firstName = m_firstName + " OK";
        m_lastName = m_lastName + " OK";
    }
    
    public void onFlip(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_toggle = !m_toggle;
        renderDynamically();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderDynamically()
    {
        if (m_toggle)
        {
            // dynamic content via object tree
            PANENode pane = new PANENode();
            pane.setRowdistance("5");
            {
                ROWNode row = new ROWNode();
                pane.addSubNode(row);
                {
                    LABELNode label = new LABELNode();
                    row.addSubNode(label);
                    label.setText("<html><b><font color='#800000'>First</font></b> Name</html>");
                    label.setWidth("120");
                    FIELDNode field = new FIELDNode();
                    row.addSubNode(field);
                    field.setText("#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.firstName}");
                    field.setWidth("120");
                }
            }
            {
                ROWNode row = new ROWNode();
                pane.addSubNode(row);
                {
                    LABELNode label = new LABELNode();
                    row.addSubNode(label);
                    label.setText("Last Name");
                    label.setWidth("120");
                    FIELDNode field = new FIELDNode();
                    row.addSubNode(field);
                    field.setText("#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.lastName}");
                    field.setWidth("120");
                }
            }
            {
                ROWNode row = new ROWNode();
                pane.addSubNode(row);
                {
                    COLDISTANCENode distance = new COLDISTANCENode();
                    row.addSubNode(distance);
                    distance.setWidth("120");
                    BUTTONNode button = new BUTTONNode();
                    row.addSubNode(button);
                    button.setText("OK");
                    button.setActionListener("#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.onOK}");
                }
            }
            m_content.setContentNode(pane);
        }
        else
        {
            // dynamic content via XML
            m_content.setContentXml
            (
                "<t:pane rowdistance='5'>" +
                "<t:row>" +
                "<t:label text='First/Last Name' width='120'/>" +
                "<t:field text='#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.firstName}' width='120'/>" +
                "<t:field text='#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.lastName}' width='120'/>" +
                "</t:row>" +
                "<t:row>" +
                "<t:coldistance width='120'/>" +
                "<t:button text='OK' actionListener='#{d.DemoRowDynamicContent.onOK}'/>" +
                "</t:row>" +
                "</t:pane>"
            );
        }
    }
}

Direct binding of objects

Hello world - with expressions

The "Hello-world" demo in this example is using the set* method for the dynamic attributes - passing an expression that is bound to the component attribute.

This is the "traditional" method of defining attributes with dynamic content - and the one that is a 1:1 representation of definitions that you normally do within the static layout definition.

Please note: the pbx() method is a convenience method for creating an expression out of the argument that you pass.
Calling "pbx("name")" will internally create the expression "#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr.name}".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr}" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_2" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr.dynamicContent}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FOLDABLEPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr}")

public class DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynamicContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    String m_name;
    String m_result;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);       
        renderContent();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodynamiccontentbindingexpr.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingExpr}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynamicContent() { return m_dynamicContent; }

    public String getName() { return m_name; } 
    public void setName(String name) { m_name = name; }

    public String getResult() { return m_result; }
    
    public void onHelloAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (m_name == null)
            m_result = "No name defined.";
        else
            m_result = "Hello world, " + m_name;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderContent()
    {
        FOLDABLEPANENode p = new FOLDABLEPANENode()
                .setText("Hello world - Value/action binding by expressions")
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setRowdistance(10);
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            FIELDNode fn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setWidth(300)
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .setText(pbx("name")); // expression
            r.addSubNode(fn);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            BUTTONNode bu = new BUTTONNode()
                    .setText("Say hello!")
                    .setWidth("200")
                    .setActionListener(pbx("onHelloAction")); // expression
            r.addSubNode(bu);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .setText(pbx("result")); // expression
            r.addSubNode(l);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }    
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
}

Hello world - with inner classes

The complete content of the dialog is rendered dynamically - by using component ROWDYNAMICCONTENT.

On server side the dynamic attributes of the field and the action listener of the button are implemented using the bind-methods that are available for each component attribute.

Here you can directly pass an implementation of interface IValueDelegation - best by sub-classing from one of the *Delegation classes of package "org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl".

So you see: for dynamic content you either can use the set* methods in order to pass fix values or expression values. Or you can use the bind* method to directly implement dynamic attributes.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbinding}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbinding}" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_2" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbinding.dynamicContent}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FOLDABLEPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.StringDelegation;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbinding}")

public class DemoDynamicContentbinding
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynamicContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    String m_name;
    String m_result;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDynamicContentbinding(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        renderContent();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodynamiccontentbinding.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDynamicContentbinding}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynamicContent() { return m_dynamicContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderContent()
    {
        FOLDABLEPANENode p = new FOLDABLEPANENode()
                .setText("Hello world - Value/action binding by inner classes")
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setRowdistance(10);
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            FIELDNode fn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setWidth(300)
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .bindText(new StringDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public String getValue()
                        {
                            return m_name;
                        }
                        @Override
                        public void setValue(String value)
                        {
                            m_name = value;
                        }
                    });
            r.addSubNode(fn);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            BUTTONNode bu = new BUTTONNode()
                    .setText("Say hello!")
                    .setWidth("200")
                    .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                        {
                            if (m_name == null)
                                m_result = "No name defined.";
                            else
                                m_result = "Hello world, " + m_name;
                        }
                    });
            r.addSubNode(bu);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .bindText(new StringDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public String getValue()
                        {
                            return m_result;
                        }
                    });
            r.addSubNode(l);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }    
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }

}

Hello world - with lambdas

Again the dynamically created Hello-World-dialog - this time implementing the dynamic attributes using lambdas.

For each type of attribute there is a corresponding "lambda-aware" delegation class: StringDelegationLambda, FloatDelegationLambda, DoubleDelgationLambda etc.

When creating instance you have to pass one lambda implementation for the get-implementation of the attribute - and you may pass a second one for the set-implementation, if required by the component.

For the implementation of the action-listener you can directly use a lambda-implementation of IActionListenerDelegation.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingLambda}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingLambda}" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_2" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicContentbindingLambda.dynamicContent}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

    package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FOLDABLEPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.StringDelegationLambda;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicContentBindingLambda}")

public class DemoDynamicContentbindingLambda
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynamicContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    String m_name;
    String m_result;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDynamicContentbindingLambda(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);   
        renderContent();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodynamiccontentbindinglambda.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDynamicContentBindingLambda}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynamicContent() { return m_dynamicContent; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderContent()
    {
        FOLDABLEPANENode p = new FOLDABLEPANENode()
                .setText("Hello world - Value/action binding by lambdas")
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setRowdistance(10);
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            FIELDNode fn = new FIELDNode()
                    .setWidth(300)
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .bindText(new StringDelegationLambda
                     (
                         () -> {return m_name;},
                         (value) -> {m_name = value;}
                     ));
            r.addSubNode(fn);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            BUTTONNode bu = new BUTTONNode()
                    .setText("Say hello!")
                    .setWidth("200")
                    .bindActionListener((event) -> 
                        {
                            if (m_name == null)
                                m_result = "No name defined.";
                            else
                                m_result = "Hello world, " + m_name;
                        }
                    );
            r.addSubNode(bu);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }        
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
            LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .bindText(new StringDelegationLambda(() -> {return m_result;}));
            r.addSubNode(l);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("100%"));
        }    
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
}

Directly binding a grid

The Java implementation is the interesting part of this demo - the whole layout is created dynamically.

"Normally" you are used to using node-components just as direct representation of the corresponding component instances, that you normally define within the XML layout definition. This means you either set a fix value or you a bind a value by assigning an expression.

"Now" you see that you can directly bind objects and processing to the component node by using corresponding "bind" methods. When doing so then the expression for accessing the corresponding object is managed internally.

This simplifies the creation of dynamic scenarios significantly because you do not have to think about how to calculate expressions anymore.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentBinding}" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_2" contentbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentBinding.dynContent}" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.BooleanDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.BooleanValue;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentBinding}")

public class DemoRowDynamicContentBinding
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // entity object - could be any pojo object
    public static class TestPerson
    {
        String m_id = UniqueIdCreator.createUUID();
        String m_firstName = "not set";
        String m_lastName = "not set";
        String m_town = "not set";
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_id = id; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String firstName) { m_firstName = firstName; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String lastName) { m_lastName = lastName; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
        public void setTown(String town) { m_town = town; }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        Object i_instance;
        public GridItem(Object instance)
        {
            i_instance = instance;
        }
        public Object getInstance() { return i_instance; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    String[] m_propertySequence;
    Class m_class;
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRowDynamicContentBinding(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        prepare(TestPerson.class, new String[] {"id","firstName","lastName","town"});
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorowdynamiccontentbinding.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentBinding}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void prepare(Class<TestPerson> clazz, String[] propertySequence)
    {
        m_class = clazz;
        m_propertySequence = propertySequence;
        render();
    }

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void render()
    {
        // outest pane
        PANENode outestPane = new PANENode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setRowdistance(5);
        // grid
        {
            m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(); // create the object which is bound
            ROWNode pr = new ROWNode();
            outestPane.addSubNode(pr);
            FIXGRIDNode fg = new FIXGRIDNode()
                    .bindObjectbinding(m_grid) // <== assigns the value AND automatically binds it via expression
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setSbvisibleamount(10);
            pr.addSubNode(fg);
            for (String property: m_propertySequence)
            {
                GRIDCOLNode gc = new GRIDCOLNode()
                        .setText(property)
                        .setWidth("100%;100");
                fg.addSubNode(gc);
                FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode()
                        .setText(".{instance."+property+"}"); // <== normal binding to expression
                gc.addSubNode(f);
            }
        }
        // buttons
        {
            ROWNode buttonRow = new ROWNode()
                    .setColdistance(5);
            outestPane.addSubNode(buttonRow);
            {
                BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode()
                        .setText("Create new item")
                        .setWidth("100+")
                        .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                        {
                            @Override
                            public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                            {
                                createNewItem();
                            }
                        });
                buttonRow.addSubNode(b);
            }
            {
                BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode()
                        .setText("Remove selected item")
                        .setWidth("100+")
                        .bindEnabled(new BooleanDelegation()
                        {
                            @Override
                            public void setValue(Boolean value) {}
                            @Override
                            public Boolean getValue()
                            {
                                return m_grid.getSelectedItem() != null;
                            }
                        })
                        .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                        {
                            @Override
                            public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                            {
                                removeSelectedItem();
                            }
                        });
                buttonRow.addSubNode(b);
            }
            {
                ROWDISTANCENode rd = new ROWDISTANCENode()
                        .setHeight(20);
                outestPane.addSubNode(rd);
            }
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNode(outestPane);
    }
    
    private void createNewItem()
    {
        try
        {
            Object o = m_class.newInstance();
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem(o));
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    private void removeSelectedItem()
    {
        GridItem selItem = m_grid.getSelectedItem();
        if (selItem != null)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(selItem);
        }
    }
}

Dynamic Form

This example shows how ROWDYNAMICCONTENT is combined with dynamic data in order to render a form.

Please note: in the example the XML is built directly - which may be quite dangerous: you must pay attention to "special characters" like "<" and ">" within the attribute values! - You may prefer to use the ComponentNode variant of building dynamic content, which unburdens you from directly creating XML.

...in the example there is also a certain animation. This is just a "show-effect" and does not have anything to do with the form processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicForm}" rowdistance="3" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="110" />
<t:textarea id="g_4" height="60" text="#{d.DemoDynamicForm.newComment}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="20" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="110" />
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicForm.onAddComment}" text="Add" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_10" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:pane id="g_14" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:captureanimator id="g_15" animationtype="hidetobottom" trigger="#{d.DemoDynamicForm.animationTrigger}" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_17" height="100%" padding="right:20" width="100%" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_18" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicForm.content}" />
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.TimeZone;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FOLDABLEPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWLINENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.TEXTPANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.DateDelegation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.impl.StringDelegation;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicForm}")

public class DemoDynamicForm
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class ItemInfo implements Serializable
    {
        Date i_date;
        String i_comment;
        public Date getDate()
        {
            return i_date;
        }
        public void setDate(Date date)
        {
            i_date = date;
        }
        public String getComment()
        {
            return i_comment;
        }
        public void setComment(String comment)
        {
            i_comment = comment;
        }
        public void remove()
        {
            m_items.remove(this);
            renderItems();
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_content = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    List<ItemInfo> m_items = new ArrayList<ItemInfo>();
    
    protected String m_newComment = "<new comment>";
    Trigger m_animationTrigger = new Trigger();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDynamicForm(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // create some items
        {
            Date d = new Date((new Date()).getTime() - 3*24*3600000); // three days ago
            ItemInfo ii = new ItemInfo();
            ii.i_date = d;
            ii.i_comment = "Captured data is associated with a user through a combination of workstation and workspace ids that are automatically generated by the collector. This identification is not tied to any personal information about the user.";
            m_items.add(0,ii);
        }
        {
            Date d = new Date((new Date()).getTime() - 3*24*3600000); // three days ago
            ItemInfo ii = new ItemInfo();
            ii.i_date = d;
