            ii.i_comment = "Subversive is a totally new Eclipse plug-in, that provides you a probability to use supported SVN clients easily directly from your workbench. Friendly user interface of Subversive makes it much more comfortable to operate repositories.";
            m_items.add(0,ii);
        }
        {
            Date d = new Date((new Date()).getTime() - 1*24*3600000); // one day ago
            ItemInfo ii = new ItemInfo();
            ii.i_date = d;
            ii.i_comment = "In order to work with SVN the plug-in user should also install one of SVN connectors.";
            m_items.add(0,ii);
        }
        renderItems();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return m_content; }
    public List<ItemInfo> getItems() { return m_items; }
    
    public void onAddComment(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        ItemInfo ii = new ItemInfo();
        ii.setDate(new Date());
        ii.setComment(m_newComment);
        m_items.add(0,ii);
        renderItems();
    }

    public String getNewComment() { return m_newComment; }
    public void setNewComment(String value) { m_newComment = value; }

    public Trigger getAnimationTrigger() { return m_animationTrigger; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderItems()
    {
        PANENode outestPane = new PANENode()
                .setWidth("100%")
                .setRowdistance(8);
        String currentDateString = "inittini";
        int counter = 0;
        FOLDABLEPANENode currentFoldable = null;
        for (final ItemInfo ii: m_items)
        {
            String dateString = buildDateString(ii.i_date);
            if (dateString.equals(currentDateString) == false)
            {
                currentDateString = dateString;
                ROWNode fr = new ROWNode();
                outestPane.addSubNode(fr);
                currentFoldable = new FOLDABLEPANENode()
                        .setWidth("100%")
                        .setText(dateString)
                        .setRowdistance(3);
                fr.addSubNode(currentFoldable);
            }
            else
            {
                ROWLINENode rowline = new ROWLINENode()
                        .setBackground("#00000010");
                currentFoldable.addSubNode(rowline);
            }
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            currentFoldable.addSubNode(r);
            LABELNode l = new LABELNode()
                    .setText(""+ii.getDate().getTime())
                    .setWidth(100)
                    .setFormat("time")
                    .setTimezone(TimeZone.getDefault().getID())
                    .setRowalignmenty("top");
            r.addSubNode(l);
            TEXTPANENode tp = new TEXTPANENode()
                    .setKeepcaret(true)
                    .setText(ii.getComment())
                    .setWidth("100%");
            r.addSubNode(tp);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth(10));
            BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode()
                    .setText("Remove")
                    .setWidth(80)
                    .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                        {
                            ii.remove();
                        }
                    })
                    .setRowalignmenty("top");
            r.addSubNode(b);
            counter++;
        }
        m_content.setContentNode(outestPane);
        m_animationTrigger.trigger();
    }
    
    private String buildDateString(Date date)
    {
        return DateFormat.getDateInstance().format(date);
    }
    
}

Individual Grid Column Layout

This grid may look a bit confusing... - but this is by intention! You see that there are two types of grid rows combined within one grid - the one with 4 fields, the other one with 2 fields.

Actually, if you have a look inside, then each grid row is a wide column pane, in which the content is rendered dynamically. The dynamic rendering is done using the ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component. This is the easiest and recommended way to do dynamic rendering. (You also can directly manipulate the JSF component tree, there are also some examples within this demo workplace, but especially in case of a grid rendering this is quite complex).

When looking inside the server side code, then you see that each grid item knows itself how it is rendered by just defining the corresponding XML definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_01" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic.grid}" rowheight="27" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" width="30" >
<t:gridrowselector id="g_5" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_7" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_8" contentbinding=".{content}" />
</t:pane>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridRowDynamic}")

/**
 * In this example there are two types of grid lines: persons and cars. Each 
 * item specifies its dynamic content rendering by returning the corresponding
 * content, that is defined statically.
 * <br><br>
 * In more complex scenarios you can, of course, build up an individual content
 * binding instance per line.
 */
public class DemoGridRowDynamic 
    extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public abstract class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public abstract ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent();
        public void onRemove(ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
        }
    }
    
    public class PersonGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_firstName;
        String m_lastName;
        String m_street;
        String m_town;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_PERSON; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setTown(String value) { m_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
    }

    public class CarGridItem extends GridItem
    {
        String m_id;
        String m_producer;
        public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return CB_CAR; }
        public String getId() { return m_id; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_id = id; }
        public String getProducer() { return m_producer; }
        public void setProducer(String producer) { m_producer = producer; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static String XML_PERSON = "<t:field text='.{firstName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{lastName}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{street}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{town}' width='25%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"; 
    static String XML_CAR = "<t:field text='.{id}' width='60%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:button actionListener='.{onRemove}' text='Rem.' width='50' height='100%' border='top:0'/>"
        +"<t:colline background='#00000030' height='100%'/>"
        +"<t:field text='.{producer}' width='40%' height='100%' border='top:0' background='#FFFFFF80'/>";
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_PERSON = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    private static ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding CB_CAR = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static
    {
        CB_PERSON.setContentXml(XML_PERSON);
        CB_CAR.setContentXml(XML_CAR);
    }
    
    public DemoGridRowDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20;i++)
        {
            if (i%3 == 0 || i%3 == 1)
            {
                PersonGridItem gi = new PersonGridItem();
                gi.setFirstName("FN"+i);
                gi.setLastName("LN"+i);
                gi.setStreet("ST"+i);
                gi.setTown("TO"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
            else
            {
                CarGridItem gi = new CarGridItem();
                gi.setId("ID"+i);
                gi.setProducer("PR"+i);
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Dynamic Page Generation

Normally a page name (e.g. "/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp") that is embedded within a ROWINCLUDE component points to a file that is located within you web content.

You also can resolve a page name by a program, so that the content of the page is generated dynamically.

You do so, by defining a class that implements interface IDynamicPageProvider. The class needs to be registered within the /eclntjsfserver/config/system.xml file.

system.xml:
<system>
...
<dynamicpages>
<dynamicpageprovider name="dynamicpages.DemoDynamicPageProvider"/>
</dynamicpages>
...
</system>

In our case the implementation is rather simple:
package dynamicpages;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.dynamicpages.IDynamicPageProvider;
import org.eclnt.util.dynaccess.IDynamicIntrospectionSupported;

public class DemoDynamicPageProvider
implements IDynamicPageProvider
{
public String getPath()
{
return "/demodyn";
}
public String readDynamicPage(String pageName)
{
return
"<t:row>"+
"<t:label text='Hello world! Page name: "+pageName+"'/>"+
"</t:row>";
}
}

You see: each dynamic provider is responsible for a certain page-name-path ("/demodyn" in this case). Within this range it is invoked by the page resolution calling method readDyniamcPage(..).

This providing of dynamic pages is a very powerful way of generating dynamic content.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicPages}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Include URL" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoDynamicPages.pageName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicPages.onLoad}" text="Load" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:pane id="g_9" border="#FF0000" height="100%" padding="1" width="100%" >
<t:rowinclude id="g_10" page="#{d.DemoDynamicPages.includedPageName}" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" align="right" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoDynamicPages.includedPageName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicPages}")

public class DemoDynamicPages
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_pageName = "/demodyn/test";
    protected String m_includedPageName;

    public DemoDynamicPages(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return m_pageName; }
    public void setPageName(String value) { m_pageName = value; }

    public String getIncludedPageName() { return m_includedPageName; }

    public void onLoad(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_includedPageName = m_pageName;
    }
}


// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
// Code of DynamicPageProvider
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
//package dynamicpages;
//
//import org.eclnt.jsfserver.dynamicpages.IDynamicPageProvider;
//import org.eclnt.util.dynaccess.IDynamicIntrospectionSupported;
//
//public class DemoDynamicPageProvider 
//    implements IDynamicPageProvider
//{
//
//    public String getPath()
//    {
//        return "/demodyn";
//    }
//
//    public String readDynamicPage(String pageName)
//    {
//        return
//        "<t:row>"+
//          "<t:label text='Hello world! Page name: "+pageName+"'/>"+
//        "</t:row>"+
//        "";
//    }
//
//}

Tuning - Stable Ids

Simple example

Click the "Rebuild" buttons: on the left side the dynamically content will flicker because it is rebuilt from the scratch. On the right side there is no flickering because components are re-used.

When building dynamic content that is updated frequently then explicitly assign stable ids to the components.

Both the server processing and the client management of controls are "id-aware": if a component at a certain position is already created, then it will not be re-created, but the existing component is used.

Please pay attention: you need to assign on any every level of the component hierarchy! - And of course: you are responsible to ensure that each id is unique within the scope of the corresponding ROWDYNAMICCONTENT component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="10" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_4" enabled="false" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="New Ids (default)" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds.onRebuild1Action}" text="Rebuild" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_7" contentbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds.dynContent1}" />
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_8" enabled="false" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Stable Ids" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds.onRebuild2Action}" text="Rebuild" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_11" contentbinding="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds.dynContent2}" />
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds}")

public class DemoRowDynamicContentIds
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent1 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent2 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    Map<String,String> m_data = new HashMap<String,String>(); 

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRowDynamicContentIds(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);     
        onRebuild1Action(null);
        onRebuild2Action(null);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorowdynamiccontentids.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRowDynamicContentIds}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent1() { return m_dynContent1; }
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent2() { return m_dynContent2; }
    public Map<String, String> getData() { return m_data; }

    public void onRebuild1Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        PANENode p = new PANENode().setWidth("100%");
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode();
            f.setLabeltext("Name " + i);
            f.setText(pbx("data.name"+i)).setWidth("100%");
            r.addSubNode(f);
        }
        m_dynContent1.setContentNode(p);
    }
    
    public void onRebuild2Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        PANENode p = new PANENode().setWidth("100%").setId("PANE");
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode().setId("ROW"+i);
            p.addSubNode(r);
            FIELDNode f = new FIELDNode().setId("FIELD"+i);
            f.setLabeltext("Name " + i);
            f.setText(pbx("data.name"+i)).setWidth("100%");
            r.addSubNode(f);
        }
        m_dynContent2.setContentNode(p);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Example: Schedule grid

This demos shows a grid with a lot of schedule items, that are dynamically rendered into the grid content.

Please observe: depending on the button you press, the right schedule items are flickering or not. The reason for flickering is that by default new components replaces the old ones: the old schedule items are removed on client side, the new ones are created.

But: you may influence this by explicitly assigning a stable id to the items. By this id the UI remembers the component, and the UI does no remove/create the optical representation but uses the existing one. Result: faste rendering and no flickering.

Please pay attention: stable ids have to be adde on every level of the dynamic node tree that you create. You see that in the demo both the SCHEDULEITEM and the contained DRAWAREA receive a stabled id (otherwise the DRAWAREA would flicker within the stable SCHEDULEITEM).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass.onPlusAction}" text="Plus" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass.onPlusActionNoBuffer}" text="Plus (no buffer)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass.grid}" sbvisibleamount="20" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Machine" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{machineId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_9" text="Orders" width="100%" >
<t:schedule id="g_10" numberofblocks="24" schedulemax="1440" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_11" contentbinding=".{dynContent}" />
</t:schedule>
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.DRAWAREANode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.SCHEDULEITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass}")

public class DemoGridScheduleMass
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Order
    {
        String i_id;
        long i_from;
        long i_duration;
        public String getId()
        {
            return i_id;
        }
        public long getFrom()
        {
            return m_base + i_from;
        }
        public long getDuration()
        {
            return i_duration;
        }
        
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_machineId;
        public String getMachineId() { return i_machineId; }
        public void setMachineId(String value) { this.i_machineId = value; }

        DYNAMICCONTENTBinding i_dynContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
        public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() {  return i_dynContent; }
        
        List<Order> i_orders = new ArrayList<DemoGridScheduleMass.Order>();
        public List<Order> getOrders() { return i_orders; }
        
        private void renderDynContent(boolean withBuffering)
        {
            List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode>();
            int orderCounter = -1;
            for (Order order: i_orders)
            {
                orderCounter++;
                SCHEDULEITEMNode sin = new SCHEDULEITEMNode()
                     .setScheduleleft(".{orders["+orderCounter +"].from}")
                     .setSchedulewidth(".{orders["+orderCounter +"].duration}")
                     .setResizingenabled(false)
                     .setBackground("#C0C0C0");
                if (withBuffering)
                    sin.addAttribute("id","SCHED_"+order.i_id);
                l.add(sin);
                DRAWAREANode da = new DRAWAREANode()
                        .setDrawcommands("rectangle(0,0,10%,100%,#800000);rectangle(10%,0,90%,100%,#008000);");
                if (withBuffering)
                    da.addAttribute("id","DRAW_"+order.i_id);
                sin.addSubNode(da);
            }
            i_dynContent.setContentNodes(l);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    private long m_base = 200;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridScheduleMass(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        int orderCounter = -1;
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            String machineId = "" + i;
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.i_machineId = machineId;
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            for (int j=0; j<20; j++)
            {
                orderCounter++;
                Order o = new Order();
                o.i_id = ""+orderCounter;
                o.i_from = j*50;
                o.i_duration = 40;
                gi.i_orders.add(o);
            }
        }
        rerender(true);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridschedulemass.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridScheduleMass}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public void rerender(boolean withBuffering)
    {
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
            gi.renderDynContent(withBuffering);
    }

    public void onPlusAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_base += 10;
        rerender(true);
    }

    public void onPlusActionNoBuffer(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_base += 10;
        rerender(false);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}
    

Adapter Binding

Simple Scenario

This is a simple demonstration of how to use the adapter binding.

Both fields show some error information if you define a value with less than 3 characters.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAdapterBindingSimple}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:field id="g_3" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoAdapterBindingSimple.firstName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_5" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoAdapterBindingSimple.lastName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoAdapterBindingSimple.onCheck}" text="Check" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ICCComponentProperties;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.IComponentAdapterBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAdapterBindingSimple}")
public class DemoAdapterBindingSimple
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public static class MyFieldAdapter 
        implements IComponentAdapterBinding, ICCComponentProperties
    {
        static Set<String> MYFIELDADAPTER_FIXATTRIBUTES;
        static Set<String> MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES;
        
        static
        {
            MYFIELDADAPTER_FIXATTRIBUTES = new HashSet<String>();
            MYFIELDADAPTER_FIXATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_labeltext);
            MYFIELDADAPTER_FIXATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_align);
            MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES = new HashSet<String>();
            MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_text);
            MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_enabled);
            MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_bgpaint);
            MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES.add(ATT_tooltip);
        }
        
        String i_labelText = null;
        String i_align = null;
        boolean i_containsError = false;
        String i_errorMessage = null;
        String i_text = "";
        boolean i_enabled = true;
        // methods if IComponentAdapterBinding
        public Set<String> getFixAttributeNames() { return MYFIELDADAPTER_FIXATTRIBUTES; }
        public Set<String> getDynamicAttributeNames() { return MYFIELDADAPTER_DYNATTRIBUTES; }
        public MyFieldAdapter(String labelText, String align)
        {
            i_labelText = labelText;
            i_align = align;
        }
        public Class getAttibuteType(String attributeName) 
        { 
            if ("text".equals(attributeName))
                return String.class; 
            else
                throw new Error("The attribute " + attributeName + " is not supported!");
        }
        public Object getAttributeValue(String attributeName)
        {
            if (ATT_text.equals(attributeName)) 
                return i_text;
            else if (ATT_enabled.equals(attributeName)) 
                return i_enabled;
            else if (ATT_bgpaint.equals(attributeName)) 
            {
                if (i_containsError == true) 
                    return "error()";
                else
                    return null;
            }
            else if (ATT_align.equals(attributeName)) 
                return i_align;
            else if (ATT_labeltext.equals(attributeName)) 
                return i_labelText;
            else if (ATT_tooltip.equals(attributeName)) 
            {
                if (i_containsError == true) 
                    return i_errorMessage;
                else
                    return null;
            }
            else
                throw new Error("The attribute " + attributeName + " is not supported!");
        }
        public void setAttributeValue(String attributeName, Object value)
        {
            if (ATT_text.equals(attributeName))
                i_text = (String)value;
            else
                throw new Error("The attribute " + attributeName + " is not supported!");
        }
        public void onAction(ActionEvent event) {}
        // normal access methods
        public void resetError() { i_containsError = false; }
        public void notifyError(String message) 
        { 
            i_containsError = true; 
            i_errorMessage = message; 
        }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; }
        public void enable() { i_enabled = true; }
        public void disable() { i_enabled = false; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyFieldAdapter m_firstName = new MyFieldAdapter("First name","left");
    MyFieldAdapter m_lastName = new MyFieldAdapter("Last name", "left");
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoAdapterBindingSimple(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_firstName.setText("Cap");
        m_lastName.setText("Casa");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public MyFieldAdapter getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public MyFieldAdapter getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    
    public void onCheck(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_firstName.i_containsError = false;
        m_lastName.i_containsError = false;
        // some "checks"
        if (m_firstName.getText().length() < 4)
            m_firstName.notifyError("Please define a value with more than 4 characters");
        if (m_lastName.getText().length() < 4)
            m_lastName.notifyError("Please define a value with more than 4 characters");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Form Scenario

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}"
                objectbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding}">
                <t:row id="g_2">
                    <t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
                    <t:field id="g_4"
                        adapterbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.fields.firstName}"
                        width="100%" />
                </t:row>
                <t:row id="g_5">
                    <t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" />
                    <t:field id="g_7"
                        adapterbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.fields.lastName}"
                        width="100%" />
                </t:row>
                <t:row id="g_8">
                    <t:label id="g_9" text="Street" width="100" />
                    <t:field id="g_10"
                        adapterbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.fields.street}"
                        width="100%" />
                </t:row>
                <t:row id="g_11">
                    <t:label id="g_12" text="City" width="100" />
                    <t:field id="g_13"
                        adapterbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.fields.city}"
                        width="100%" />
                </t:row>
                <t:row id="g_14">
                    <t:label id="g_15" text="Department" width="100" />
                    <t:combofield id="g_16"
                        adapterbinding="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.fields.department}"
                        width="200" />
                </t:row>
                <t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="50" />
                <t:row id="g_18">
                    <t:coldistance id="g_19" width="100" />
                    <t:button id="g_20"
                        actionListener="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.onCheck}" text="Check" />
                    <t:coldistance id="g_21" width="100%" />
                    <t:button id="g_22"
                        actionListener="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding.onFocusStreet}"
                        text="Focus Street Field" />
                </t:row>
            </t:rowdemobodypane>
            <t:pageaddons id="g_pa" />
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection.IdTextLine;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.IComponentAdapterBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.RequestFocusManager;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFormAdapterBinding}")

public class DemoFormAdapterBinding
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static Set<String> FIELDFIXATTRIBUTES = new HashSet<String>();
    
    static Set<String> FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES = new HashSet<String>();
    static
    {
        FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES.add("text");
        FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES.add("bgpaint");
        FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES.add("enabled");
        FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES.add("requestfocus");
    }
    
    /**
     * Adapter binding that is behind one form field.
     */
    public class FIELDAdapterBinding implements IComponentAdapterBinding
    {
        String m_text;
        String m_propertyName;
        boolean m_enabled = true;
        long m_requestfocus = -1;
        boolean m_hasError = false;
        boolean m_isMandatory = false;
        public FIELDAdapterBinding(boolean isMandatory, String propertyName)
        {
            m_isMandatory = isMandatory;
            m_propertyName = propertyName;
        }
        public Class getAttibuteType(String attributeName) { return String.class; }
        public Object getAttributeValue(String attributeName)
        {
            if ("text".equals(attributeName)) return m_text;
            if ("bgpaint".equals(attributeName)) return getBgpaint();
            if ("enabled".equals(attributeName)) return m_enabled;
            if ("requestfocus".equals(attributeName)) return m_requestfocus;
            throw new Error("Should never happen!");
        }
        public Set<String> getDynamicAttributeNames()
        {
            return FIELDDYNATTRIBUTES;
        }
        public Set<String> getFixAttributeNames()
        {
            return FIELDFIXATTRIBUTES;
        }
        public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
            {
                openValidValueHelp(this);
            }
        }
        public void setAttributeValue(String attributeName, Object value)
        {
            if ("text".equals(attributeName)) m_text = (String)value;
        }
        private String getBgpaint()
        {
            if (m_hasError == true) return "error()";
            if (m_isMandatory == true) return "mandatory()";
            return null;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Map<String,FIELDAdapterBinding> m_fields = new HashMap<String,FIELDAdapterBinding>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFormAdapterBinding(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        registerField("firstName",true);
        registerField("lastName",true);
        registerField("street",false);
        registerField("city",false);
        registerField("department",true);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Map<String,FIELDAdapterBinding> getFields() { return m_fields; }
    
    public void onCheck(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        boolean foundError = false;
        // reset error information
        for (FIELDAdapterBinding field: m_fields.values())
            field.m_hasError = false;
        // check for mandatory
        for (FIELDAdapterBinding field: m_fields.values())
        {
            if (field.m_isMandatory == true && (field.m_text == null || field.m_text.length() == 0))
            {
                field.m_hasError = true;
                Statusbar.outputError("Mandatory input is missing!");
            }
        }
        // special rules
        FIELDAdapterBinding cityField = m_fields.get("city");
        if ("Paul".equals(cityField.m_text))
        {
            cityField.m_hasError = true;
            cityField.m_requestfocus = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
            Statusbar.outputError("Paul ist heute nicht in der City.");
        }
    }
    
    public void onFocusStreet(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_fields.get("street").m_requestfocus = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void registerField(String propertyName, boolean isMandatory)
    {
        m_fields.put(propertyName,new FIELDAdapterBinding(isMandatory,propertyName));
    }
    
    private void openValidValueHelp(final FIELDAdapterBinding field)
    {
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"Opening valid value helpt for property " + field.m_propertyName);
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            idts.addLine(field.m_propertyName+"_" + i,field.m_propertyName+"_" + i);
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                field.m_text = id;
            }
        });
    }
    
}

By annotation

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCabReflection}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCabReflection}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_4" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCabReflection.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:field id="g_6" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCabReflection.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:field id="g_8" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCabReflection.title}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoCabReflection.onCheckAction}" text="Check" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAdapterByAnnotation;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttribute;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttributeType;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCabReflection}")

public class DemoCabReflection
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * In the demo: inner class. In real scenarios: real class that is used
     * by many page beans.
     */
    public class FieldAdapter extends ComponentAdapterByAnnotation
    {
        String m_label;
        String m_value;
        boolean i_containsError;
        String i_errorText;
        public FieldAdapter(String label)
        {
            m_label = label;
        }
        @ComponentAttribute(type=ComponentAttributeType.FIX,attribute="labeltext")
        public String getLabel() { return m_label; }
        @ComponentAttribute(attribute="text")
        public String getValue() { return m_value; }
        public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getBgpaint()
        {
            if (i_containsError)
                return "error()";
            else
                return null;
        }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getTooltip()
        {
            if (i_containsError == true)
                return i_errorText;
            else
                return null;
        }
        public void indicateError(String text) 
        { 
            i_containsError = true;
            i_errorText = text;
        }
        public void resetError() 
        { 
            i_containsError = false;
            i_errorText = null;
        }
    }

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Set<FieldAdapter> m_adapters = new HashSet<FieldAdapter>();
    
    FieldAdapter m_firstName;
    FieldAdapter m_lastName;
    FieldAdapter m_title;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCabReflection(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_firstName = createFieldAdapter("First name");
        m_lastName = createFieldAdapter("Last name");
        m_title = createFieldAdapter("Title");
        m_firstName.setValue("Captain");
        m_lastName.setValue("Casa");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democabreflection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCabReflection}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FieldAdapter getFirstName() { return m_firstName; } 
    public FieldAdapter getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public FieldAdapter getTitle() { return m_title; }

    public void onCheckAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        clearAdapterErrors();
        processChecks();
        if (checkIfError() == true)
            Statusbar.outputError("Person contains error - please check.");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /**
     * In demo: checks are done directly in page bean (which means: on view layer).
     * Better: checks to be done on logic layer!
     */
    private void processChecks()
    {
        if (m_firstName.getValue() == null || m_firstName.getValue().trim().length() == 0)
            m_firstName.indicateError("First name does not contain any value.");
        if (m_lastName.getValue() == null || m_lastName.getValue().trim().length() == 0)
            m_lastName.indicateError("Last name does not contain any value.");
        if (m_title.getValue() == null || m_title.getValue().trim().length() == 0)
            m_title.indicateError("Last name does not contain any value.");
    }
    
    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private void clearAdapterErrors()
    {
        for (FieldAdapter pa: m_adapters)
            pa.resetError();
    }

    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private FieldAdapter createFieldAdapter(String label)
    {
        FieldAdapter result = new FieldAdapter(label);
        m_adapters.add(result);
        return result;
    }
    
    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private boolean checkIfError()
    {
        for (FieldAdapter pa: m_adapters)
            if (pa.i_containsError == true)
                return true;
        return false;
    }
}

By annotation, with bean property

The base class "ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty" extends the functions of "ComponentAdapterByAnnotation" by adding one additional feature.

You define one component attribute to be resolved by a property of a bean. The bean itself is passed either directly or by an interface "IBeanAccess".

Advantage: if you e.g. use this adapter for a field component, then the value of the field is directly taken from e.g. a Pojo-bean's property - while all the other values for the component are added as additional properties of the adapter. This makes the usage of Pojo-beans much easier.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_2" beanbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_5" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_7" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:field id="g_9" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.title}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_11" text="Gender" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_12" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_14" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="0" text="Male" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_15" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="1" text="Female" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_16" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="2" text="Diverse" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:combobox id="g_18" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection2.department}" width="100%" withnullitem="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.Democabreflection2.onCheckAction}" text="Check" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttribute;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttributeType;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.IBeanAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.Democabreflection2}")

public class Democabreflection2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable, IBeanAccess<Person>
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /**
     * In the demo: inner class. In real scenarios: real class that is used
     * by many page beans.
     */
    public class PropertyAdapter extends ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty<Person>
    {
        String i_label;
        boolean i_containsError;
        String i_errorText;
        boolean i_mandatory = false;
        public PropertyAdapter(String componentAttribute, 
                               IBeanAccess<Person> beanAccess, 
                               String property,
                               String label)
        {
            super(componentAttribute, beanAccess, property);
            i_label = label;
        }
        @ComponentAttribute(type=ComponentAttributeType.FIX,attribute="labeltext")
        public String getLabel() { return i_label; }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getBgpaint()
        {
            if (i_containsError)
                return "error()";
            else if (i_mandatory)
                return "mandatory()";
            else
                return null;
        }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getTooltip()
        {
            if (i_containsError == true)
                return i_errorText;
            else
                return null;
        }
        public void indicateError(String text) 
        { 
            i_containsError = true;
            i_errorText = text;
        }
        public void resetError() 
        { 
            i_containsError = false;
            i_errorText = null;
        }
        public void setMandatory(boolean value) { i_mandatory = value; }
    }

    /**
     * In the demo: inner class. In real scenarios: real class that is used
     * by many page beans.
     */
    public class PropertyComboAdapter extends PropertyAdapter
    {
        ValidValuesBinding i_vvb = new ValidValuesBinding();
        public PropertyComboAdapter(String componentAttribute, 
                                    IBeanAccess<Person> beanAccess, 
                                    String property,
                                    String label)
        {
            super(componentAttribute, beanAccess, property, label);
        }
        @ComponentAttribute(attribute="validvaluesbinding")
        public ValidValuesBinding getVvb() { return i_vvb; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Person m_person;
    Map<String,PropertyAdapter> m_adapters = new HashMap<String,PropertyAdapter>();
    
    PropertyAdapter m_firstName; 
    PropertyAdapter m_lastName; 
    PropertyAdapter m_title; 
    PropertyAdapter m_gender;
    PropertyComboAdapter m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Democabreflection2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_person = new Person();
        m_firstName = createPropertyAdapter("text",Person.PROP_FIRSTNAME,"First name");
        m_firstName.setMandatory(true);
        m_lastName = createPropertyAdapter("text",Person.PROP_LASTNAME,"Last name");
        m_lastName.setMandatory(true);
        m_title = createPropertyAdapter("text",Person.PROP_TITLE,"Title");
        m_gender = createPropertyAdapter("value",Person.PROP_GENDER,"Gender");
        m_department = createPropertyComboAdapter("value",Person.PROP_DEPARTMENT,"Department");
        m_department.setMandatory(true);
        m_department.getVvb().addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_department.getVvb().addValidValue("0002","Marketing");
        m_department.getVvb().addValidValue("0003","Production");
        m_department.getVvb().addValidValue("0004","Human resources");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democabreflection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCabReflection}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    @Override
    public Person getBean() { return m_person; }

    public Person getPerson() { return m_person; } 
    
    public PropertyAdapter getFirstName() { return m_firstName; } 
    public PropertyAdapter getLastName() { return m_lastName; } 
    public PropertyAdapter getTitle() { return m_title; } 
    public PropertyAdapter getGender() { return m_gender; }
    public PropertyComboAdapter getDepartment() { return m_department; }

    public void onCheckAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        clearAdapterErrors();
        processChecks();
        if (checkIfError() == true)
            Statusbar.outputError("Person contains error - please check.");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * In demo: checks are done directly in page bean (which means: on view layer).
     * Better: checks to be done on logic layer!
     */
    private void processChecks()
    {
        if (m_person.getFirstName() == null || m_person.getFirstName().trim().length() == 0)
            m_firstName.indicateError("First name does not contain any value.");
        if (m_person.getLastName() == null || m_person.getLastName().trim().length() == 0)
            m_lastName.indicateError("Last name does not contain any value.");
        if (m_person.getDepartment() == null || m_person.getDepartment().trim().length() == 0)
            m_department.indicateError("Department does not contain any value.");
    }
    
    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private PropertyAdapter createPropertyAdapter(String componentAttribute, 
                                                  String property,
                                                  String label)
    {
        PropertyAdapter result = new PropertyAdapter(componentAttribute,this,property,label);
        m_adapters.put(property,result);
        return result;
    }
    
    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private PropertyComboAdapter createPropertyComboAdapter(String componentAttribute, 
                                                            String property,
                                                            String label)
    {
        PropertyComboAdapter result = new PropertyComboAdapter(componentAttribute,this,property,label);
        m_adapters.put(property,result);
        return result;
    }

    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private void clearAdapterErrors()
    {
        for (PropertyAdapter pa: m_adapters.values())
            pa.resetError();
    }

    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private boolean checkIfError()
    {
        for (PropertyAdapter pa: m_adapters.values())
            if (pa.i_containsError == true)
                return true;
        return false;
    }

}

By annotation, "self configuring"

This example of using the adapter binding shows two important apsects:

1.

The adapters are implementing interface IComponentAdapter2. This interface extends IComponentAdapter by an additional method, in which at runtime the component, that uses the adapter binding, is passed (method: initComponent(IBaseComponent component)).

AS consequence the definition of the attribute name that serves the component can be directly derived from the component name. Of course any other behavior now can be defined dependent on the component as well.

2.

The adapters are not kept in fix member variables, but in a map (m_adapters). The map is a "lazy loading" map, i.e. its content is created at this point of time when it is required. In other words: the map automatically fills itself during usage.


Please note: this example assembles all aspects into one class, which are normally arranged in some base class - and some extending class!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_4" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:field id="g_6" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:combobox id="g_8" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.title}" width="100%" />
<t:combobox id="g_9" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.department}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_11" text="Gender" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_12" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_14" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="0" text="Male" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_15" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="1" text="Female" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_16" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection4.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="2" text="Diverse" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.Democabreflection4.onCheckAction}" text="Check" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.IBaseComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttribute;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttributeType;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.IBeanAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.map.LazyLoadingMap;
import org.eclnt.util.map.LazyLoadingMap.ILazyLoader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.Democabreflection4}")

public class Democabreflection4
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable, IBeanAccess<Person>
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /**
     * In the demo: inner class. In real scenarios: real class that is used
     * by many page beans.
     * <br><br>
     * In the method initComponent at runtime the component is passed. Dependent
     * on the component the attribute name is initialized.
     */
    public static class PropertyAdapter extends ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty<Person>
    {
        String i_label;
        boolean i_containsError;
        String i_errorText;
        boolean i_mandatory = false;
        ValidValuesBinding i_vvb = null;
        public PropertyAdapter(IBeanAccess<Person> beanAccess,String property)
        {
            super(beanAccess, property);
            i_label = property.toUpperCase();
        }
        @Override
        public void initComponent(IBaseComponent component)
        {
            super.initComponent(component);
            String tagName = component.getTagNameWithPrefix();
            switch (tagName)
            {
                case "t:field":
                case "t:combofield":
                case "t:textarea":
                case "t:label":
                    initComponentAttribute("text");
                    break;
                case "t:formattedfield":
                case "t:calendarfield":
                case "t:combobox":
                case "t:radiobutton":
                    initComponentAttribute("value");
                    break;
                case "t:checkbox":
                    initComponentAttribute("selected");
                    break;
                default:
                    throw new Error("Adapter not prepared to be used for component: " + tagName);
            }
        }
        @ComponentAttribute(type=ComponentAttributeType.FIX,attribute="labeltext")
        public String getLabel() { return i_label; }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getBgpaint()
        {
            if (i_containsError)
                return "error()";
            else if (i_mandatory)
                return "mandatory()";
            else
                return null;
        }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public String getTooltip()
        {
            if (i_containsError == true)
                return i_errorText;
            else
                return null;
        }
        public void indicateError(String text) 
        { 
            i_containsError = true;
            i_errorText = text;
        }
        public void resetError() 
        { 
            i_containsError = false;
            i_errorText = null;
        }
        public void setMandatory(boolean value) { i_mandatory = value; }
        @ComponentAttribute(attribute="validvaluesbinding")
        public ValidValuesBinding getVvb() 
        { 
            if (i_vvb == null) i_vvb = new ValidValuesBinding();
            return i_vvb; 
        }
        @ComponentAttribute
        public boolean getWithnullitem() { return true; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Person m_person;
    LazyLoadingMap<PropertyAdapter> m_adapters = new LazyLoadingMap<PropertyAdapter>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Democabreflection4(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_adapters.setLoader(new ILazyLoader<PropertyAdapter>()
        {
            @Override
            public PropertyAdapter lazyLoad(String key)
            {
                return new PropertyAdapter(Democabreflection4.this,key);
            }
        });
        // configure property adapters
        m_adapters.get("firstName").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("lastName").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("department").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0002","Marketing");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0003","Production");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0004","Human resources");
        m_adapters.get("title").getVvb().addValidValue("DR","Dr");
        m_adapters.get("title").getVvb().addValidValue("PROF","Prof");
        // create some bean
        m_person = new Person();
        m_person.setFirstName("Captain");
        m_person.setLastName("Casa");
        m_person.setTitle("DR");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democabreflection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCabReflection}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    @Override
    public Person getBean() { return m_person; }
    public Person getPerson() { return m_person; } 
    public LazyLoadingMap<PropertyAdapter> getAdapters() { return m_adapters; }

    public void onCheckAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        clearAdapterErrors();
        processChecks();
        if (checkIfError() == true)
            Statusbar.outputError("Person contains error - please check.");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * In demo: checks are done directly in page bean (which means: on view layer).
     * Better: checks to be done on logic layer!
     */
    private void processChecks()
    {
        if (m_person.getFirstName() == null || m_person.getFirstName().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("First name does not contain any value.","firstName");
        if (m_person.getLastName() == null || m_person.getLastName().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("Last name does not contain any value.","lastName");
        if (m_person.getDepartment() == null || m_person.getDepartment().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("Department does not contain any value.","department");
    }
    
    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private void clearAdapterErrors()
    {
        for (PropertyAdapter pa: m_adapters.values())
            pa.resetError();
    }

    /**
     * In real scenario: this method is part of some base class.
     */
    private boolean checkIfError()
    {
        for (PropertyAdapter pa: m_adapters.values())
            if (pa.i_containsError == true)
                return true;
        return false;
    }

    private void indicateError(String message, String... properties)
    {
        for (String property: properties)
        {
            PropertyAdapter pa = m_adapters.getDirectly(property);
            if (pa != null) pa.indicateError(message);
        }
    }
}

By annotation, cleaned up

This is from functional point of view the same demo as the previous demo "Democabreflection4" - but now the logic is not melted in one class, but separated into one base generic base class and one extending class for the object "Person".

You see: there is not a lot left inside the extending class...!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="BP" beanbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_4" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:field id="g_777" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:combobox id="g_8" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.title}" width="100%" />
<t:combobox id="g_999" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.department}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_11" text="Gender" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_12" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_14" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="0" text="Male" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_15" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="1" text="Female" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_16" adapterbinding="#{d.Democabreflection5.adapters.gender}" group="GENDER" refvalue="2" text="Diverse" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.Democabreflection5.onCheckAction}" text="Check" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.Person;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.Democabreflection5}")

public class Democabreflection5
    extends DemocabreflectionBase<Person> 
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Democabreflection5(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_adapters.get("firstName").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("lastName").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("department").setMandatory(true);
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0002","Marketing");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0003","Production");
        m_adapters.get("department").getVvb().addValidValue("0004","Human resources");
        m_adapters.get("title").getVvb().addValidValue("DR","Dr");
        m_adapters.get("title").getVvb().addValidValue("PROF","Prof");
        // create some bean
        Person p = new Person();
        p.setFirstName("Captain");
        p.setLastName("Casa");
        p.setTitle("DR");
        setBean(p);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democabreflection5.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCabReflection5}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    protected void processChecks()
    {
        Person p = getBean();
        if (p.getFirstName() == null || p.getFirstName().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("First name does not contain any value.","firstName");
        if (p.getLastName() == null || p.getLastName().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("Last name does not contain any value.","lastName");
        if (p.getDepartment() == null || p.getDepartment().trim().length() == 0)
            indicateError("Department does not contain any value.","department");
    }
    
}

Example: COMBOFIELD referencing bean-objects

The focus of the demo is the COMBOFIELD processing.

The three controls reference to a bean of type "Order". In the "Order" beand there is a direct instance reference to the bean "Customer".

This demo shows how to use the COMBOFIELD accordingly:

1. you can directly input the id of the customer - and it will be checked and transferred into an object which is set into the order
2. you can select the customer from the COMBOFIELD popup
3. In case your input does not match a customer, then the field shows an error background

The interesting issues with the COBOFIELD processing are:

1. always remember: the COMBOFIELD does not know about bean objects! It knows simple data types only (in the example we use String)
2. that's the reason why in the adapter binding you need to tell that "customer" from UI perspective is a String. The conversion into a bean of type "Customer" is "behind the control".
3. because there might be situations in which the user inputs a customer that is not valid, you need to "park" the interim-value outside of the bean object.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_7" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.orderIdAdapter}" flush="true" labeltext="Order Id" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:combofield id="g_10" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.customerAdapter}" flush="true" labeltext="Customer" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textarea id="g_13" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.orderCommentAdapter}" flush="true" height="200" labeltext="Comment" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.onOutputAction}" text="Output order" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:textarea id="g_20" adapterbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.customerAdapter}" flush="true" height="200" rendered="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.resultOutput!=null}" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference.resultOutput}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.adapter.ComponentAttribute;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCombofieldBeanReference}")

public class DemoCombofieldBeanReference
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public static class Order
    {
        String i_orderId;
        Customer i_customer;
        String i_orderComment;
        public String getOrderId() { return i_orderId; }
        public void setOrderId(String orderId) { i_orderId = orderId; }
        public Customer getCustomer() { return i_customer; }
        public void setCustomer(Customer customer) { i_customer = customer; }
        public String getOrderComment() { return i_orderComment; }
        public void setOrderComment(String orderComment) { i_orderComment = orderComment; }
    }
    
    public static class Customer
    {
        String i_customerId;
        String i_customerName;
        public String getCustomerId() { return i_customerId; }
        public void setCustomerId(String customerId) { i_customerId = customerId; }
        public String getCustomerName() { return i_customerName; }
        public void setCustomerName(String customerName) { i_customerName = customerName; }
        public String toString() { return i_customerName; }
    }
    
    public class FieldAdapter extends ComponentAdapterByAnnotationForBeanProperty<Order>
    {
        public FieldAdapter(Order bean,String property)
        {
