This example shows how to correctly start a parallel thread that is accessing CaptainCasa-internal functions. In the example the grid processing is accessed from the external thread.

It is important to synchronize the parallel thread with the CaptainCasa thread processing, so that you use the same thread synchronization as CaptainCasa internally does in order to prevent two threads being processed in parallel for one dialog session.

Check the code and observe the console output: the inner processing of the parallel thread is started at this point of time when the request processing of the UI-request calling "onExportAction" has finished.

...to make sure: you only have to follow this procedure if your parallel thread accesses CaptainCasa-functions. If the thread has nothing to do with CaptainCasa, then you must not synchronize with the CaptainCasa processing!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoThreadSynchronization}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoThreadSynchronization}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoThreadSynchronization.onExportAction}" text="Export grid content to file in separate thread" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoThreadSynchronization.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="First" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_26" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Last " width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_12" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="Birthday" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_15" format="date" text=".{birthday}" timezone="LOCAL" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ThreadData;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.ColumnInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDComponent.READTYPE;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.FIXGRIDDumper;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ISessionAbstraction;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ThreadingSynchronization;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoThreadSynchronization}")

public class DemoThreadSynchronization
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyThread extends Thread
    {
        Object i_synchObject;
        public MyThread(Object synchObject)
        { 
            i_synchObject = synchObject;
        }
        @Override
        public void run()
        { 
            System.out.println("==========> Thread is started!!!");
            synchronized (i_synchObject)
            {
                try
                {
                    System.out.println("==========> Thread is processing!!!");
                    StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
                    FIXGRIDDumper.dumpGridContentToSystemOut(m_grid);
                    List<ColumnInfo> cis = m_grid.getColumnInfos();
                    for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
                    {
                        for (ColumnInfo ci: cis)
                        {
                            String value = m_grid.getItemColumnClientStringValue(gi,ci,READTYPE.EXPORT);
                            sb.append(value + ", ");
                        }
                        sb.append("\n");
                    }
                    String fileName = HttpSessionAccess.getServletTempDirectory()+"/demo/testdemodataexport.txt";
                    FileManager.ensureDirectoryForFileExists(fileName);
                    FileManager.writeUTF8File(fileName,sb.toString(),true);
                    System.out.println("==========> Thread processing has finished");
                }
                catch (Throwable t)
                {
                    t.printStackTrace();
                    System.out.println("==========> Thread processing has finished");
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        int i_index = 0;
        LocalDate i_birthday;
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public GridItem(int index)
        {
            i_index = index;
        }
        public LocalDate getBirthday() { return i_birthday; }
        public void setBirthday(LocalDate value) { this.i_birthday = value; }
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoThreadSynchronization(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    { 
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem(i);
            gi.setFirstName("First " + i);
            gi.setLastName("Last " + i);
            gi.setBirthday(LocalDate.of(1950+i,8,24));
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/ztest/k40_export.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.K40_exportUI}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public void onExportAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // start thread and inject it with current context info
        ISessionAbstraction dialogSession = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentDialogSession();
        Object synchObject = ThreadingSynchronization.instance().getSynchObject(dialogSession);
        MyThread t = new MyThread(synchObject);
        ThreadData.injectExtThread(t);
        t.start();
        // still add some items
        //...so the thread must not start before having finished adding these items
        //...and: the thread must not access internal session data in a multi-threaded,
        //        unsynchronized way!
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem(i);
            gi.setFirstName("AddFirst " + i);
            gi.setLastName("AddLast " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(0,gi);
            System.out.println("Added: " + i);
        }
        System.out.println("==========> Now finished processing of onExportAction");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Focus Management

Focus sequence

You can explicitly define the tab/focus-sequence within a page using the attribute FOCUSSEQUENCE, that is available on all relevant components.

The attribute value, that you need to pass, is built out of two definitions: <area>/<index>

Within one page there may be one or several area definitions. In the example page there is the "A" area, the "B" area, the "C" area. Within each area you define the indices for these components for which you want to explicitly define the tab/focus-order.

The focus sequence definitions are defined on page level: if you use area "A" on one page, and you use area "A" on another page as well - then both "A" areas are no interlinked, but are managed as totally separated areas.

Btw.: the index definitions may contain gaps, i.e. you may define FOCUSSEQUENCE values "A/0", "A/2", "A/5" without having to fill in the missing indices.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFocusSequence}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Tabbing like a Snake!" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" />
<t:label id="g_8" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" />
<t:label id="g_11" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" />
<t:label id="g_14" text="A/0" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_15" focussequence="A/0" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="A/4" width="25" />
<t:combobox id="g_18" focussequence="A/4" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_19" />
<t:label id="g_20" text="A/3" width="25" />
<t:combofield id="g_21" focussequence="A/3" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_22" />
<t:label id="g_23" text="A/2" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_24" focussequence="A/2" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_25" />
<t:label id="g_26" text="A/1" width="25" />
<t:checkbox id="g_27" focussequence="A/1" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="A/5" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_30" focussequence="A/5" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_31" />
<t:label id="g_32" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_33" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_34" />
<t:label id="g_35" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_36" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_37" />
<t:label id="g_38" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_39" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_41" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Two parallel PANEs - with FOCUSSEQUENCE-definition" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:pane id="g_43" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" text="B/0" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_46" focussequence="B/0" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:label id="g_48" text="B/2" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_49" focussequence="B/2" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" text="B/4" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_52" focussequence="B/4" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_53" />
<t:pane id="g_54" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_55" >
<t:label id="g_56" text="B/1" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_57" focussequence="B/1" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_58" >
<t:label id="g_59" text="B/3" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_60" focussequence="B/3" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_61" >
<t:label id="g_62" text="B/5" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_63" focussequence="B/5" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_64" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_65" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Two parallel PANEs - without FOCUSSEQUENCE-definition" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_66" >
<t:pane id="g_67" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_68" >
<t:label id="g_69" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_70" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_73" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_74" >
<t:label id="g_75" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_76" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_77" />
<t:pane id="g_78" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_79" >
<t:label id="g_80" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_81" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_82" >
<t:label id="g_83" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_84" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_85" >
<t:label id="g_86" width="25" />
<t:field id="g_87" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_88" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_89" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="FOCUSSEQUENCE in Grid" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_90" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_91" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFocusSequence.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_92" text="First Name C/0" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_93" focussequence="C/0" text=".{firstName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_94" text="Last Name C/2" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_95" focussequence="C/2" text=".{lastName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_96" text="Street C/1" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_97" focussequence="C/1" text=".{street}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_98" text="Town C/3" width="25%" >
<t:field id="g_99" focussequence="C/3" text=".{town}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFocusSequence}")

public class DemoFocusSequence
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_town;
        public String getTown() { return m_town; }
        public void setTown(String value) { this.m_town = value; }

        String m_street;
        public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
        public void setStreet(String value) { this.m_street = value; }

        String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.m_lastName = value; }

        String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.m_firstName = value; }

    }

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    public DemoFocusSequence(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
}

Request focus by application

When a page is built then the focus typically is set to the first focussable component.

You can override this behaviour by using the attribute REQUESTFOCUS of an element. Setting the value "creation" into this attribute, means that this component tries to obtain the focus when the page shows up.

In the example the focus is set onto the second element, while it normally would show up on the first component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoRequestfocus}" popupmenu="HOTKEYS" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_4" requestfocus="#{d.demoRequestfocus.firstNameRF}" text="#{d.demoRequestfocus.firstName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_7" requestfocus="#{d.demoRequestfocus.lastNameRF}" text="#{d.demoRequestfocus.lastName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Street" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_10" requestfocus="#{d.demoRequestfocus.streetRF}" text="#{d.demoRequestfocus.street}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="ZipCode" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_13" requestfocus="#{d.demoRequestfocus.zipCodeRF}" text="#{d.demoRequestfocus.zipCode}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="City" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_16" requestfocus="#{d.demoRequestfocus.cityRF}" text="#{d.demoRequestfocus.city}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.demoRequestfocus.onFocussedFieldAction}" flush="true" value="#{d.demoRequestfocus.focussedField}" width="120" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_21" text="firstName" value="firstName" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_22" text="lastName" value="lastName" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" text="street" value="street" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_24" text="zipCode" value="zipCode" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" text="city" value="city" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="HOTKEYS" >
<t:menuitem id="g_26" actionListener="#{d.demoRequestfocus.onFocusFirstName}" hotkey="ctrl-shift-49" text="Focus First Name" />
<t:menuitem id="g_27" actionListener="#{d.demoRequestfocus.onFocusLastName}" hotkey="ctrl-shift-50" text="Focus First Name" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.RequestFocusManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoRequestfocus}")

public class DemoRequestfocus extends PageBean
{
    protected long m_firstNameRF;
    protected long m_lastNameRF = RequestFocusManager.getCreationRequestFocusCounter();
    protected long m_streetRF;
    protected long m_cityRF;
    protected long m_zipCodeRF;
    
    public long getFirstNameRF() { return m_firstNameRF; }
    public long getLastNameRF() { return m_lastNameRF; }
    public long getStreetRF() { return m_streetRF; }
    public long getCityRF() { return m_cityRF; }
    public long getZipCodeRF() { return m_zipCodeRF; }

    protected String m_firstName ="Michael";
    protected String m_lastName = "Moretimer";
    protected String m_street;
    protected String m_zipCode;
    protected String m_city;
    
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
    public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
    public String getZipCode() { return m_zipCode; }
    public void setZipCode(String value) { m_zipCode = value; }
    public String getCity() { return m_city; }
    public void setCity(String value) { m_city = value; }

    protected String m_focussedField;
    public String getFocussedField() { return m_focussedField; }
    public void setFocussedField(String value) { m_focussedField = value; }
    
    public DemoRequestfocus(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void onFocussedFieldAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_focussedField == null)
            return;
        else if (m_focussedField.equals("firstName"))
            m_firstNameRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
        else if (m_focussedField.equals("lastName"))
            m_lastNameRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
        else if (m_focussedField.equals("street"))
            m_streetRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
        else if (m_focussedField.equals("zipCode"))
            m_zipCodeRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
        else if (m_focussedField.equals("city"))
            m_cityRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
    }

    public void onFocusLastName(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_lastNameRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
    }

    public void onFocusFirstName(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_firstNameRF = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
    }

}

Focus hot key

By using attribute REQUESTFOCUSHOTKEY you can explicitly define some keyboard combination which the user may use to directly focus a certain component.

The hot key definition is valid throughout the whole dialog.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFocusHotkey}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:box id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="First field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_6" requestfocushotkey="ctrl-shift-49" tooltip="First" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_7" text="ctrl-shift-1" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Second field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" requestfocushotkey="ctrl-shift-50" tooltip="Second" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_11" text="ctrl-shift-2" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Third field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" requestfocushotkey="ctrl-shift-51" tooltip="Third" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_15" text="ctrl-shift-3" />
</t:row>
</t:box>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFocusHotkey}")

public class DemoFocusHotkey
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoFocusHotkey(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
    }

    @Override
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofocushotkey.jsp"; }
    @Override
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFocusHotkey}"; }
}

Use other keys than tab/shift-tab

The default key for moving the focus are "tab" and "shift-tab".

You can override by control in the following way:

(.) by setting attribute TABONENTER to "true" the focus will also be moved using "enter" and "shift-enter".
(.) you may set individual hot-key-definitions via attributes FOCUSNEXTHOTKEY and FOCUSPREVIOUSHOTKEY for navigating to the next/previous focus-able component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFocusTabHotkeys}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFocusTabHotkeys}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_4" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Default: use tab/shift-tab" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_7" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_10" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_13" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_15" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Enter key in addition to tab/shift-tab" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_18" tabonenter="true" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_21" tabonenter="true" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_24" tabonenter="true" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_26" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Explizit next/previous hot keys in addtion to tab/shift-tab" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_29" focusnexthotkey="40" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_30" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_31" text="cursor-down" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_34" focusnexthotkey="40" focusprevioushotkey="38" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_35" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_36" text="cursor-down/cursor-up" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_39" focusnexthotkey="40" focusprevioushotkey="38" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_40" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_41" text="cursor-down/cursor-up" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:label id="g_43" text="Some field" width="100+" />
<t:field id="g_44" focusprevioushotkey="38" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_45" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_46" text="cursor-up" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFocusTabHotkeys}")

public class DemoFocusTabHotkeys
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoFocusTabHotkeys(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofocustabhotkeys.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFocusTabHotkeys}"; }
}

Mouse over events

Example

When setting attribute PANE-WITHMOUSEOVEREVENT to "true" then the pane will send two events to the server side processing:

1. "mouseover" - this is event is not immediately thrown if the user moves the mouse over the pane, but it is thrown if the user stays with the mouse on top of the pane for a certain duration.

2. "mouseout" - this event is thrown if the user leaves the pane AND if there was a "mouseover" event before.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMouseOver}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMouseOver}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_4" text="Move the mouse on top of the images below - afte some while the image will be taken over into the background." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_15" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_17" >
<t:image id="g_7" height="100%" image="#{d.DemoMouseOver.selectedImage}" keepratiofitmode="cover" width="100%" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_18" height="100%" width="100%" x="0" y="0" zindex="1" >
<t:pane id="g_5" padding="10" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:pane id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoMouseOver.onPane1Action}" background="#00000010" border="#c0c0c0" height="150" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="150" withmouseoverevent="true" >
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:image id="g_8" height="100%" image="/images/pictures/riscBackground2.jpg" keepratiofitmode="cover" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pane id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoMouseOver.onPane2Action}" animatechangeofsize="true" background="#00000010" border="#c0c0c0" height="150" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="150" withmouseoverevent="true" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:image id="g_12" height="100%" image="/images/pictures/riscBackground1.jpg" keepratiofitmode="cover" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventMouseOut;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventMouseOver;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMouseOver}")

public class DemoMouseOver
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_selectedImage;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMouseOver(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomouseover.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMouseOver}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onPane1Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_selectedImage = "/images/pictures/riscBackground2.jpg";
    }

    public void onPane2Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_selectedImage = "/images/pictures/riscBackground1.jpg";
    }

    public String getSelectedImage() { return m_selectedImage; }
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Style and Language Management

Session style & language

Change the style or the language by pressing the corresponding button. Then open another page and you will see according changes.

There are only very few pages translated at the moment. For checking the language open the page "Arranging Pages - Modal Dialogs" and open the default dialogs (e.g. Yes/No dialog).

Both style and language management are documented within the Developers' Guide. Please read details there.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle}" rowdistance="3" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="#{rr.literals[&#39;lblStyleSelection&#39;]}" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onStyleAction}" text="default" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onStyleAction}" reference="defaultrisc" text="defaultrisc" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onStyleAction}" reference="defaultlightbluerisc" text="defaultlightbluerisc" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="#{rr.literals.lblLanguageSelection}" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onLanguageEnglish}" text="#{rr.literals[&#39;lblEnglish&#39;]}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onLanguageGerman}" text="#{rr.literals[&#39;lblGerman&#39;]}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_20" placeholder="Country" text="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.country}" width="70" />
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="5" />
<t:field id="g_22" placeholder="Language" text="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.language}" width="70" />
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchstyle.onLocaleChange}" text="Switch" width="120" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.Locale;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.SessionInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoSwitchstyle extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_country;
    String m_language;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoSwitchstyle(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getCountry() { return m_country; } 
    public void setCountry(String country) { m_country = country; }
    
    public String getLanguage() { return m_language; } 
    public void setLanguage(String language) { m_language = language; }

    public void onStyleAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        String styleName = ((BaseActionEvent)ae).getSourceReference();
        if (styleName == null) styleName = SessionInfo.getSessionDefaultStyleForRISCClient();
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentStyle(styleName);
    }
    
    public void onLanguageEnglish(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentLocale(new Locale("en","US"));
        m_country = "en";
        m_language = "US";
    }
    
    public void onLanguageGerman(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentLocale(new Locale("de","DE"));
        m_country = "de";
        m_language = "DE";
    }
    
    public void onLocaleChange(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_country == null || m_language == null)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Please define both country and language.");
            return;
        }
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentLocale(new Locale(m_country,m_language));
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------    

}

Client localization

The CLIENTCONFIG component provides two attribute COUNTRY and LANGUAGE, by which you can set the client localization.

The country is the one that defines the formatting of certain values. You may either choose a concrete country or you may use one of the "CCTYPE"-countries which represent some oftenly used formatting.

The language is the one that defines the text output of all client components (e.g. the CALENDARFIELD).

Countries and languages are defined via XML files within the eclnt/risc/i18n directory of your web application.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:clientconfig id="g_2" country="#{d.DemoClientLocale.clientCountry}" language="#{d.DemoClientLocale.clientLanguage}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClientLocale}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Country" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_6" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoClientLocale.countryVVS}" value="#{d.DemoClientLocale.country}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Language" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_9" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoClientLocale.languageVVS}" value="#{d.DemoClientLocale.language}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoClientLocale.onSetLocaleAction}" text="Set locale" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="50" />
<t:rowline id="g_14" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_17" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some sample components" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_20" text="...in which client internationalization settings are applied..." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Calendar field" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_24" value="2374623874675" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="Formatted field" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_27" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" value="123456.99" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Formatted label" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_30" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" text="123456.99" width="120+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientI18NReader;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClientLocale}")

public class DemoClientLocale
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_clientCountry;
    String m_clientLanguage;
    ValidValuesBinding m_languageVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    ValidValuesBinding m_countryVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_country;
    String m_language;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoClientLocale(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        // get current localization of client
        m_language = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getHeader("eclnt-language");
        m_country = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getHeader("eclnt-country");
        // load combo boxes
        List<String> countries = new ArrayList<String>(ClientI18NReader.getCountries());
        Collections.sort(countries);
        List<String> languages = new ArrayList<String>(ClientI18NReader.getLanguages());
        Collections.sort(languages);
        for (String country: countries)
            m_countryVVS.addValidValue(country,country);
        for (String language: languages)
            m_languageVVS.addValidValue(language,language);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democlientlocale.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoClientLocale}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getClientCountry() { return m_clientCountry; }
    public String getClientLanguage() { return m_clientLanguage; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getLanguageVVS() { return m_languageVVS; }
    public ValidValuesBinding getCountryVVS() { return m_countryVVS; }

    public String getCountry() { return m_country; }
    public void setCountry(String value) { this.m_country = value; }

    public String getLanguage() { return m_language; }
    public void setLanguage(String value) { this.m_language = value; }

    public void onSetLocaleAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // transfer values from text fields into fields that
        // are referenced by client config
        m_clientLanguage = m_language;
        m_clientCountry = m_country;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Define runtime styles

Style definitions can be outsourced into the Stream store so that they are kept outside the webcontent.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStstStyleFiles}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:pane id="g_8" background="#00000008" height="100%" padding="10" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_1" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_6" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoStstStyleFiles.ststUI}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCRuntimeStyleEditor;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStstStyleFiles}")

public class DemoStstStyleFiles
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCRuntimeStyleEditor m_ststUI = new CCRuntimeStyleEditor();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoStstStyleFiles(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_ststUI.prepare("/workplace/workplaceRisc.jsp",null);
    }

    @Override
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demostststylefiles.jsp"; }
    @Override
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoStstStyleFiles}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCRuntimeStyleEditor getStstUI() { return m_ststUI; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Client Clipboard

Setting/Getting clipboard content

The CLIPBOARDSET component connects to the client side clipboard and simplifies the way of passing information into the clipboard.

In some browsers (IE 10/11) server-side content can be directly copied into the clipboard - in most browsers (Edge, Firefox, Chrome, ...) this is done via a helper dialog showing up. In the dialog the user can easily copy the text by pressing the ctrl-c key - which also closes the dialog.

There is a default CLIPBOARDSET component, that is automatically available on any page. This can be accessed by the Clipboard-class by using a static API.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:clipboardset id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoClipboard.triggerSET}" value="#{d.DemoClipboard.text}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClipboard}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textarea id="g_5" height="100" text="#{d.DemoClipboard.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoClipboard.onCopyTextToClipboard}" text="Copy Text to Clipboard" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Clipboard;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventClipboardGet;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClipboard}")

public class DemoClipboard
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_text = "Some\ttext";
    protected Trigger m_triggerSET = new Trigger();
    
    public DemoClipboard(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public Trigger getTriggerSET() { return m_triggerSET; }
    public void setTriggerSET(Trigger value) { m_triggerSET = value; }

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { m_text = value; }

    public void onCopyTextToClipboard(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_triggerSET.trigger();
    }

}

Tool Tips / User Hints

Direct text definition

The attribute TOOLTIP is available for (nearly) all components, that are optical components.

You either define a straight text - or you define simple HTML text. HTML text needs to be defined as "<html>....</html>".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTooltip}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="Move the cursor on top of the following fields - a tool tip will show up." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Default" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" tooltip="Straight tooltip." width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="HTML based" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" tooltip="&lt;html&gt;&lt;h2&gt;HTML based tooltip&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;The text of this tooltip is an HTML text. The tooltip is not rendered by the browser&#39;s tooltip management but is rendered by some own tooltip.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Please note: the text of the tooltip is HTML-sanitized prior to being displayes in the tooltip window. This is due to preventing JavaScript injection.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/html&gt;" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTooltip extends PageBean
{
    public DemoTooltip(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

Tooltip - popup sizing

If using HTML based tooltips, then some own popup is opened by the CaptainCasa client framework.

The sizing of the tooltip popup depends on the text content of the HTML tooltip. In the style of style class "riscuserhint_textpane" there is a definition of a width/height-ration (value "_popupAspectRatio"). The sizing tries to find a size fitting to this ratio, starting with a minimum width of 300 pixels.

You may also directly define a size in the text by starting your text with "<html data-tooltipwidth='xxx'>". Please pay attention: the text has to exactly start with this phrase - no variations ara allowed!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTooltipHtmlSizing}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTooltipHtmlSizing}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_7" labeltext="Field with standard tooltip" text="Some text..." tooltip="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:field id="g_10" labeltext="Field with short HTML tooltip" text="Some text..." tooltip="&lt;html&gt;Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor.&lt;/html&gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:field id="g_13" labeltext="Field with long HTML tooltip" text="Some text..." tooltip="&lt;html&gt;Lorem &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;ipsum&lt;/span&gt; dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;dolores&lt;/span&gt; et ea rebum.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;labore&lt;/span&gt; et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum.&lt;/html&gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:field id="g_16" labeltext="Field with even longer HTML tooltip" text="Some text..." tooltip="&lt;html&gt;Lorem &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;ipsum&lt;/span&gt; dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;dolores&lt;/span&gt; et ea rebum.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;labore&lt;/span&gt; et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum.Lorem &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;ipsum&lt;/span&gt; dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;dolores&lt;/span&gt; et ea rebum.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;labore&lt;/span&gt; et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum.&lt;/html&gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:field id="g_22" labeltext="Field with HTML tooltip, width of popup explicitly defined" text="Some text..." tooltip="&lt;html data-tooltipwidth=&#39;200&#39;&gt;Lorem &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;ipsum&lt;/span&gt; dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;dolores&lt;/span&gt; et ea rebum.Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut &lt;span style=&#39;font-size:30px&#39;&gt;labore&lt;/span&gt; et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum.&lt;/html&gt;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTooltipHtmlSizing}")

public class DemoTooltipHtmlSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoTooltipHtmlSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotooltiphtmlsizing.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTooltipHtmlSizing}"; }
}

Programmed tooltip

You may explicitly take over the tooltip management by a server side implementation. To do so define the attribute TOOLTIP as "server:true". As result you will receive two corresponding events for opening and closing the tooltip.

The popup dialogs that you may open up, can be designed without any restrictions. - Of course you may not open up a popup at all, but e.g. also show some information in another area of the screen as reaction on the tooltip processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Move the mouse over the fields..." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_10" text="In this example the popup disappears immediately when the user moves the mouse out of the componnent area." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true;closedelay:1000;opendelay:300" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_17" text="In this example the popup disappears after a certain period of time when the user moves the mouse out of the componnent area. The period of time is defined by the definition &#34;closedelay:xxx&#34; in the TOOLTIP attribute." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_18" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Some field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer.onFieldAction}" tooltip="server:true;keeppopup:true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_24" text="In this example the popup does not disappear if the user navigates into the popup itself - but it only disappears if the user moves the mouse either out of the field or out of the popup. This is done due to 2 definitions: 1. the definition &#34;keeppopup:true&#34; in the TOOLTIP attribute and 2. the defintion setCloseOnMouseExit(true) in the code when opening the tooltip popup." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEventTooltipEnded;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEventTooltipStarted;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}")

public class DemoToolTipByServer
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DemoToolTipByServerPopup m_tooltipPopup = null;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoToolTipByServer(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotooltipbyserver.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoToolTipByServer}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onFieldAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventTooltipStarted)
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Tooltip started");
            if (m_tooltipPopup == null)
            {
                m_tooltipPopup = new DemoToolTipByServerPopup();
                ModelessPopup mp = openModelessPopup(m_tooltipPopup,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
                {
                    public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                    {
                        closePopup(m_tooltipPopup);
                        m_tooltipPopup = null;
                    }
                });
                mp.setUndecorated(true);
                mp.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
                mp.setCloseonmouseexit(true);
                mp.setLeftTopMousePosition(true);
            }
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventTooltipEnded)
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Tooltip ended");
            if (m_tooltipPopup != null)
            {
                closePopup(m_tooltipPopup);
                m_tooltipPopup = null;
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

User hint - more dynamic...

This example shows a usage variant of the USERHINT attribute.

1. The USERHINT attributes are dynamically set.
2. When pressing the Check-button then all user hints are shown. Once the user steps through the fields they disappear.

There is a corresponding USERHINTTRIGGER attribute. If triggered then the corresponding user hint is shown. In the example both FIELDs refer to the same trigger property.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.onFirstNameAction}" bgpaint="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.firstNameBgpaint}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.firstName}" userhint="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.firstNameUserHint}" userhinttrigger="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.userHintTrigger}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.onLastNameAction}" bgpaint="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.lastNameBgpaint}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.lastName}" userhint="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.lastNameUserHint}" userhinttrigger="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.userHintTrigger}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger.onCheckAction}" text="Check data" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoUserHintTrigger}")

public class DemoUserHintTrigger
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public void onLastNameAction(ActionEvent event) { check(); }
    public void onFirstNameAction(ActionEvent event) { check(); }

    Trigger m_userHintTrigger = new Trigger();

    String m_firstNameUserHint;
    String m_lastNameUserHint;
    String m_lastNameBgpaint;
    String m_firstNameBgpaint;

    protected String m_firstName = "Test";
    protected String m_lastName = "Test";
        
    public DemoUserHintTrigger(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        onCheckAction(null);
    }
    
    public Trigger getUserHintTrigger() { return m_userHintTrigger; }
    
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstNameUserHint() { return m_firstNameUserHint; }
    public String getLastNameUserHint() { return m_lastNameUserHint; }
    public String getLastNameBgpaint() { return m_lastNameBgpaint; }
    public String getFirstNameBgpaint() { return m_firstNameBgpaint; }

    public void onCheckAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        boolean success = check();
        if (success == false)
        {
            m_userHintTrigger.trigger();
        }
    }

    private boolean check()
    {
        boolean result = true;
        m_lastNameBgpaint = null;
        m_lastNameUserHint = null;
        m_firstNameBgpaint = null;
        m_firstNameUserHint = null;
        if (m_firstName == null || m_firstName.length()<10)
        {
            m_firstNameUserHint = "Please input at least 10 characters.";
            m_firstNameBgpaint = "error()";
            result = false;
        }
        if (m_lastName == null || m_lastName.length()<20)
        {
            m_lastNameUserHint = "Please input at least 20 characters.";
            m_lastNameBgpaint = "error()";
            result = false;
        }
        return result;
    }
}

General Issues

Complex expressions

An expression binds a component attribute to some Java property.

By default we recommend to use straight expressions - so that the full logic of a dialog is contained in the corresponding server side class.

For certain, limited scenarios we "allow" to use certain complex expressions as well. - Please strictly keep to the expressions that are listed in this example: CaptainCasa only guarantees these ones to properly work!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoExpressions}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoExpressions}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_60" >
<t:pane id="g_61" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_58" >
<t:label id="g_126" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Straight expressions - the preferred way..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_80" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someName}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someName}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_62" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_63" >
<t:pane id="g_64" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Valid complex expressions" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" font="weight:bold" text="1. Concatenations" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" foreground="#808080" text="AAA # {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="AAA #{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_28" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" foreground="#808080" text="AAA # {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB # {d.DemoExpressions.someName} CCC" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="AAA #{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB #{d.DemoExpressions.someName} CCC" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_65" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB # {d.DemoExpressions.someName} CCC" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber} BBB #{d.DemoExpressions.someName} CCC" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_66" >
<t:pane id="g_67" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:label id="g_35" font="weight:bold" text="2. ==/!= Comparison with fix value" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber == 0}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber == 0}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_40" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_41" >
<t:label id="g_42" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someNumber != 0}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:label id="g_44" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someNumber != 0}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_45" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:label id="g_47" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someName == &#39;Captain&#39;}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_48" >
<t:label id="g_49" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someName == &#39;Captain&#39;}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_50" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_51" >
<t:label id="g_52" foreground="#808080" text="# {d.DemoExpressions.someName == &#39;CaptainCasa&#39;}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_53" >
<t:label id="g_54" text="#{d.DemoExpressions.someName == &#39;CaptainCasa&#39;}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_102" >
<t:pane id="g_103" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_104" >
<t:label id="g_105" font="weight:bold" text="1. and 2. within grid processing:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_106" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_107" objectbinding="#{d.DemoExpressions.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_108" text="Straight first" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_109" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_110" text="Straight last" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_111" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_112" text="Height" width="50" >
<t:label id="g_113" text=".{height}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_114" text="Concatenated" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_115" text="AAA .{firstName} BBB" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_116" text="Concatenated" width="150" >
<t:label id="g_117" text=".{lastName}, .{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_118" text="Height set" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_119" text=".{height != 0}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_128" >
<t:pane id="g_129" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_130" >
<t:label id="g_131" font="weight:bold" text="1. and 2. within repeat processing" />
</t:row>
<t:repeat id="g_132" listbinding="#{d.DemoExpressions.persons}" >
<t:row id="g_133" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_134" text=".{firstName}" />
<t:label id="g_135" text="/" />
<t:label id="g_136" text=".{lastName}" />
<t:label id="g_137" text="/" />
<t:label id="g_138" text=".{height}" />
<t:label id="g_139" text="/" />
<t:label id="g_140" text="AAA .{firstName} BBB" />
<t:label id="g_141" text="/" />
<t:label id="g_142" text=".{lastName}, .{firstName}" />
<t:label id="g_143" text="/" />
<t:label id="g_144" text=".{height != 0}" />
</t:row>
</t:repeat>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoExpressions}")

public class DemoExpressions
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        int i_height;
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public void setHeight(int value) { this.i_height = value; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    public class PersonsItem extends Object implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        int i_height;
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public int getHeight() { return i_height; }
        public void setHeight(int value) { this.i_height = value; }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_someNumber = 0;
    String m_someName = "Captain";
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    List<PersonsItem> m_persons = new ArrayList<PersonsItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoExpressions(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initGridData();
        initListData();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoexpressions.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoExpressions}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public List<PersonsItem> getPersons() { return m_persons; }

    public String getSomeName() { return m_someName; }
    public void setSomeName(String value) { this.m_someName = value; }

    public int getSomeNumber() { return m_someNumber; }
    public void setSomeNumber(int value) { this.m_someNumber = value; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initGridData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            if (i % 5 == 0)
                gi.setHeight(80);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
    
    private void initListData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            PersonsItem gi = new PersonsItem();
            gi.setFirstName(RandomLogic.getFirstName());
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            if (i % 5 == 0)
                gi.setHeight(80);
            m_persons.add(gi);
        }
    }

}

Character Input

CaptainCasa is 100% based on unicode.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChars}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Enter unicocde value " width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" format="int" value="#{d.DemoChars.input}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoChars.onShowInput}" text="OK" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoChars.output}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_10" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Start value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_14" format="int" value="#{d.DemoChars.startValue}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoChars.onShowValues}" text="OK" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:pane id="g_18" componentbinding="#{d.DemoChars.dynPane}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.LABELComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.LABELComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.PANEComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChars}")

public class DemoChars
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected int m_startValue = 160;
    protected String m_input;
    protected String m_output;
    protected PANEComponent m_dynPane = new PANEComponent();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChars(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        showValues();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getInput() { return m_input; }
    public void setInput(String value) { m_input = value; }
    
    public void setOutput(String value) { m_output = value; }
    public String getOutput() { return m_output; }
    
    public int getStartValue() { return m_startValue; }
    public void setStartValue(int value) { m_startValue = value; }

    public void setDynPane(PANEComponent value) 
    { 
        if (m_dynPane == value)
            return;
        m_dynPane = value; 
        showValues();
    }

    public void onShowInput(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        int inputInt = ValueManager.decodeInt(m_input,65);
        m_output = "" + (char)inputInt;
    }

    public void onShowValues(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_startValue < 0)
            m_startValue = 0;
        showValues();
    }
