    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void showValues()
    {
        if (m_dynPane == null)
            return;
        m_dynPane.getChildren().clear();
        int counter = m_startValue;
        for (int i=0; i<25; i++)
        {
            ROWComponentTag rt = new ROWComponentTag();
            BaseComponent rc = rt.createBaseComponent();
            m_dynPane.getChildren().add(rc);
            for (int j=0; j<4; j++)
            {
                LABELComponentTag lt;
                lt = new LABELComponentTag();
                lt.setText(counter+"");
                lt.setWidth("60");
                rc.getChildren().add(lt.createBaseComponent());
                lt = new LABELComponentTag();
                lt.setText(""+(char)counter);
                lt.setWidth("20");
                rc.getChildren().add(lt.createBaseComponent());
                counter++;
            }
        }
    }
    
}

Error Management

The demo demonstrates how errors (which should never happen of course... ;-) ...) are managed on server and on client side.

The one category of errors is, that something on the way from the client to the server and back happened: this can reach from connection failures to errors on server side. In the example the server causes an Error that is thrown.

The second category of errors is, that something happens on client side. This should only happen if the XML layout definition that is received by the client is not properly formed. (Note: You can build up the page's XML dynamically...!)

In both cases it is essential to have a look onto the server and the client log that is written.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoError}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoError.firstName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_7" font="size:10" text="When defining value &#34;error&#34; then an error is thrown within the corresponding set-method on server side." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="2" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.demoError.onThrowError}" text="Throw error on server side" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoError.onThrowSevereError}" text="Throw severe error on server side" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;
import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ApplicationErrorInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ApplicationErrorInfoDuringSet;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIELDComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.PANEComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IErrorAware;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;



public class DemoError 
    extends PageBean
    implements IErrorAware
{
    PANEComponent m_pane;
    String m_firstName;
    
    public DemoError(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void setFirstName(String value) 
    { 
        m_firstName = value; 
        if ("error".equalsIgnoreCase(value) || "severeerror".equalsIgnoreCase(value))
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("throwing severe error during set");
            throw new Error("What a strange value!");
        }
    }
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    
    public PANEComponent getPane() { return m_pane; }
    public void setPane(PANEComponent pane) { m_pane = pane; }
    
    public void onThrowError(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("throwing error");
        throw new Error("This error was thrown on server side.");
    }
    
    public void onThrowSevereError(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("throwing severe error");
        throw new Error("SEVERE ERROR");
    }
    
    // Please NOTE: in the demo workplace there is also a second level of catching errors - on
    // dispatcher level. Because top-levels override the lower levels, there are the same 
    // checks for SEVERE ERRPRs within the Dispatcher.java-class
    
    public void onApplicationErrorDuringSet(ApplicationErrorInfoDuringSet aeids)
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("managing error during set");
        Statusbar.outputError("Error occurred on server side during setting a property value: " + aeids.getException());
        if ("severeerror".equals(m_firstName))
            throw new Error("Sever error is too much...!");
    }
    
    public void onApplicationError(ApplicationErrorInfo aei)
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("managing severe error");
        Throwable t = aei.getException();
        if (t.getMessage().indexOf("SEVERE ERROR") >= 0)
            throw new Error(t);
        Statusbar.outputError("Error occurred on server side during invocation of method: " + t);
    }
    
}

Long lasting Operations

On server side the processing is passed to a thread which runs aside the request thread. Consequence: a quick response is given to the user, the user does not have to wait for the execution of the processing thread.

The processing thread writes information into a log. Because all communication via http is a request based communication there is a polling - which is programmed to stop when the server side processing thread is finished.

The polling is done in the following way:

(.) There is the method AsynchMessageBus.addMessage("demoPolling()") on server side. This sends - as part of the repsonse - an event to the client. The event has a command (the name) and may have parameters.

(.) On client side there is a component MESSAGELISTENER that is part of the layout definition. Within the component the attribute COMMANDFILTER specifies the events that the component is interested in. There is the attribute DELAY that specifies a time (in ms) to wait until an actionListener is called on server side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:blocker id="g_1" blocked="#{d.DemoPolling.blocked}" />
<t:beanprocessing id="g_2" >
  <t:messagelistener id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.demoPolling.onSynchronize}" commandfilter="demoPolling" delay="3000" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.demoPolling}" >
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoPolling.onStartOperation}" enabled="#{d.demoPolling.buttonEnabled}" text="Start long lasting Operation" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_8" >
    <t:label id="g_9" text="Activity Log" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_10" >
    <t:textarea id="g_11" background="#{d.demoPolling.logBackground}" height="200" text="#{d.demoPolling.log}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_12" />
  <t:row id="g_13" >
    <t:label id="g_14" text="Screen blocked" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_15" >
    <t:field id="g_16" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoPolling.blocked}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.AsynchMessageBus;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass(expressionBase="#{d.demoPolling}")

public class DemoPolling extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    class LongLastingOperation extends Thread
    {
        boolean i_finished = false;
        public void run()
        {
            for (int i=0; i<8; i++)
            {
                try { Thread.currentThread().sleep(1000); } catch (Throwable t) {}
                m_log = m_log +     "Step " + (i+1) + " of 8 was executed.\n";
            }
            m_log = m_log + "...finished!";
            i_finished = true;
            m_blocked = false;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_log = "";
    boolean m_blocked = false;
    LongLastingOperation m_llop;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPolling(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void setLog(String value) { m_log = value; }
    public String getLog() { return m_log; }
    
    public boolean getBlocked() { return m_blocked; }
    
    public void onStartOperation(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        // avoid double starting
        if (m_llop != null && m_llop.i_finished == false)
            return;
        // start
        m_llop = new LongLastingOperation();
        m_log = "Started operation...\n";
        m_llop.start();
        triggerNextPolling();
        m_blocked = true;
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Long running server side operation was started.");
    }
    
    public void onSynchronize(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        triggerNextPolling();
    }
    
    public boolean getButtonEnabled()
    {
        if (m_llop == null || m_llop.i_finished == true)
            return true;
        else
            return false;
    }
    
    public String getLogBackground()
    {
        if (m_llop == null || m_llop.i_finished == true)
            return "#FFFFFF";
        else
            return "#FFE0E0";
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void triggerNextPolling()
    {
        if (m_llop.i_finished == true)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Long lasting operation was successfully executed.");
            return;
        }
        AsynchMessageBus.addMessage("demoPolling()");
    }

}

Online Help

Online help is available for all input components: if the user pressed the F1 key within a focussed component then corresponding help shwows up.

Each component can be associated with the online help by defining the HELPID attribute within the component. Behind the HELPID value there is a resolution of a text, which can either be a plain text, an HTML text or an RTF text. Because of using the Swing brwoser component by default, only limited formatting elements are applicable when using HTML or RTF as content type.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" helpid="demoonlinehelp" objectbinding="#{d.demoOnlinehelp}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" helpid="firstName" text="First Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_4" helpid="firstName" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" helpid="lastName" text="Last Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_7" helpid="lastName" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" helpid="lastName" text="Street" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_10" helpid="street" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" helpid="married" text="Married" width="120" />
<t:checkbox id="g_13" helpid="married" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_16" helpid="btnSave" text="Save" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:textpane id="g_19" text="You can use the HELPICON component in order to place dedicated help texts into you dialog." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="120" />
<t:helpicon id="g_22" helpid="specialHelp" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoOnlinehelp extends PageBean
{
    public DemoOnlinehelp(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

Server Roundtrips

Flushing... - this is the selection of the point of time when changes on the client side are communicated to the server processing.

User input controls (fields, checkbox, radio button, multi line fields) do not flush data to the client when being changed. The data is kept on client side and waits for the next flush, coming from another component. Typical example: a long list of fields with a button - the user inputs the fields and explicitly presses a button when finished.

But you can override this behaviour. The FLUSH attribute of a component needs to be set to "true". In this case check boxes, radio buttons ("clickable" components) directly cause a server flushing when being changed. Fields also flush, but they wait for the user leaving the field (focusLost event).

With field components there is a special attribute: FLUSHTIMER. With this attribute you can define a duration in milliseconds. When the user changes the content of a field and stays waiting in the field, then after this duration a flush to the server is done.

On server side the flush is passed into a corresponding action listener of the component. The event object is of type BaseActionEventFlush.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoFlush}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="No flush (default)" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="noflush" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_6" text="Synch!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Flush when leaving field" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="flush" flush="true" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Autoflush after 1000 ms" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="flushtimer" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoFlush extends PageBean
{
    String m_searchName;
    
    public DemoFlush(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field"); 
    }
    
    public void setSearchName(String value) { m_searchName = value; }
    public String getSearchName() { return m_searchName; }
    
    public void onSearchNameAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Flush on searchName: content now is " + m_searchName);
    }
}

Unicode

All literals and values that are managed within CaptainCasa Enterprise Client are managed as Unicode characters - both inside the Java programming (which is default in Java) and within the communication, that is based on UTF-8.

Please note that the whole client can be started in righ-to-left mode as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.demoUnicode}" >
  <t:row id="g_4" >
    <t:label id="g_5" text="   " width="100" />
    <t:field id="g_6" text="   " width="100" />
    <t:coldistance id="g_7" />
    <t:button id="g_8" text="   " />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_9" >
    <t:tabbedpane id="g_10" height="100" width="100%" >
      <t:tabbedpanetab id="g_11" text="   " />
    </t:tabbedpane>
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_13" >
    <t:label id="g_14" text=" " width="100" />
    <t:field id="g_15" text=" " width="100" />
    <t:coldistance id="g_16" />
    <t:button id="g_17" text=" " />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_18" >
    <t:tabbedpane id="g_19" height="100" width="100%" >
      <t:tabbedpanetab id="g_20" text=" " />
    </t:tabbedpane>
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_22" >
    <t:label id="g_23" text="" width="100" />
    <t:field id="g_24" text="" width="100" />
    <t:coldistance id="g_25" />
    <t:button id="g_26" text="" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_27" >
    <t:tabbedpane id="g_28" height="100" width="100%" >
      <t:tabbedpanetab id="g_29" text="" />
    </t:tabbedpane>
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoUnicode extends PageBean
{
    public DemoUnicode(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

#{rr.literals['tiSwitchLangauge']}

This demo shows how to switch between different languages/country settings - both on server side and on client side.

(.) The server side switch ("application level") is done through the view root of the FacesContext.
(.) The client side switch ("client level") is done through the CLIENTCONFIG.

The CLIENTCONFIG component is not contained within this .jps definition - but is contained in the out-most jsp-page (workplace/workplace.jsp). In general the CLIENTCONFIG definition should be "as outmost as possible".

The reload is required in this case, in which you want to re-render all existing components on client side. Otherwise changes are only applied to newly created components.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="#{rr.literals.lblLanguage}" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" bgpaint="mandatory()" text="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale.language}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="#{rr.literals.lblCountry}" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" bgpaint="mandatory()" text="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale.country}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale.onSwitch}" text="#{rr.literals.btnSwitch}" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale.onSwitchToGerman}" text="#{rr.literals.btnSwitchToGerman}" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale.onSwitchToEnglish}" text="#{rr.literals.btnSwitchToEnglish}" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_19" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_23" clockformat="dateLong" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Locale;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSwitchLocale}")

/*
 * The CLIENTCONFIG should be defined in the "outmost" page. In the demo workplace
 * this is the workplace.jsp page. The data for passing the language and country settings
 * are kept on central dispatcher level.
 */
public class DemoSwitchLocale
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_country;
    String m_language;

    public String getCountry() { return m_country; } 
    public void setCountry(String country) { m_country = country; }

    public String getLanguage() { return m_language; } 
    public void setLanguage(String language) { m_language = language; }

    public DemoSwitchLocale(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        updateFieldsFromServerLocale();
    }

    public void onSwitchToEnglish(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Locale l = new Locale("en","US");
        switchServerAndClientLocale(l);
    }

    public void onSwitchToGerman(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Locale l = new Locale("de","DE");
        switchServerAndClientLocale(l);
    }

    public void onSwitch(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Locale l = new Locale(m_language,m_country);
        switchServerAndClientLocale(l);
    }
    
    private void switchServerAndClientLocale(Locale l)
    {
        // switch the server side language
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentLocale(l);
        // in addition (optional): switch client side locale
        ((Dispatcher)getOwningDispatcher()).defineClientConfigLocale(l);
        getWorkpageContainer().getFunctionsManager().importWorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode("default");
        HttpSessionAccess.reloadClient();
        updateFieldsFromServerLocale();
    }

    private void updateFieldsFromServerLocale()
    {
        Locale l = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentLocale();
        m_country = l.getCountry();
        m_language = l.getLanguage();
    }

}

Change Style Variant at Runtime

Select a style variant by using the combo box and the field below will be updated accordingly.

From update 20131014 on style variants can be assigned dynamically - and can be changed at runtime.

This means a significant improvement when using style variants. Typically a style variant represents a certain semantics, e.g. "key fields" are rendered differently to "normal fields". If the semantics of a component now changes, the style variant can follow accordingly.

When defining corresponding style variants (Swing: style.xml, FX: fx.css and style.xml) please note that component attributes that are marked as "FIX" in the layout editor cannot be changed at runtime due to assigning a different style variant.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" font="size:14" text="Pick style variant of field dynamically" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Style Variant" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_3" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange.buttonStyleVariantVVS}" value="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange.buttonStyleVariant}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" stylevariant="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange.buttonStyleVariant}" text="Some text" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" font="size:14" text="Style variant defined by item" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" rendered="true" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_17" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Column" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_20" stylevariant=".{styleVariant}" text=".{text}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange}")

public class DemoStyleVariantChange
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_text;
        public String getText() { return m_text; }
        public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

        String m_styleVariant;
        public String getStyleVariant() { return m_styleVariant; }
        public void setStyleVariant(String value) { this.m_styleVariant = value; }

    }

    ValidValuesBinding m_buttonStyleVariantVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_buttonStyleVariant = "RED";
    String[] VARIANTS = new String[] {"RED","GREEN","BLUE"};

    public DemoStyleVariantChange(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_buttonStyleVariantVVS.addValidValue("RED","RED");
        m_buttonStyleVariantVVS.addValidValue("GREEN","GREEN");
        m_buttonStyleVariantVVS.addValidValue("BLUE","BLUE");
        m_buttonStyleVariantVVS.addValidValue(null,"null (default)");
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem g = new GridItem();
            String styleVariant = VARIANTS[i%VARIANTS.length];
            g.setText("Text " + i + " / " + styleVariant);
            g.setStyleVariant(styleVariant);
            m_grid.getItems().add(g);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demostylevariantchange.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoStyleVariantChange}"; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getButtonStyleVariantVVS() { return m_buttonStyleVariantVVS; }
    
    public String getButtonStyleVariant() { return m_buttonStyleVariant; }
    public void setButtonStyleVariant(String value) { this.m_buttonStyleVariant = value; }

}

Attribute RENDERED

The attribute RENDERED is available on most of the components. If set to "false", typically using a binding to a managed bean, then the corresponding component will not be sent to the client at all - and as consequence will not be rendered onto the user's screen.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoRendered}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.rendered}" text="First Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_4" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoRendered.onChangeRendered}" text="Toggle label" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pane id="g_10" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="This is the first row" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_13" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.rowRendered}" />
<t:row id="g_15" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.rowRendered}" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="This is the second row" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_17" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="This is the third row" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_21" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_22" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.demoRendered.onChangeRowRendered}" text="Toggle second row" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_27" height="100" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_28" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.leftTabRendered}" text="Left" />
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_29" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.rightTabRendered}" text="Right" />
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:checkbox id="g_31" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoRendered.leftTabRendered}" text="Render left tab" />
<t:checkbox id="g_32" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoRendered.rightTabRendered}" text="Render right tab" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_33" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:checkbox id="g_35" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoRendered.paneRendered}" text="Render Pane" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:pane id="g_37" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#F0F0F0,#E0E0E0,vertical)" height="100" rendered="#{d.demoRendered.paneRendered}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="Label inside the pane" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoRendered extends PageBean
{
    boolean m_rendered = true;
    boolean m_rowRendered = true;
    boolean m_leftTabRendered = true;
    boolean m_rightTabRendered = true;
    boolean m_paneRendered = false;
    
    public DemoRendered(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public boolean getRendered() { return m_rendered; }
    public void setRendered(boolean value) { m_rendered = value; }
    
    public boolean getRowRendered() { return m_rowRendered; }
    public void setRowRendered(boolean value) { m_rowRendered = value; }

    public boolean getLeftTabRendered() { return m_leftTabRendered; }
    public void setLeftTabRendered(boolean leftTabRendered) { m_leftTabRendered = leftTabRendered; }
    
    public boolean getRightTabRendered() { return m_rightTabRendered; }
    public void setRightTabRendered(boolean rightTabRendered) { m_rightTabRendered = rightTabRendered; }
    
    public boolean getPaneRendered() { return m_paneRendered; }
    public void setPaneRendered(boolean paneRendered) { m_paneRendered = paneRendered; }
    
    public void onChangeRendered(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_rendered = !m_rendered;
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Changed m_rendered to: " + m_rendered);
    }
    
    public void onChangeRowRendered(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_rowRendered = !m_rowRendered;
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Changed m_rowRendered to: " + m_rendered);
    }
    
}

Many Fields...

This page demonstrates the performance of pages with many contained elements. This page contains 200 fields, 200 labels, 200 rows, 100 column distances elements within the first tab.

When pressing the button then a server roundtrip will be initiated that updates all fields with random values.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.demoManyFields.onUpdateValues}" text="Update Values" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.demoManyFields}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Field 1" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_6" text="#{d.demoManyFields.fields.f1}" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="5" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="Field 2" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_9" text="#{d.demoManyFields.fields.f2}" width="50%" />
</t:row>

<t:row id="g_1108" >
<t:label id="g_1109" text="Field 9" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_1110" text="#{d.demoManyFields.fields.f9}" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_1111" width="5" />
<t:label id="g_1112" text="Field 0" width="120" />

</t:row>

</t:row>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoManyFields extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class FieldInfo
    {
        long m_f0;
        long m_f1;
        long m_f2;
        long m_f3;
        long m_f4;
        long m_f5;
        long m_f6;
        long m_f7;
        long m_f8;
        long m_f9;
        public long getF0()
        {
            return m_f0;
        }
        public void setF0(long f0)
        {
            m_f0 = f0;
        }
        public long getF1()
        {
            return m_f1;
        }
        public void setF1(long f1)
        {
            m_f1 = f1;
        }
        public long getF2()
        {
            return m_f2;
        }
        public void setF2(long f2)
        {
            m_f2 = f2;
        }
        public long getF3()
        {
            return m_f3;
        }
        public void setF3(long f3)
        {
            m_f3 = f3;
        }
        public long getF4()
        {
            return m_f4;
        }
        public void setF4(long f4)
        {
            m_f4 = f4;
        }
        public long getF5()
        {
            return m_f5;
        }
        public void setF5(long f5)
        {
            m_f5 = f5;
        }
        public long getF6()
        {
            return m_f6;
        }
        public void setF6(long f6)
        {
            m_f6 = f6;
        }
        public long getF7()
        {
            return m_f7;
        }
        public void setF7(long f7)
        {
            m_f7 = f7;
        }
        public long getF8()
        {
            return m_f8;
        }
        public void setF8(long f8)
        {
            m_f8 = f8;
        }
        public long getF9()
        {
            return m_f9;
        }
        public void setF9(long f9)
        {
            m_f9 = f9;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    private Map<String,String> m_fields = new HashMap<String,String>();
    private FieldInfo m_fieldInfo = new FieldInfo();
    private static int FIELD_COUNT = 200;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoManyFields(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        onUpdateValues(null);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public Map<String,String> getFields() { return m_fields; }
    public FieldInfo getFieldss() { return m_fieldInfo; }
    
    public void onUpdateValues(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        for (int i=0; i<FIELD_COUNT; i++)
            m_fields.put("f"+i,""+s_random.nextInt(99));
        m_fieldInfo.m_f0 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f1 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f2 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f3 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f4 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f5 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f6 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f7 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f8 = s_random.nextInt(99);
        m_fieldInfo.m_f9 = s_random.nextInt(99);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Many Columns...

This page demonstrates the performance of grids with many contained columns. The grid has 40 columns, each one being rendered as fully available field control (could also be combo box, radio button or any other control). The number of rows which are rendered as maximum is 20 (in this example).

On server side the number of rows is much higher. Only these rows are brought to client side which are visible to the user. We call this "server side scrolling".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.demoBigGrid.onUpdateData}" text="Update Data" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.demoBigGrid}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_98" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_4" text="Background color" >
<t:pane id="g_5" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_101" actionListener="#{d.DemoBigGrid.onBackgroundAllAction}" flush="true" group="BGCOLOR" refvalue="#FFFFFF" text="#FFFFFF No transparency" value="#{d.DemoBigGrid.backgroundAll}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoBigGrid.onBackgroundAllAction}" flush="true" group="BGCOLOR" refvalue="#FFFFFF80" text="#FFFFFF80 With transparency" value="#{d.DemoBigGrid.backgroundAll}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoBigGrid.onBackgroundAllAction}" flush="true" group="BGCOLOR" text="null" value="#{d.DemoBigGrid.backgroundAll}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_95" >
<t:spinner id="g_96" flush="true" labeltext="Number of fix columns " maxvalue="5" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoBigGrid.numberOfFixColumns}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoBigGrid.rows.onOpenGridFunctions}" text="Grid..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_13" avoidroundtrips="true" background="#C0C0FF" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.demoBigGrid.rows}" sbvisibleamount="20" selectorcolumn="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_14" align="right" text="Col 0" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_15" align="right" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c0}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Col 1" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_17" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c1}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Col 2" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_19" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c2}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_20" text="Col 3" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_21" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c3}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_22" text="Col 4" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_23" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c4}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_24" text="Col 5" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_25" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c5}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_26" text="Col 6" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_27" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c6}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_28" text="Col 7" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_29" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c7}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_30" text="Col 8" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_31" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c8}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_32" text="Col 9" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_33" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c9}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_34" text="Col 10" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_35" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c10}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_36" text="Col 11" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_37" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c11}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_38" text="Col 12" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_39" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c12}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_40" text="Col 13" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_41" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c13}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_42" text="Col 14" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_43" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c14}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_44" text="Col 15" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_45" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c15}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_46" text="Col 16" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_47" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c16}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_48" text="Col 17" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_49" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c17}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_50" text="Col 18" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_51" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c18}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_52" text="Col 19" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_53" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c19}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_54" text="Col 20" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_55" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c20}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_56" text="Col 21" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_57" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c21}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_58" text="Col 22" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_59" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c22}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_60" text="Col 23" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_61" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c23}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_62" text="Col 24" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_63" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c24}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_64" text="Col 25" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_65" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c25}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_66" text="Col 26" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_67" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c26}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_68" text="Col 27" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_69" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c27}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_70" text="Col 28" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_71" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c28}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_72" text="Col 29" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_73" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c29}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_74" text="Col 30" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_75" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c30}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_76" text="Col 31" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_77" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c31}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_78" text="Col 32" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_79" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c32}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_80" text="Col 33" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_81" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c33}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_82" text="Col 34" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_83" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c34}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_84" text="Col 35" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_85" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c35}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_86" text="Col 36" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_87" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c36}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_88" text="Col 37" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_89" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c37}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_90" text="Col 38" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_91" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c38}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_92" text="Col 39" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_93" background=".{background}" enabled=".{enabled}" text=".{v.c39}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IAcceleratedPropertyAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoBigGrid extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class Row 
        extends FIXGRIDItem
        implements IAcceleratedPropertyAccess
    {
        Map<String,Integer> m_v = new HashMap<String,Integer>();
        public Map<String,Integer> getV() { return m_v; }
        public String getBackground() { return getBackgroundAll(); }
        public boolean getEnabled() { return true; }
        // IAcceleratedPropertyAccess
        public Object getPropertyValue(String property)
        {
            if ("enabled".equals(property)) return true;
            if ("background".equals(property)) return getBackgroundAll();
            return NOT_AVAILABLE;
        }
    }
    
    public class MyGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<Row>
    {
        public boolean checkIfChangeIndexIsSupported()
        {
            return true;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static Random s_random = new Random();
    static int NUM_OF_ROWS = 100;
    static int NUM_OF_COLS = 40;
    MyGrid m_rows = new MyGrid();
    
    String m_backgroundAll = "#FFFFFF";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoBigGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // create rows
        for (int i=0; i<NUM_OF_ROWS; i++)
        {
            Row r = new Row();
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
        updateRowData();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public MyGrid getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public int getNumberOfFixColumns() { return m_rows.getNumberOfFixColumns(); } 
    public void setNumberOfFixColumns(int numberOfFixColumns) { m_rows.setNumberOfFixColumns(numberOfFixColumns); }

    public String getBackgroundAll() { return m_backgroundAll; }
    public void setBackgroundAll(String backgroundAll) { m_backgroundAll = backgroundAll; }

    public void onBackgroundAllAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        for (Row r: m_rows.getItems())
            r.getChangeIndex().indicateChange();
    }
    
    public void onUpdateData(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        updateRowData();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void updateRowData()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<NUM_OF_ROWS; i++)
        {
            Row r = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
            for (int j=0; j<NUM_OF_COLS; j++)
            {
                r.m_v.put("c"+j,s_random.nextInt(99));
                r.getChangeIndex().indicateChange();
            }
        }
    }

}

Many Grids...

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:button id="g_2" text="button" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowbodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_5" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_6" padding="10" text="TAB1" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_7" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPerformance2.dyn1}" />
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_9" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_10" padding="10" text="TAB2" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_11" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPerformance2.dyn2}" />
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_12" padding="10" text="TAB3" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_13" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPerformance2.dyn3}" />
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_15" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_16" padding="10" text="TAB4" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_17" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPerformance2.dyn4}" />
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_18" padding="10" text="TAB5" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_19" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPerformance2.dyn5}" />
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IAcceleratedPropertyAccess;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPerformance2}")

public class DemoPerformance2 implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class PropData implements IAcceleratedPropertyAccess
    {
        public Object getPropertyValue(String property)
        {
            if ("value".equals(property)) return getValue();
            if ("enabled".equals(property)) return i_enabled; 
            if ("bgpaint".equals(property)) return i_bgpaint; 
            if ("flush".equals(property)) return true;
            if ("requestfocus".equals(property)) return 0;
            if ("maxlength".equals(property)) return 10;
            return IAcceleratedPropertyAccess.NOT_AVAILABLE;
        }
        String i_value = s_random.nextInt(10000)+"";
        boolean i_enabled = (s_random.nextInt()%2 == 0);
        String i_bgpaint = "#FF000030";
        public String getValue()
        {
            i_value = s_random.nextInt(10000)+"";
            return i_value;
        }
        public void setValue(String value)
        {
            i_value = value;
        }
        public boolean isEnabled()
        {
            return i_enabled;
        }
        public String getBgpaint()
        {
            return i_bgpaint;
        }
        public String getFlush()
        {
            return "true";
        }
        public String getRequestfocus()
        {
            return "0";
        }
        public String getMaxlength()
        {
            return "10";
        }
    }
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        Map<String,PropData> i_propmap = new HashMap<String,PropData>();
        public Map<String, PropData> getPropmap()
        {
            return i_propmap;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static int COLCOUNT = 20;
    static boolean CHANGEINDEX = true;
    static Random s_random = new Random();
    
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dyn1 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dyn2 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dyn3 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dyn4 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    protected ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dyn5 = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid1 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(CHANGEINDEX);
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid2 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(CHANGEINDEX);
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid3 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(CHANGEINDEX);
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid4 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(CHANGEINDEX);
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid5 = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(CHANGEINDEX);

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPerformance2()
    {
        super();
        m_dyn1.setContentXml(initDyn(1));
        m_dyn2.setContentXml(initDyn(2));
        m_dyn3.setContentXml(initDyn(3));
        m_dyn4.setContentXml(initDyn(4));
        m_dyn5.setContentXml(initDyn(5));
        initGridData(m_grid1);
        initGridData(m_grid2);
        initGridData(m_grid3);
        initGridData(m_grid4);
        initGridData(m_grid5);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDyn1() { return m_dyn1; }
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDyn2() { return m_dyn2; }
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDyn3() { return m_dyn3; }
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDyn4() { return m_dyn4; }
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDyn5() { return m_dyn5; }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid1() { return m_grid1; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid2() { return m_grid2; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid3() { return m_grid3; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid4() { return m_grid4; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid5() { return m_grid5; }

    private String initDyn(int dyni)
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        sb.append("<t:fixgrid objectbinding='#{d.DemoPerformance2.grid"+dyni+"}' sbvisibleamount='10'" +
                            " rowheight='16' bordercolor='#00000030'" +
                            " borderheight='1' borderwidth='1'" +
                            " width='100%'>\n");
        for (int coli=0; coli<COLCOUNT; coli++)
        {
            sb.append("<t:gridcol text='Column "+coli+"'>\n");
            sb.append("<t:field text='.{propmap.column"+coli+".value}'" +
//                              " enabled='.{propmap.column"+coli+".enabled}'" +
                              " bgpaint='.{propmap.column"+coli+".bgpaint}'" +
                              " flush='.{propmap.column"+coli+".flush}'" +
                              " maxlength='.{propmap.column"+coli+".maxlength}'" +
                              " requestfocus='.{propmap.column"+coli+".requestfocus}'/>\n");
            sb.append("</t:gridcol>\n");
        }
        sb.append("</t:fixgrid>\n");
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    private void initGridData(FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> grid)
    {
        for (int rowi=0; rowi<50; rowi++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            grid.getItems().add(gi);
            for (int coli=0; coli<COLCOUNT; coli++)
            {
                String propName = "column"+coli;
                PropData propData = new PropData();
                gi.i_propmap.put(propName,propData);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    


    
}

Many images in ROWFLEXLINE

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowbodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Number of items" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.onRenderAction}" format="int" value="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.numberOfItems}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="120" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" group="STYLE" refvalue="0" text="Plain image" value="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.style}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_8" group="STYLE" refvalue="1" text="Image with text" value="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.style}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.onRenderAction}" text="Render" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.onClearAction}" text="Clear" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:pane id="g_15" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_16" border="#c0c0c0" coldistance="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_17" contentbinding="#{d.DemoFlexImageList.dynContent}" />
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.apache.batik.gvt.TextNode;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.IMAGENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFlexImageList}")

public class DemoFlexImageList
    extends WorkpageDispatchedPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    int m_style = 0;
    public int getStyle() { return m_style; }
    public void setStyle(int value) { this.m_style = value; }

    public void onClearAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        PANENode p = new PANENode();
        m_dynContent.setContentNode(p);
    }

    public void onRenderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        renderContent();
    }

    int m_numberOfItems = 500;
    public int getNumberOfItems() { return m_numberOfItems; }
    public void setNumberOfItems(int value) { this.m_numberOfItems = value; }

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFlexImageList(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        renderContent();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofleximagelist.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFlexImageList}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderContent()
    {
        List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int i=0; i<m_numberOfItems; i++)
        {
            if (m_style == 0)
            {
                IMAGENode in = new IMAGENode()
                    .setImage("/images/icons/bigspeaker.png");
                l.add(in);
            }
            else
            {
                PANENode p = new PANENode()
                    .setPadding("3")
                    .setBackground("#00000010");
                {
                    ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                    p.addSubNode(r);
                    IMAGENode in = new IMAGENode()
                        .setImage("/images/icons/bigspeaker.png");
                    r.addSubNode(in);
                }
                {
                    ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
                    p.addSubNode(r);
                    LABELNode t = new LABELNode()
                        .setText("" + i)
                        .setWidth("100%")
                        .setAlign("center");
                    r.addSubNode(t);
                }
                l.add(p);
            }
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNodes(l);
    }
}

Many images in flexible grid

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowbodypane id="g_4" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:pane id="g_6" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:sizetransfer id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlexImageListViaGrid.onPaneSizeAction}" flush="true" horizontalcategories="SMALL:800;MIDDLE:1500;LARGE:10000" sizevalue="#{d.DemoFlexImageListViaGrid.paneSize}" verticalcategories="ALL:10000" />
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_11" contentbinding="#{d.DemoFlexImageListViaGrid.dynContent}" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.IMAGENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFlexImageListViaGrid}")

public class DemoFlexImageListViaGrid
    extends WorkpageDispatchedPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }
    public void setDynContent(ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding value) { this.m_dynContent = value; }

    public void onPaneSizeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        renderGrid();
    }

    String m_paneSize;
    public String getPaneSize() { return m_paneSize; }
    public void setPaneSize(String value) { this.m_paneSize = value; }

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        List<String> i_images = new ArrayList<String>();
        public List<String> getImages() { return i_images; }
    }

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;
    private int m_nofImages = 1000;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFlexImageListViaGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_paneSize = "SMALL;ALL";
        renderGrid();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofleximagelistviagrid.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFlexImageListViaGrid}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderGrid()
    {
        // render grid
        FIXGRIDNode f = new FIXGRIDNode()
            .setWidth("100%")
            .setHeight("100%")
            .setSuppressheadline(true)
            .setBordercolor("#00000010")
            .setBorderwidth(1)
            .setBorderheight(1)
            .setSbvisibleamount(20)
            .setRowheight("60")
            .setObjectbinding(pbx("grid"));
        int nofCols = 5;
        if (m_paneSize.startsWith("MIDDLE"))
            nofCols = 10;
        else if (m_paneSize.startsWith("LARGE"))
            nofCols = 20;
        for (int i=0; i<nofCols; i++)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode c = new GRIDCOLNode()
                .setWidth("100%");
            IMAGENode in = new IMAGENode()
                .setImage(".{images["+i+"]}");
            f.addSubNode(c);
            c.addSubNode(in);
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNode(f);
        // build items
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        int nofRows = m_nofImages / nofCols;
        if (m_nofImages % nofCols > 0)
            nofRows++;
        for (int iRow=0;iRow<nofRows;iRow++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            for (int iCol=0;iCol<nofCols; iCol++)
            {
                int index = iRow*nofCols + iCol;
                if (index > m_nofImages)
                    break;
                gi.i_images.add("/images/icons/bigspeaker.png");
            }
        }
    }
}

Grid Performance Test

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:beanmethodinvoker id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.onBeforeRenderAction}" jsfphase="renderBegin" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowbodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Cell Type" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_6" value="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.controlType}" width="150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_7" text="0 Label" value="0" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_8" text="1 Field" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_9" text="2 FormattedField" value="2" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_10" text="3 Simple Label" value="3" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_11" text="4 Simple Label - optimized" value="4" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_12" text="5 Combo Field" value="5" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_13" text="6 Checkbox" value="6" />
</t:combobox>
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_15" text="# of Client Rows" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.rowCount}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_18" text="# of Columns" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_19" format="int" value="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.colCount}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Server latency" width="100" />
<t:slider id="g_23" majortickspacing="250" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="50" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.roundtripLatence}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" rendered="false" >
<t:coldistance id="g_25" width="270" />
<t:label id="g_26" text="Creation hint" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_27" value="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.creationHint}" width="170" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" text="default" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_29" text="toggle" value="toggle" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_30" height="1" />
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:coldistance id="g_32" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.onRender}" text="Render Grid" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_34" />
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_35" contentbinding="#{d.DemoGridPerformance.content}" />
<t:rowline id="g_36" />
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="Source code: workplace.DemoGridPerformance // Page: /workplace/demogridperformance.jsp" />
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.CHECKBOXNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COMBOFIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FORMATTEDFIELDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.SIMPLELABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.IDatabagProvider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IAcceleratedPropertyAccess;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridPerformance}")

public class DemoGridPerformance
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem 
        extends FIXGRIDItem 
        implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        List<String> i_data = new ArrayList<String>();
        public List<String> getData() { return i_data; }
        public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
            {
                IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
                idts.addLine("Harry","Harry");
                idts.addLine("Jo","Jo");
                idts.addLine("Karl","Karl");
            }
        }
    }

    public class GridItemWithDatabag 
        extends GridItem
        implements IDatabagProvider
    {
        String i_databag = null;
        public String getDatabag()
        {
            if (i_databag == null)
            {
                Map<String,String> m = new HashMap<String,String>();
                for (int i=0; i<i_data.size(); i++)
                {
                    m.put(""+i,i_data.get(i));
                }
                i_databag = ValueManager.encodeComplexValue(m);
            }
            return i_databag;
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_content = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>(true);
    
    int m_controlType = 0;
    int m_rowCount = 10;
    int m_colCount = 20;
    int m_roundtripLatence = 0;
    String m_creationHint = "toggle";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridPerformance()
    {
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogridperformance.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridPerformance}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getControlType() { return m_controlType; }
    public void setControlType(int value) { this.m_controlType = value; }

    public int getRowCount() { return m_rowCount; }
    public void setRowCount(int value) { this.m_rowCount = value; }

    public int getColCount() { return m_colCount; }
    public void setColCount(int value) { this.m_colCount = value; }

    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return m_content; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public void onRender(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        FIXGRIDNode fg = new FIXGRIDNode();
        fg.setObjectbinding("#{d.DemoGridPerformance.grid}");
        fg.setSbvisibleamount(m_rowCount);
        fg.setWidth("100%");
        fg.setHeight("100%");
//        fg.setHeight("100%");
        fg.setBordercolor("#00000030");
        fg.setBorderheight(1);
        fg.setBorderwidth(1);
        for (int i=0; i<m_colCount; i++)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode gn = new GRIDCOLNode();
            fg.addSubNode(gn);
            gn.setText(""+i);
            gn.setWidth(60);
            gn.setSortreference(".{data["+i+"]}"); // explicit definition ownly required for "4"
            if (m_controlType == 0)
            {
                LABELNode ln = new LABELNode();
                gn.addSubNode(ln);
                ln.setFormat("bigdecimal");
                ln.setFormatmask("dec2");
                ln.setText(".{data["+i+"]}");
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 1)
            {
                FIELDNode fn = new FIELDNode();
                gn.addSubNode(fn);
                fn.setText(".{data["+i+"]}");
                fn.addAttribute("creationhint",m_creationHint);
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 2)
            {
                FORMATTEDFIELDNode fn = new FORMATTEDFIELDNode();
                gn.addSubNode(fn);
                fn.setValue(".{data["+i+"]}");
                fn.setFormat("float");
                fn.addAttribute("creationhint",m_creationHint);
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 3)
            {
                SIMPLELABELNode ln = new SIMPLELABELNode();
                gn.addSubNode(ln);
                ln.setFormat("bigdecimal");
                ln.setFormatmask("dec2");
                ln.setText(".{data["+i+"]}");
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 4)
            {
                SIMPLELABELNode ln = new SIMPLELABELNode();
                gn.addSubNode(ln);
                ln.setText("@cc_db:"+i+"@");
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 5)
            {
                COMBOFIELDNode ln = new COMBOFIELDNode();
                gn.addSubNode(ln);
                ln.setText(".{data["+i+"]}");
                ln.setActionListener(".{onAction}");
                ln.addAttribute("creationhint",m_creationHint);
            }
            else if (m_controlType == 6)
            {
                CHECKBOXNode cn = new CHECKBOXNode();
                cn.setSelected(".{data["+i+"]}");
                gn.addSubNode(cn);
            }
        }
        m_content.setContentNode(fg);
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = null;
            switch (m_controlType) 
            {
                case 0:
                case 1:
                case 2:
                case 3:
                case 5:
                case 6:
                    gi = new GridItem();
                    break;
                case 4:
                    gi = new GridItemWithDatabag();
                    break;
            }
            for (int j=0; j<m_colCount; j++)
            {
                if (m_controlType != 6)
                {
                    gi.getData().add(i + "." + j);
                }
                else
                {
                    int r = new Random().nextInt(10);
                    if (r%2 == 0)
                        gi.getData().add("true");
                    else
                        gi.getData().add("false");
                }
            }
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public void onBeforeRenderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            if (m_roundtripLatence > 0)
