                Thread.currentThread().sleep(m_roundtripLatence);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
        }
    }

    public int getRoundtripLatence() { return m_roundtripLatence; }
    public void setRoundtripLatence(int value) { this.m_roundtripLatence = value; }

    public String getCreationHint() { return m_creationHint; }
    public void setCreationHint(String value) { this.m_creationHint = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Grid Performance - Complex Columns

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" />
<t:rowbodypane id="g_4" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Number of columns" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" format="int" value="#{d.DemoComplexGridPerformance.numberOfColumns}" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoComplexGridPerformance.onRenderAction}" text="Render" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_9" contentbinding="#{d.DemoComplexGridPerformance.content}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.CHECKBOXNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.COLDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.FIXGRIDNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.GRIDCOLNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWDISTANCENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;


@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComplexGridPerformance}")

public class DemoComplexGridPerformance
    extends WorkpageDispatchedPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        Map<String,Object> i_data = new HashMap();
        public Map<String, Object> getData()
        {
            return i_data;
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_content = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    int m_numberOfColumns = 5;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComplexGridPerformance(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        renderContent();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            if (i%3 == 0)
                gi.getData().put("bool0",true);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democomplexgridperformance.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComplexGridPerformance}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getContent() { return m_content; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    
    public int getNumberOfColumns() { return m_numberOfColumns; }
    public void setNumberOfColumns(int value) { this.m_numberOfColumns = value; }

    public void onRenderAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        renderContent();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void renderContent()
    {
        FIXGRIDNode f = new FIXGRIDNode()
            .setSbvisibleamount(30)
            .setWidth("100%")
            .setHeight("100%")
            .setRowheight(26)
            .setObjectbinding(pbx("grid"));
        for (int i=0; i<m_numberOfColumns; i++)
        {
            GRIDCOLNode c = new GRIDCOLNode()
                .setWidth(60)
                .setText("Col " + i)
                .setAlign("center");
            f.addSubNode(c);
            // PANE
            //   ROWDISTANCE
            //     ROW
            //       COLDISTANCE
            //       CHECKBOX
            //       COLDISTANCE
            //   ROWDISTANCE
            PANENode p = new PANENode();
            c.addSubNode(p);
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("50%"));
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("50%"));
            r.addSubNode(new CHECKBOXNode().setSelected(".{data['bool"+i+"']}"));
            r.addSubNode(new COLDISTANCENode().setWidth("50%"));
            p.addSubNode(new ROWDISTANCENode().setHeight("50%"));
        }
        m_content.setContentNode(f);
    }
}

Grid with Adapter Binding...

Wizards

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowbodypane id="g_3" >
  <t:row id="g_4" >
    <t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoWizard.onStartWizard}" text="Start Wizard inside Page" />
    <t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoWizard.onStartWizardPopup}" text="Start Wizard as Popup" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_8" >
    <t:pane id="g_9" border="#C0C0C0" height="100%" padding="1" width="100%" >
      <t:rowinclude id="g_10" page="#{d.demoWizard.pageName}" />
    </t:pane>
  </t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Wizard;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Wizard.IWizardLogicProvider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Wizard.IWizardPageInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoWizard extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyWizardPageInfo extends Wizard.WizardPageInfo
    {
        public MyWizardPageInfo(String arg0, String arg1, boolean arg2,
                boolean arg3)
        {
            super(arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3);
        }
    }
    
    public class WizardLogic implements IWizardLogicProvider, Serializable
    {
        public IWizardPageInfo[] getWizardPageInfos()
        {
            return new IWizardPageInfo[]
                                       {
                    new MyWizardPageInfo("Hello World!","/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp",false,true),
                    new MyWizardPageInfo("Panes","/workplace/demopanes.jsp",false,true),
                    new MyWizardPageInfo("Outlook bar","/workplace/demooutlookbar.jsp",true,true)
                                       };
        }
        public void exit()
        {
            m_modelessPopup.close();
        }
        public boolean checkIfNavigationIsPossible(IWizardPageInfo fromPage,
                                                   IWizardPageInfo toPage,
                                                   int directionOfNavigation)
        {
            return true;
        }
        public void prepareNextPage(IWizardPageInfo wp,
                                    int directionOfNavigation)
        {
            System.out.println("PREPARE CALLED FOR " + wp.getStep());
            System.out.println("PREPARE CALLED FOR " + wp.getStep());
            System.out.println("PREPARE CALLED FOR " + wp.getStep());
        }
        public void finish() 
        {
            if (m_modelessPopup != null)
            {
                m_modelessPopup.close();
                m_modelessPopup = null;
            }
        }
        public void cancel()
        {
            if (m_modelessPopup != null)
            {
                m_modelessPopup.close();
                m_modelessPopup = null;
            }
        }
        public boolean checkIfGridNavigationIsEnabled()
        {
            return true;
        }
         
    }
    
    private class MyWizardLogic extends WizardLogic
    {
        public void exit()
        {
            if (m_modelessPopup != null)
            {
                m_modelessPopup.close();
                m_modelessPopup = null;
            }
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_pageName = "/empty.jsp";
    ModelessPopup m_modelessPopup;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoWizard(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void setPageName(String value) { m_pageName = value; }
    public String getPageName() { return m_pageName; }
    
    public void onStartWizard(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_pageName = "/eclntjsfserver/popups/wizard.jsp";
        Wizard.getInstance().prepare(new MyWizardLogic());
    }
    
    public void onStartWizardPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_pageName = "/empty.jsp";
        Wizard.getInstance().prepare(new MyWizardLogic());
        if (m_modelessPopup == null)
        {
            m_modelessPopup = ModelessPopup.createInstance();
            IModelessPopupListener mpl = new IModelessPopupListener() {
                public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                {
                    m_modelessPopup.close();
                    m_modelessPopup = null;
                }
            };
            m_modelessPopup.open("/eclntjsfserver/popups/wizard.jsp","Wizard",1000,600,mpl);
        }
    }
}

Server Memory

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowbodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Used memory" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" enabled="false" format="long" value="#{d.DemoMemory.usedMemory}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Available Memory" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" enabled="false" format="long" value="#{d.DemoMemory.availableMemory}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoMemory.onCollectGarbage}" text="Collect Garbage" />
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMemory}")

public class DemoMemory implements Serializable
{
    public long getAvailableMemory() 
    { 
        return Runtime.getRuntime().freeMemory(); 
    }

    public long getUsedMemory() 
    { 
        return Runtime.getRuntime().totalMemory() - Runtime.getRuntime().freeMemory();
    }

    public void onCollectGarbage(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        System.gc();
    }

}

Client Info

Each request that is sent from the CaptainCasa client contains certain http header parameters that may be useful for your application processing on server side.

A special parameter is the so called client-id ("eclnt-id"). It contains an id that is assigned to each client, so that the server can keep data dependent from the client. The client-id is generated by default, but can also be explicitly assigned. Please view the Developer's Guide (chapter "Client-Id Management") for more information.

Pay attention: the client-id is only available if calling pages through ".ccapplet" or ".ccwebstart".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:callserverontrigger id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoClientId.onRefreshAction}" trigger="#{d.DemoClientId.refreshTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClientId}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Client address" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Client host name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_8" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientHost}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Client Ip Address" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_11" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientIp}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_13" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Client name" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Client id" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_16" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientId}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Set client id to new value" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="New client id" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_22" placeholder="client id value" text="#{d.DemoClientId.newClientId}" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="10" />
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoClientId.onSetAction}" text="Set!" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_26" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Client information" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Client Type" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_29" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientType}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Client Language" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_32" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientLanguage}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:label id="g_34" text="Client Country" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_35" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoClientId.currentClientCountry}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_41" height="100%" text="Current request - header parameters" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:textarea id="g_38" enabled="false" height="100%;200" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoClientId.requestHeaderParams}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Enumeration;

import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClientId}")

public class DemoClientId
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_newClientId;
    Trigger m_refreshTrigger = new Trigger();
    
    public DemoClientId(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getCurrentClientType() 
    { 
        if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientTypeIsRisc()) return "RISC-HTML Client";
        if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientJavaTypeIsSwing()) return "Java-Swing Client";
        if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientJavaTypeIsFX()) return "Java-FX Client";
        return "Undefined Client";
    }
    
    public String getCurrentClientId() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentClientId(); 
    }
    
    public String getCurrentClientIp() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getRemoteAddr(); 
    }
    
    public String getCurrentClientHost() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getRemoteHost(); 
    }
    
    public String getCurrentClientLanguage() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getHeader("eclnt-language"); 
    }
    
    public String getCurrentClientCountry() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest().getHeader("eclnt-country"); 
    }
    
    public String getNewClientId() { return m_newClientId; }
    public void setNewClientId(String value) { this.m_newClientId = value; }

    public void onSetAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_newClientId == null || m_newClientId.trim().length() == 0)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("Please define a valid new client id");
            return;
        }
        HttpSessionAccess.setCurrentClientId(m_newClientId);
        m_refreshTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public Trigger getRefreshTrigger() { return m_refreshTrigger; }

    public void onRefreshAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) {}

    public String getRequestHeaderParams() 
    { 
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        HttpServletRequest req = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest();
        if (req != null)
        {
            Enumeration<String> names = req.getHeaderNames();
            while (names.hasMoreElements())
            {
                String name = names.nextElement();
                String value = req.getHeader(name);
                sb.append(name + ": " + value + "\n");
            }
        }
        return sb.toString();
    }

}

Server Log Viewer

Local Client Configuration

On client side there is one file that holds certain client-specific configuration:

(.) the id of the client
(.) the "local directory" of the client (the one used for automated upload/download)
(.) an indicator if automated file functions are supported

The file is kept on client side within the temporary directory that is assigned by the operating system environment.

You can up/download this configuration file in just normal way. The client file's name is ${temp}/eclnt/eclntconfig.xml.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:filedownload id="g_2" filename="{temp}/eclnt/eclntconfig.xml" trigger="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.downloadTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.downloadURL}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadbutton id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.onUpload}" filename="{temp}/eclnt/eclntconfig.xml" maxfilesize="100000" text="Upload to Server" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.onCreateTemplate}" text="Create Template" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Content" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_12" flush="true" height="150" text="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.content}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.onDownload}" text="Download to Client" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig.onReloadClient}" text="Reload Client" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.BufferedContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventUpload;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageLifecycleListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLocalClientConfig}")

public class DemoLocalClientConfig
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    class MyBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            try
            {
                if (m_content == null)
                    throw new Error("No content");
                return m_content.getBytes("UTF-8");
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"Problem when passing back content");
                throw new Error(t);
            }
        }
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return null;
        }
            
    }
    
    String m_content;
    MyBufferedContent m_bufferedContent;
    Trigger m_downloadTrigger = new Trigger();
    
    public DemoLocalClientConfig(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_bufferedContent = new MyBufferedContent();
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedContent);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                BufferedContentMgr.remove(m_bufferedContent);
                m_bufferedContent = null;
            }
        });
    }
    
    public String getContent() { return m_content; }
    public void setContent(String value) { m_content = value; }

    public String getDownloadURL() { return m_bufferedContent.getURL(); }
    public Trigger getDownloadTrigger() { return m_downloadTrigger; }

    public void onUpload(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventUpload)
            {
                BaseActionEventUpload ue = (BaseActionEventUpload)event;
                byte[] bytes = ue.getHexBytes();
                m_content = new String(bytes,"UTF-8");
            }
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    public void onReloadClient(ActionEvent event)
    {
        HttpSessionAccess.reloadClient();
    }
    
    public void onDownload(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (m_content == null || m_content.trim().length() == 0)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("No content for download defined.");
            return;
        }
        m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
    }
    
    public void onCreateTemplate(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_content = "<clientconfig>\n" +
                    "    <clientid value='CLIENTID'/>\n" +
                    "    <localdirectory value='c:\\temp\\'/>\n" +
                    "    <suppressautofilefunctions value='false'/>\n" +
                    "</clientconfig>\n";
    }

}

Tooltip

The attribute TOOLTIP is available for (nearly) all components, that are optical components.

You either define a straight text - or you define simple HTML text. HTML text needs to be defined as "<html>....</html>".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTooltip}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="Move the cursor on top of the following fields - a tool tip will show up." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Default" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" tooltip="Straight tooltip." width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="HTML based" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" tooltip="&lt;html&gt;&lt;h2&gt;HTML based tooltip&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;The text of this tooltip is an HTML text. The tooltip is not rendered by the browser&#39;s tooltip management but is rendered by some own tooltip.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Please note: the text of the tooltip is HTML-sanitized prior to being displayes in the tooltip window. This is due to preventing JavaScript injection.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/html&gt;" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTooltip extends PageBean
{
    public DemoTooltip(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

Show Client Error Screen

After pressing the button the error screen will appear that normally shows up, when no connection to the server is available.

The component SHOWCLIENTERRORSCREEN is responsible for this: by triggering its trigger it will show the client error screen.

There are not a lot of use cases, in which this component really makes sense... ;-) But there is one: you want to restart the server by an application function, so the user should directly see the error screen as response on the restart request - and not see a valid screen, in which the error screen is shown after doing some client action (e.g. pressing the button).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:showclienterrorscreen id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoShowClientErrorScreen.trigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoShowClientErrorScreen}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoShowClientErrorScreen.onShowClientErrorScreen}" text="Show Client Error Screen" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoShowClientErrorScreen}")

public class DemoShowClientErrorScreen
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    
    public DemoShowClientErrorScreen(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public Trigger getTrigger() 
    { 
        return m_trigger; 
    }

    public void onShowClientErrorScreen(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

}

Log Configuration

The configuration of the CaptainCasa server side logging can be updated at runtime by using some API. Please check the Java code for details.

The client side logging is done into the console of the browser. In order to save performance it is default switched off. You can switch on by appending query parameter "cclogactive=true" to the .risc-URL that starts your dialog.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLogUpdate}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Log level" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_4" group="LOGLEVEL" refvalue="SEVERE" text="Severe / Error" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logLevel}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" group="LOGLEVEL" refvalue="WARNING" text="Warning" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logLevel}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_10" group="LOGLEVEL" refvalue="INFO" text="Information" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logLevel}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_13" group="LOGLEVEL" refvalue="ALL" text="Debug / All" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logLevel}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Console output" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_17" group="CONSOLE" refvalue="true" text="switched ON" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logConsole}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_20" group="CONSOLE" refvalue="false" text="switched OFF" value="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.logConsole}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoLogUpdate.onTakeOverAction}" text="Take over" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.logging.Level;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLogUpdate}")

public class DemoLogUpdate
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    boolean m_logConsole;
    String m_logLevel;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoLogUpdate(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_logConsole = CLog.getLogToConsole();
        m_logLevel = CLog.L.getLevel().getName();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demologupdate.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLogUpdate}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public boolean getLogConsole() { return m_logConsole; }
    public void setLogConsole(boolean value) { this.m_logConsole = value; }
    
    public String getLogLevel() { return m_logLevel; }
    public void setLogLevel(String value) { this.m_logLevel = value; }

    public void onTakeOverAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            Level newLevel = Level.parse(m_logLevel);
            CLog.updateLogLevel(newLevel);
            if (m_logConsole == true)
                CLog.addConsoleHandler();
            else
                CLog.removeConsoleHandler();
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Configuration of logging was updated.");
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString(),ValueManager.getStackstraceString(t));
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Access style values

Both in the CSS style XML definition ("riscstyle_<styleName>.xml") and in the attribute style definition ("style.xml") you may define style values:

CSS style:
<var n="@<name>@" v="<value>"/>

XML attribute style:
<stylevalue name="<name>" value="<value>"/>

These style values can be accesse from the layout by using the expression:
"#{ccstylevalue.<styleValue>}" for simple names and/or
"#{ccstylevalue['<styleValue>']} for complex names

As consequence you can outsource certain optical information into the style management.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStyleValueAccess}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="ccStatusbarWarningBig" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_4" image="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;ccStatusbarWarningBig&#39;]}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="@baseColor@" width="150" />
<t:pane id="g_7" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@baseColor@&#39;]}" border="#c0c0c0" height="60" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="@textcolor@" width="150" />
<t:pane id="g_10" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@textcolor@&#39;]}" border="#c0c0c0" height="60" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="@buttonBackground@" width="150" />
<t:pane id="g_13" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@buttonBackground@&#39;]}" border="#c0c0c0" height="60" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoStyleValueAccess.onRuntimeAccessAction}" text="Runtime Access" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.StyleManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStyleValueAccess}")

public class DemoStyleValueAccess
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoStyleValueAccess(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demostylevalueaccess.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoStyleValueAccess}"; }
    
    public void onRuntimeAccessAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String styleValue = StyleManager.getStyleValue("@baseColor@");
        Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup("The style value for \"@baseColor@\" is: " + styleValue);
    }

}

Change of http session id

In some security-related scenarios it is required to update the http session id during the runtime of the session.

This demo shows how to do this on server-side - and tests that the client-server configuration is automatically adapted to the new session id.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_8" labeltext="Current session id" text="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId.currentSessionId}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId.onChangeSessionIdAction}" text="Change Session Id" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textarea id="g_10" enabled="false" height="100%" labeltext="Protocol" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId}")

public class DemoChangeHttpSessionId
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_protocol = "";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChangeHttpSessionId(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demochangehttpsessionid.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoChangeHttpSessionId}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getCurrentSessionId() 
    { 
        return HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentHttpSession().getId();
    }
    
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; } 
    public void setProtocol(String protocol) { m_protocol = protocol; }

    public void onChangeSessionIdAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String from = getCurrentSessionId();
        HttpServletRequest req = HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentRequest();
        req.changeSessionId();
        String to = getCurrentSessionId();
        m_protocol += "Changed session id from " + from + " to " + to + "\n";
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Server Side Value Binding

Data Type Resolution in Maps

This example shows by using two maps, how the data type of the values to be put into the map is found:

Enter some values into the fields - and observe the protocol output.

For the map "data" the following rules apply:
(.) int1 is already filled into the map - as result the type will be kept (String).
(.) the same happens with int2 - but now the type is Integer
(.) with int3 the map was not filled at all, so the FORMATTEDFIELD's format definition is guiding the type resolution

For the map "datawi" the interface "IPropertyTypeResolver" is provided, exactly telling which data type to select.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Without explicit type info" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Int 1" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.onFlush}" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.data.int1}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Int 2" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.onFlush}" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.data.int2}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Int 3" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.onFlush}" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.data.int3}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Without explicit type info" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Int 4" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.onFlush}" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.datawi.int4}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Int 5" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.onFlush}" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.datawi.int5}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:textarea id="g_23" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IPropertyTypeResolver;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicBindingTypes}")

public class DemoDynamicBindingTypes
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    public class MyMap extends HashMap<String,Object>
    {
        @Override
        public Object put(String key, Object value)
        {
            if (value != null)
                m_protocol = m_protocol + "\n" + key + "/" + value + "/" + value.getClass();
            else
                m_protocol = m_protocol + "\n" + key + "/null";
            return super.put(key, value);
        }
    }
    
    public class MyMapWithInfo extends MyMap
        implements IPropertyTypeResolver
    {
        public Class resolveType(String propertyName)
        {
            if ("int4".equals(propertyName)) return String.class;
            if ("int5".equals(propertyName)) return Integer.class;
            return String.class;
        }
    }
    
    
    String m_protocol = "";
    MyMap m_data = new MyMap();
    MyMapWithInfo m_datawi = new MyMapWithInfo();
    
    public DemoDynamicBindingTypes(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_data.put("int1","100");
        m_data.put("int2",100);
        m_protocol = "Protocol:";
    }

    public MyMap getData() { return m_data; }
    public MyMapWithInfo getDatawi() { return m_datawi; }
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    
    public void onFlush(ActionEvent event) {}

    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(m_protocol);
        return false;
    }
    
}

Property Change Notification - Version 1

Input some values into the fields and press OK. You will see a log telling about which values were updated on server side.

There are two ways to get notified when values are passed from the user interface processing into managed beans:

(1) Beans that are accessed via expressions (example: "#{d.address.firstName}") may optionally implement the interface "IPropertyResolverAware". In this case the bean is notified immediately after the property resolver having upodated a poperty value.

(2) There is a session wide ValueBinding listener, in which the valuebinding (the expression referenced by components) and the value that is set is passed as well. Typically you register this listener one time at the start up of your application - not in a constructor of a "sub-bean" - this is an example only!

You may use both interfaces in order to get triggered when the user interface request processing updates a property of your bean.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
  <t:row id="g_2" >
    <t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.firstName}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.lastName}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_8" >
    <t:label id="g_9" text="Street" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.street}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_11" >
    <t:label id="g_12" text="City" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_13" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.city}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="10" />
  <t:row id="g_15" >
    <t:coldistance id="g_16" width="120" />
    <t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.onOK}" text="OK" width="100" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="30" />
  <t:row id="g_19" >
    <t:coldistance id="g_20" width="120" />
    <t:textpane id="g_21" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware.log}" width="100%"/>
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.el.MethodExpression;
import javax.el.ValueExpression;
import javax.faces.el.MethodBinding;
import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.phases.PhaseManager;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IMethodBindingListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IPropertyResolverAware;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IValueBindingListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware}")

public class DemoPropertyResolverAware 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IPropertyResolverAware
{
    
    public class MyValueBindingListener implements IValueBindingListener
    {
        public void reactoOnValueExpressionSet(String expressionString,
                                               Object value)
        {
            m_log += "IValueBindingListener, Property change: " + expressionString + " / " + value + "\n";
        }
    }
    
    public class MyMethodBindingListener implements IMethodBindingListener
    {
        public void reactOnActionListenerInvokeAfter(String expressionString, ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_log += "IMethodBindingListener, Method call, before: " + expressionString + "\n";
        }

        public boolean reactOnActionListenerInvokeBefore(String expressionString, ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_log += "IMethodBindingListener, Method call, after: " +expressionString + "\n";
            return true;
        }
        
    }
    
    public class ResetLog implements Runnable
    {
        public void run()
        {
            m_log = "";
        }
    }
    
    public DemoPropertyResolverAware(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // create value binding listener
        // pay attention the value binding listener is active for the whole application
        // now - not only for this managed bean instance.
        HttpSessionAccess.setValueBindingListener(new MyValueBindingListener());
        // same with method binding listener
        HttpSessionAccess.setMethodBindingListener(new MyMethodBindingListener());
    }
    
    protected String m_log = "";
    public String getLog() { return m_log; }
    public void setLog(String value) { m_log = value; }

    protected String m_city;
    public String getCity() { return m_city; }
    public void setCity(String value) { m_city = value; }

    protected String m_street;
    public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
    public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }

    protected String m_lastName;
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    protected String m_firstName;
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

    public void onOK(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_log += "onOK was called\n";
        PhaseManager.runAfterRenderResponsePhase(new ResetLog());
    }
    
    public void reactOnSetValue(int index, Object value)
    {
        m_log += "IPropertyResolverAware, Property change: " + index + " / " + value + "\n";
    }
    
    public void reactOnSetValue(Object property, Object value)
    {
        m_log += "IPropertyResolverAware, Property change: " + property + " / " + value + "\n";
    }
    
}

Property Change Notification - Version 2

Change some data and press "OK". In the protocol area you see, what changes are registered on server side by implementing interface IPropertyResolverAware2.

The interface IPropertyResolverAware2 may be implemented on any managed bean level. Via the interface you get notified whenever values are changed inside your bean.

There are two levels:
(.) you get notified about data changes that directly affect properties of your current object
(.) you get notified about data changed that happen within sub objects of your current object

Please pay attention: the notification is executed within the data-transfer phase ("set phase"). You should only do "minimal actions" within this phase and push all processing into the invoke phase. Use class PhaseManager in order to shift processing into the invoke phase, if explicitly required.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2} }">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.firstName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.lastName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Title" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.data[&#34;title&#34;]}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Street" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.address.street}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Zip Code" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_17" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.address.zipCode}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Town" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_20" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.address.town}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="1st Car Id" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_24" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.cars[0].id}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_25" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_26" text="1st Car Type" width="80" />
<t:field id="g_27" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.cars[0].type}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="2ndt Car Id" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_30" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.cars[1].id}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_31" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_32" text="2nd Car Type" width="80" />
<t:field id="g_33" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.cars[1].type}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_34" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Comment 1" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_37" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.comments[0]}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_38" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_39" text="Comment 2" width="80" />
<t:field id="g_40" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.comments[1]}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_41" >
<t:coldistance id="g_42" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_43" actionListener="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.onOK}" text="OK" width="60" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_44" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_45" >
<t:coldistance id="g_46" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_47" actionListener="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.onClearProtocol}" text="Clear Protocol" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_48" >
<t:textarea id="g_49" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IPropertyResolverAware2;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPropertyResolverAware2}")

public class DemoPropertyResolverAware2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable, IPropertyResolverAware2
{
    public class Address
    {
        public Address(String street, String zipCode, String town)
        {
            i_street = street;
            i_zipCode = zipCode;
            i_town = town;
        }
        String i_street;
        String i_zipCode;
        String i_town;
        public void setStreet(String value) { i_street = value; }
        public String getStreet() { return i_street; }
        public void setZipCode(String value) { i_zipCode = value; }
        public String getZipCode() { return i_zipCode; }
        public void setTown(String value) { i_town = value; }
        public String getTown() { return i_town; }
    }
    
    public class Car
    {
        String i_id;
        String i_type;
        public Car(String id, String type)
        {
            i_id = id;
            i_type = type;
        }
        public void setId(String value) { i_id = value; }
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public void setType(String value) { i_type = value; }
        public String getType() { return i_type; }
    }
    
    public DemoPropertyResolverAware2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);       
        m_firstName = "Captain";
        m_lastName = "Casa";
        m_data.put("title","Company");
    }

    // mapped data
    Map<String,String> m_data = new HashMap<String, String>();
    // directly available data
    String m_firstName;
    String m_lastName;
    // linked data
    Address m_address = new Address("Main Street","347623","Nice Town");
    protected String m_protocol = "";
    // array of data
    Car[] m_cars = new Car[] {new Car("K-AA 827","Audi A6"), new Car("M-HH","BMW 5")};
    // array of simple data
    String[] m_comments = new String[] {"Comment 1","Comment 2"};
    
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }

    public Map<String,String> getData() { return m_data; }
    public Address getAddress() { return m_address; }
    public Car[] getCars() { return m_cars; }
    public String[] getComments() { return m_comments; }

    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }


    public void reactOnSetValue(String completeExpression, String propertyName, Object value)
    {
        m_protocol += "\nreactOnSetValue: " + completeExpression + " / " + propertyName + " / " + value;
    }

    public void reactOnSetValue(String completeExpression, int index, Object value)
    {
        m_protocol += "\nreactOnSetValue: " + completeExpression + " / " + index + " / " + value;
    }

    public void reactOnSetValueInSubObject(String completeExpression, Object value)
    {
        m_protocol += "\nreactOnSetValueInSubObject: " + completeExpression + " / " + value;
    }

    public void onClearProtocol(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_protocol = "";
    }

    public void onOK(ActionEvent event) 
    {
    }   

}

Central Notification

Server side JFreeChart

Pie Chart

In this demo, charts are created on server side - using the JFreeChart library. The image of the chart is transferred to the client, but not as URL but as hex string of data.

The component that is used within the layout is the HEXIMAGE component, that is able to render an image out of an hexstring representation of data (e.g. "af6e4453").

Have a look into the server side Java program: the image is created using the JFreeChart library, and then the image is transferred into a hex representation using the ValueManager class that comes with the server side library of Enterprise Client.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCharts}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#e0e0e0" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCharts.rows}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Town" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Inhabitants" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="double" value=".{inhabitants}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts.onCreateNewTown}" text="Add new Town" />
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts.onUpdateChart}" text="Update Chart" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:pane id="g_15" background="#FFFFFF" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,10,100%,#00000040,#00000000,horizontal);rectangle(100%-10,0,10,100%,#00000000,#00000040,horizontal);" border="top:1;bottom:1;color:#00000020" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="50%" />
<t:heximagemap id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoCharts.onImageMapAction}" hexdata="#{d.demoCharts.image}" imageareas="#{d.demoCharts.imageAreas}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.Font;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartFactory;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartRenderingInfo;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartUtilities;
import org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.ChartEntity;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.EntityCollection;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.StandardEntityCollection;
import org.jfree.chart.imagemap.StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator;
import org.jfree.chart.imagemap.ToolTipTagFragmentGenerator;
import org.jfree.chart.plot.MultiplePiePlot;
import org.jfree.chart.plot.PiePlot;
import org.jfree.data.category.CategoryDataset;
import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetUtilities;
import org.jfree.data.general.DefaultPieDataset;
import org.jfree.util.TableOrder;

public class DemoCharts extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------    

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_town;
        double m_inhabitants;
        public String getTown()
        {
            return m_town;
        }
        public void setTown(String town)
        {
            m_town = town;
        }
        public double getInhabitants()
        {
            return m_inhabitants;
        }
        public void setInhabitants(double inhabitants)
        {
            m_inhabitants = inhabitants;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    String m_image;
    String m_imageAreas;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoCharts(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("imagemap");
        MyRow row;
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Bammental"); row.setInhabitants(6800); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Mauer"); row.setInhabitants(4000); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Meckesheim"); row.setInhabitants(5300); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        generateChart();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void setImage(String value) { m_image = value; }
    public String getImage() { return m_image; }
    
    public void setImageAreas(String value) { m_imageAreas = value; }
    public String getImageAreas() { return m_imageAreas; }
    
    public void onUpdateChart(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        generateChart();
    }
    
    public void onCreateNewTown(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.setTown("new town");
        m_rows.getItems().add(row);
    }
    
    public void onImageMapAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)
            {
                BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected e = (BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)event;
                String mapId = e.getMapAreaId();
                int index = (new Integer(mapId)).intValue();
                m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
                m_rows.selectItem(index);
            }
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void generateChart()
    {
        try
        {
            DefaultPieDataset ds = new DefaultPieDataset();
            for (MyRow row: m_rows.getItems())
                ds.setValue(row.getTown(),row.getInhabitants());
            // create image
            JFreeChart chart = ChartFactory.createPieChart("Some important towns",ds,true,true,false);
            ChartRenderingInfo info = new ChartRenderingInfo(new StandardEntityCollection());
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(bos,chart,400,300,info);
            m_image = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bos.toByteArray());
            // collect entity data
            EntityCollection ec = info.getEntityCollection();
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
            Map<String,String> shapeCoordsByName = new HashMap<String,String>();
            for (int i=0; i<ec.getEntityCount(); i++)
            {
                ChartEntity ce = ec.getEntity(i);
                if (ce.getToolTipText() == null)
                    continue;
                String key = ce.getToolTipText();
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                int index = key.lastIndexOf(':');
                if (index < 0)
                    continue;
                key = key.substring(0,index);
                shapeCoordsByName.put(key,ce.getShapeCoords());
            }
            // build area string
            sb = new StringBuffer();
            int counter = 0;
            for (MyRow row: m_rows.getItems())
            {
                String fragment;
                fragment = shapeCoordsByName.get(row.getTown());
                if (sb.length() != 0)
                    sb.append(";");
                sb.append("poly("+counter+","+row.getTown()+","+fragment+")");
                counter++;
            }
            m_imageAreas = sb.toString();
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",t);
        }
    }
    
    private void generateChartOLD()
    {
        try
        {
            DefaultPieDataset ds = new DefaultPieDataset();
            for (int i=0; i<m_rows.getItems().size(); i++)
            {
                MyRow row = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
                ds.setValue(row.getTown(),row.getInhabitants());
            }
            JFreeChart chart = ChartFactory.createPieChart("Some important towns",ds,true,true,false);
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(bos, chart, 400, 200);
            bos.close();
            byte[] image = bos.toByteArray();
            m_image = ValueManager.encodeHexString(image);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",t);
        }
    }
    
}

Bar/Line Chart

In this demo charts are created on server side - using the JFreeChart library. The image of the chart is transferred to the client, but not as URL but as hex string of data.

The component that is used within the layout id the HEXIMAGE component, that is able to render an image out of an hexstring representation of data (e.g. "af6e4453").

Have a look into the server side Java program: the image is created using the JFreeChart library, and then the image is transferred into a hex representation using the ValueManager class that comes with the server side library of Enterprise Client.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCharts2}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#e0e0e0" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCharts2.rows}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Product" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{product}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Revenue North" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="double" value=".{revenueNorth}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Revenue South" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" align="right" format="double" value=".{revenueSouth}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts2.onCreateNewRow}" contentareafilled="false" text="Add new Row" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts2.onUpdateChart}" contentareafilled="false" font="weight:bold" foreground="#800000" text="Update Chart" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:pane id="g_17" background="#FFFFFF" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,10,100%,#00000040,#00000000,horizontal);rectangle(100%-10,0,10,100%,#00000000,#00000040,horizontal);" border="top:1;bottom:1;color:#00000020" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="50%" />
<t:combobox id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts2.onUpdateChart}" flush="true" value="#{d.demoCharts2.chartType}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_22" value="H.Bar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" value="V.Bar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_24" value="H.3DBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" value="V.3DBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_26" value="H.3DLine" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_27" value="V.3DLine" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" value="H.Area" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_29" value="V.Area" />
</t:combobox>
<t:coldistance id="g_30" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_31" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:coldistance id="g_33" width="50%" />
<t:heximage id="g_34" hexdata="#{d.demoCharts2.image}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_35" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_36" height="5" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartFactory;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartUtilities;
import org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart;
import org.jfree.chart.plot.PlotOrientation;
import org.jfree.data.category.DefaultCategoryDataset;
import org.jfree.data.general.DefaultPieDataset;

public class DemoCharts2 extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------    

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_product;
        double m_revenueNorth;
        double m_revenueSouth;
        public String getProduct()
        {
            return m_product;
        }
        public void setProduct(String product)
        {
            m_product = product;
        }
        public double getRevenueNorth()
        {
            return m_revenueNorth;
        }
        public void setRevenueNorth(double revenueNorth)
        {
            m_revenueNorth = revenueNorth;
        }
        public double getRevenueSouth()
        {
            return m_revenueSouth;
        }
        public void setRevenueSouth(double revenueSouth)
        {
            m_revenueSouth = revenueSouth;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    String m_image;
    String m_chartType = "H.Bar";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoCharts2(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        MyRow row;
        row = new MyRow(); row.setProduct("Hardware"); row.setRevenueNorth(1000); row.setRevenueSouth(1200); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setProduct("Software"); row.setRevenueNorth(800); row.setRevenueSouth(1000); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setProduct("Services"); row.setRevenueNorth(1800); row.setRevenueSouth(2000); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        generateChart();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void setImage(String value) { m_image = value; }
    public String getImage() { return m_image; }
    
    public void setChartType(String value) { m_chartType = value; }
    public String getChartType() { return m_chartType; }
    
    public void onUpdateChart(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        generateChart();
    }
    
    public void onCreateNewRow(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.setProduct("new");
        m_rows.getItems().add(row);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void generateChart()
    {
        try
        {
            DefaultCategoryDataset ds = new DefaultCategoryDataset();
            for (int i=0; i<m_rows.getItems().size(); i++)
            {
                MyRow row = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
                ds.setValue(row.getRevenueNorth(),"North",row.getProduct());
                ds.setValue(row.getRevenueSouth(),"South",row.getProduct());
            }
            JFreeChart chart = null;
            if (m_chartType.equals("H.Bar"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createBarChart("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("V.Bar"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createBarChart("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.VERTICAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("H.3DBar"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createBarChart3D("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("V.3DBar"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createBarChart3D("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.VERTICAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("H.3DLine"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createLineChart3D("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("V.3DLine"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createLineChart3D("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.VERTICAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("H.Area"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createAreaChart("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL,true,true,false);
            else if (m_chartType.equals("V.Area"))
                chart = ChartFactory.createAreaChart("Sales by Product and Region","Region","Product Revenue (Mio EUR)",ds,PlotOrientation.VERTICAL,true,true,false);
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(bos, chart, 400, 300);
            bos.close();
            byte[] image = bos.toByteArray();
            m_image = ValueManager.encodeHexString(image);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",t);
        }
    }
    
}

Workplace Management

Open/Close Pages

The workplace API allows to directly close or open pages from your code.

When opening pages you may either use the declarative API in which a "WorkpageStartInfo"-instance is passed, containing all the configuration parameters that are also used when e.g. starting a workpage from a workplace function tree.

Or you may use an explicit API - in this case the creation of the page bean is completely yours, so that you can use the Java API of the page bean to configure it.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpClose}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Closing workpage(s) via API" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Close this page" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onClose}" text="Close" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Close all workpages" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onCloseAllWorkpages}" text="Close all" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Opening workpages via declaraitve API" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Open a new page (jsp)" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onAddNewPage}" text="Open" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onAddNewSwitchToPage}" text="Open / Switch" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Open a new page (page bean)" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onAddNewPageBean}" text="Open" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
