<t:label id="g_24" text="Open a new page as popup" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onOpenHelloWorld}" text="Open" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_27" />
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Opening workpages with explicitly created page bean" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Create and open page bean" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_32" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpClose.onCreateAndOpenPageBean}" text="Open" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIELDComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.LABELComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.DefaultDispatchedBean;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpage;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageContainer;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.Workpage;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageByPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStarterFactory;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpClose}")

public class DemoWpClose 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static int s_counter = 0;
    BaseComponent m_row;
    
    String m_firstName;
    String m_lastName;
    
    ModalPopup m_popup;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoWpClose(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public methods
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    
    /**
     * Close the current page and removes it from the workplace.
     */
    public void onClose(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpage(getWorkpage());
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when closing: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

    /**
     * Opens a new workpage containing the hello world application.
     */
    public void onAddNewPageBean(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            IWorkpageDispatcher wpd = (IWorkpageDispatcher)getOwningDispatcher().getTopOwner();
            IWorkpageContainer wpc = getWorkpageContainer();
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setPageBeanName("DemoHelloWorld");
            wpsi.setText("Hello world!");
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(true);
            WorkpageStarterFactory.getWorkpageStarter().startWorkpage(wpd,wpc,wpsi);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when adding page: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

    
    /**
     * Opens a new workpage containing the page bean "DemoWpClose".
     */
    int m_openCounter = 0;
    public void onAddNewSwitchToPage(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            // same code as "onAddNewPage" - but now:
            // 1. passing an id
            // if a page with this id is already opened in the workplace then
            // no new page will be opened, but the existing one is pushed
            // to the front
            // 2. setting openMultipleInstances to false
            IWorkpageDispatcher wpd = (IWorkpageDispatcher)getOwningDispatcher().getTopOwner();
            IWorkpageContainer wpc = getWorkpageContainer();
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/demowpopened.jsp");
            wpsi.setText("Page HARRY");
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(false);
            wpsi.setId("HARRY_PAGE");
            m_openCounter++;
            IWorkpage startedWorkpage = WorkpageStarterFactory.getWorkpageStarter().startWorkpage(wpd,wpc,wpsi);
            DemoWPOpened wpo = (DemoWPOpened)startedWorkpage.getDispatcher().getDispatchedBean(DemoWPOpened.class);
            wpo.setCounter(m_openCounter);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when adding page: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

    /**
     * Opens a new workpage containing the page "/workplace/demominispread.jsp". 
     */
    public void onAddNewPage(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            IWorkpageDispatcher wpd = (IWorkpageDispatcher)getOwningDispatcher().getTopOwner();
            IWorkpageContainer wpc = getWorkpageContainer();
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/demominispread.jsp");
            wpsi.setText("Spreadsheet Demo");
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(true);
            WorkpageStarterFactory.getWorkpageStarter().startWorkpage(wpd,wpc,wpsi);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when adding page: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

    /**
     * Opens the hello-world-page as workpage, being started as a 
     * popup dialog.
     * 
     */
    public void onOpenHelloWorld(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        try
        {
            IWorkpageDispatcher wpd = (IWorkpageDispatcher)getOwningDispatcher().getTopOwner();
            IWorkpageContainer wpc = getWorkpageContainer();
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setPageBeanName("DemoHelloWorld");
            wpsi.setText("Hello world");
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(true);
            wpsi.setOpenAsPopupByDefault(true);
            WorkpageStarterFactory.getWorkpageStarter().startWorkpage(wpd,wpc,wpsi);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when adding page: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

    /**
     * In this example the instance of the bean is directly created - and then
     * passed as existing instance into the workplace management.
     */
    public void onCreateAndOpenPageBean(ActionEvent event)
    {
        // create page bean
        DemoHelloWorld dhw = new DemoHelloWorld(null);
        dhw.setName("Harry");
        // open new workpage
        WorkpageByPageBean wp = new WorkpageByPageBean(getOwningDispatcher(),dhw,"Harry","Hello Harry",null,true);
        getWorkpageContainer().addWorkpage(wp);
    }
    
    
    public void onTestPageWithPopup(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            IWorkpageDispatcher wpd = getOwningDispatcher();
            IWorkpageContainer wpc = getWorkpageContainer();
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/demowpdoublepopup.jsp");
            wpsi.setText("Page with Popup");
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(true);
            IWorkpage wp = WorkpageStarterFactory.getWorkpageStarter().startWorkpage(wpd,wpc,wpsi);
            // prepare managed bean
            DemoWpDoublePopup dp = (DemoWpDoublePopup)wp.getDispatcher().getDispatchedBean(DemoWpDoublePopup.class);
            dp.prepare();
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when adding page: " + t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    public void onCloseAllWorkpages(ActionEvent event)
    {
        List<IWorkpage> wps = getWorkpageContainer().getAllWorkpagesIncludingSubWorkpageContainers();
        for (IWorkpage wp: wps)
        {
            if (wp == getWorkpage()) continue; // do not close this workpage
            if (wp.isCloseSupported() == false) continue; // pages that cannot be closed are NOT closed
            getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpage(wp);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private methods
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    

}

Favorites List

It is very simple to create favorite areas - in which the user can drag&drop functions w.g. coming from the workplace's function tree management.

Just create an instance of class "WorkplaceFavorites" and bind it to the ROWWORKPAGEFAVORITES component.

There is one special favorite area, that is part of the workplace management already: the history. Every time something in the workplace is started using WorkpageStartInfo-instances, a corresponding history item is added.

The history is persisted in the local stream store.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWPFavorites}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" border="#00000030" height="100%" padding="5" width="200" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" font="weight:bold" text="Own Favorite Area" />
</t:row>
<t:rowworkpagefavorites id="g_6" imageheight="16" imagewidth="16" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWPFavorites.favs}" rowalignmenty="bottom" withicontext="true" />
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="10" />
<t:pane id="g_8" border="#00000030" height="100%" padding="5" width="200" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" font="weight:bold" text="History" />
</t:row>
<t:rowworkpagefavorites id="g_11" imageheight="16" imagewidth="16" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWPFavorites.history}" rowalignmenty="bottom" withicontext="true" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.DefaultDispatchedBean;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFavorites;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWPFavorites}")

public class DemoWPFavorites 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    WorkplaceFavorites m_favs;
    
    public DemoWPFavorites(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_favs = new WorkplaceFavorites(dispatcher,"demo");
        if (m_favs.getFaovriteInfos().size() == 0)
        {
            WorkpageStartInfo fi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            fi.setImage("/images/icons/person.png");
            fi.setText("Hallo");
            fi.setJspPage("/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp");
            m_favs.addFavorite(fi);
        }
    }
    
    public WorkplaceFavorites getFavs() { return m_favs; }
    
    public WorkplaceFavorites getHistory() { return getWorkpageContainer().getHistory(); }
}

Restart workplace

There are cases in which you want to reload a whole application - e.g. one user logs off - and you want to be sure that all objects are initialized "by guarantee".

In this case you may use the feature that is offered by the piece of the server side framework that translates the first name of a JSF expression ("#{d.xyz.abc" => the "d") into an object instance. The class that is responsible for doing this (VariableResolverByDelegation) provides the possibility to pass a new object for a given name at runtime.

When having a used a dispatcher-like variable approach then it is to re-initialize central objects of your server side UI processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRestart}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoRestart.onRestart}" text="&#34;Hard&#34; Restart" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoRestart.onRestartSoft}" text="&#34;Soft&#34; Restart" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.phases.PhaseManager;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.VariableResolverByDelegation;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRestart}")

public class DemoRestart 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoRestart(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onRestart(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentDialogSession().invalidate();
    }

    public void onRestartSoft(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        getWorkpageContainer().closeAllWorkpages(false,new Runnable() 
        {
            public void run()
            {
                HttpSessionAccess.getCurrentDialogSession().invalidate();
            }
        });
    }

}

Statusbar Output

By default you use the static Statusbar methods for displaying a message within the central status bar.

For workplace content scenarios there is an optional, a bit more sophisticated framework. Background: workpage content may be opened within a modeless dialog box - the central statusbar may be hidden as result.

The frameworks consists of:

(.) When a page is openes as modeless popup then an additional header and an additional statusbar is drawn. The statusbar that is now part of the modeless popup is the one were messagesa are going to - i.e. the central status bar is not used, as long as the page it opened within the popup.

(.) In the coding on the server side you do not use the static methods, but you use the write*-methods to write your output statements.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar}" >
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar.onOutputMessage}" text="Output Message" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_7" />
  <t:row id="g_8" >
    <t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar.onOutputSuccess}" text="Output Success" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_10" >
    <t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar.onOutputWarning}" text="Output Warning" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_12" >
    <t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar.onOutputError}" text="Output Error" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_14" >
    <t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar.onOutputAlert}" text="Output Alert" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_17" >
    <t:button id="g_18" text="Synch (Clear)" width="150" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpStatusbar}")

public class DemoWpStatusbar 
    extends PageBean // implicitly: extends WorkpageDispatchedBean
    implements Serializable
{

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoWpStatusbar(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void onOutputAlert(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeAlert("This message is output as ALERT message.","Alert Message");
    }
    
    public void onOutputError(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeError("This message is output as ERROR message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputSuccess(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeSuccess("This message is output as SUCCESS message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputMessage(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message 1.");
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message 2.");
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message 3.");
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message 4.");
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message 5.");
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeMessage("This message is output as normal message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputWarning(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().writeWarning("This message is output as WARNING message.");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
}

Content Lifecycle

Input some data into the two fields. The close the page. A message box will come up and warn that data might get lost.

A page that is started via the workplace management is associated with an IWorkpage object instance. This IWorkpage instance is the one to register for notifications that are thrown when the user (or an inside function) wants to close a page.

By implementing the interfaec "IWorkpageLifecycleListener" you get notified in two ways:

(1.) the "close()" method allows your application to intervent and return false.
(2.) the "closeForced()" method is called when all listeners have agreed to close, or if the closeForced method is called itself.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle.firstName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle.lastName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle.onSave}" text="Save" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textarea id="g_13" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.YESNOPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpLifecycle}")

public class DemoWpLifecycle 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    class MyLifecycleListener extends WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener
    {
        public boolean close()
        {
            protocol("close()");
            if (m_dataWasChanged == false)
                return true;
            else
            {
                YESNOPopup.createInstance("UnsavedData",
                                          "Data was changed. Do you really want to exit?",
                                          new YESNOPopup.IYesNoListener()
                                          {
                                              public void reactOnNo()
                                              {
                                              }
                                              public void reactOnYes()
                                              {
                                                  getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpageForced(getWorkpage());
                                                  if (getCloseContinueOperation() != null)
                                                      getCloseContinueOperation().run();
                                              }
                                          });
                return false;
            }
        }
        public void closeForced()
        {
            protocol("closeForced()");
        }
        public void reactOnDestroyed()
        {
            protocol("reactOnDestroyed()");
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnShownInContentArea()
        {
            System.out.println("*******************************************");
            System.out.println("* "+createTimeStamp()+" reactOnShownInContentArea()");
            System.out.println("*******************************************");
            protocol("reactOnShownInContentArea()");
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnHiddenInContentArea()
        {
            System.out.println("*******************************************");
            System.out.println("* "+createTimeStamp()+" reactOnHiddenInContentArea()");
            System.out.println("*******************************************");
            protocol("reactOnHiddenInContentArea()");
        }
        @Override
        public void reactOnShownInPopup()
        {
            protocol("reactOnShownInPopup()");
        }
        
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected boolean m_dataWasChanged = false;
    protected String m_lastName = "Last";
    protected String m_firstName = "First";
    protected String m_protocol = "Protocol:";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoWpLifecycle(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new MyLifecycleListener());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; m_dataWasChanged = true; }

    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; m_dataWasChanged = true; }

    public void setProtocol(String value) { m_protocol = value; }
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    
    public void onSave(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Data was saved.");
        m_dataWasChanged = false;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void protocol(String s)
    {
        m_protocol += "\n" + createTimeStamp() + " - " + s;
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"##### " + s);
    }
    
    private String createTimeStamp()
    {
        DateFormat df = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy/MM/dd - HH.mm.ss.SSS");
        return df.format(new Date());
    }
}

Set title at runtime

Define a new title and press the button - the titel that you input will be the new workpage title. Both the title bar and the workpage selector (on the bottom of the screen) will be updated accordingly.

In addition to changing the title of the workpage you can change the id as well - using the IWorkpage.setId() method.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Title" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle.title}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Selector Title" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle.selectorTitle}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle.onUpdateTitle}" text="Update Workpage Title" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_13" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle.onUpdateImage}" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/calendar_16x16.svg" text="Update Workpage Image" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.Workpage;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWorkpageSetTitle}")

public class DemoWorkpageSetTitle 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoWorkpageSetTitle(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        if (getWorkpage() != null)
        {
            // take over current title
            m_title = getWorkpage().getTitle();
            m_selectorTitle = getWorkpage().getSelectorTitle();
            getWorkpage().setIconURL("/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/calendar_16x16.svg");
        }
    }

    protected String m_title = "Update Workpage Title";
    public String getTitle() { return m_title; }
    public void setTitle(String value) { m_title = value; }
    
    protected String m_selectorTitle = "Update Workpage Title";
    public void setSelectorTitle(String value) { m_selectorTitle = value; }
    public String getSelectorTitle() { return m_selectorTitle; }
    
    public void onUpdateTitle(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (getWorkpage() != null)
        {
            getWorkpage().setTitle(m_title);
            getWorkpage().setSelectorTitle(m_selectorTitle);
        }
    }

    public void onUpdateImage(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (getWorkpage() != null)
        {
            getWorkpage().setIconURL("/images/iconssvg/demoshow_16x16.svg");
        }
    }

}

Start content as Popup

Enter your name into the field "Your Name" and press "Hello!" afterwards. The result field will be updated accordingly.

Compare the graphical layout with the layout definition which is shown inside the "Layout XML" area. The layout is assembled out of a set of components, each component defining its graphical layout and its relation to the backend processing.

Have a look onto the Java code of the managed bean which reflects the graphical processing on backend side. For each field you find one property definition, the button is linked with a method.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHelloWorld}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:field id="g_4" accessiblename="Your Name" align="center" clientname="yourName" labeltext="Your name" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoHelloWorld.name}" width="250" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoHelloWorld.onHello}" clientname="onHello" hotkey="ctrl-72" text="Say Hello!" width="100+" />
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" accessiblename="Result" align="center" clientname="result" stylevariant="ccbig" text="#{d.DemoHelloWorld.output}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoHelloWorld extends PageBean
{
    String m_name;
    String m_output;
    
    public DemoHelloWorld(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }
    public String getName() { return m_name; }
    
    public String getOutput() 
    { 
        return m_output; 
    }
    
    public void onHello(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_name == null)
        {
            m_output = "No name defined.";
            Statusbar.outputError("Please define some name!");
        }
        else
        {
            m_output = "Hello World, "+m_name+"!";
        }
    }
    
}

Passing Data

Bjrn Borg

You can pass parameters from the starting component (e.g. node within the function tree of the workplace) to the workpage instance that is opened.

In the function tree you can pass parameters using a setParam(name,value) interface - in the workpage there is the counter part: a getParam(name) method, that typcically is called in the constructor of a UI processing bean.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpPassData}">
  <t:row id="g_2" >
    <t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.firstName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.lastName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageStartInfo;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpPassData}")

public class DemoWpPassData
    extends PageBean // DemoBase extends WorkpageDisptachedBean
    implements IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo
{
    public DemoWpPassData(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
       super(dispatcher);
    }

    /**
     * This method is called by the workpage dispatcher just after
     * creating the object within the dispatcher context.
     */
    public void prepare(IWorkpageStartInfo workpageStartInfo)
    {
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"########## prepare was called in bean");
        m_firstName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("firstName");
        m_lastName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("lastName");
    }

    protected String m_lastName;
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    protected String m_firstName;
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

}

John McEnroe

You can pass parameters from the starting component (e.g. node within the function tree of the workplace) to the workpage instance that is opened.

In the function tree you can pass parameters using a setParam(name,value) interface - in the workpage there is the counter part: a getParam(name) method, that typcically is called in the constructor of a UI processing bean.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpPassData}">
  <t:row id="g_2" >
    <t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.firstName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.lastName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageStartInfo;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpPassData}")

public class DemoWpPassData
    extends PageBean // DemoBase extends WorkpageDisptachedBean
    implements IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo
{
    public DemoWpPassData(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
       super(dispatcher);
    }

    /**
     * This method is called by the workpage dispatcher just after
     * creating the object within the dispatcher context.
     */
    public void prepare(IWorkpageStartInfo workpageStartInfo)
    {
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"########## prepare was called in bean");
        m_firstName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("firstName");
        m_lastName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("lastName");
    }

    protected String m_lastName;
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    protected String m_firstName;
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

}

Boris Becker

You can pass parameters from the starting component (e.g. node within the function tree of the workplace) to the workpage instance that is opened.

In the function tree you can pass parameters using a setParam(name,value) interface - in the workpage there is the counter part: a getParam(name) method, that typcically is called in the constructor of a UI processing bean.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpPassData}">
  <t:row id="g_2" >
    <t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.firstName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="120" />
    <t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoWpPassData.lastName}" width="150" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageStartInfo;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpPassData}")

public class DemoWpPassData
    extends PageBean // DemoBase extends WorkpageDisptachedBean
    implements IPrepareByWorkpageStartInfo
{
    public DemoWpPassData(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
       super(dispatcher);
    }

    /**
     * This method is called by the workpage dispatcher just after
     * creating the object within the dispatcher context.
     */
    public void prepare(IWorkpageStartInfo workpageStartInfo)
    {
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"########## prepare was called in bean");
        m_firstName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("firstName");
        m_lastName = workpageStartInfo.getParam("lastName");
    }

    protected String m_lastName;
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    protected String m_firstName;
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

}

Close by Timer

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:timer id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpCloseTimer.onClose}" duration="3000" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowbodypane id="g_3" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="This workpage will be closed after 3 seconds." />
</t:row>
</t:rowbodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpCloseTimer}")

public class DemoWpCloseTimer
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoWpCloseTimer(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onClose(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpage(getWorkpage());
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Error when closing: " + t.toString());
        }
    }

}

Drop Info onto Node

This example shows that you can drop information from any area, e.g. the content area, into the workplace function tree. Drop the icons of this page onto the node "Drop Info onto Node" on the left - this is the node you started this page from. A corresponding message will show up and a new node will be added within the function node tree.

In order to process the drop event you neeed to override the "FunctionNode" class - you find the code within the program "workplace/WPFunctionTreeGeneral.java".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpDropInfo}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:icon id="g_3" dragsend="WPINFO:Main Street" image="/images/pictures/ph0.jpg" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:icon id="g_5" dragsend="WPINFO:Cable Car" image="/images/pictures/ph1.jpg" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFunctionTree.FunctionNode;

public class DemoWpDropInfo extends PageBean
{
    public DemoWpDropInfo(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

// This is the implementation within WPFunctionTreeGeneral:
//
//
///**
// * Example for implementing a node with drop processing.
// */
//public class DropableFunctionNode extends FunctionNode
//{
//    public DropableFunctionNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parent, String page, String dropReceive)
//    {
//        super(parent, page);
//        setDropReceive(dropReceive);
//    }
//    public DropableFunctionNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem page, String dropReceive)
//    {
//        super(page);
//        setDropReceive(dropReceive);
//    }
//    @Override
//    public void processTREENDOEAction(ActionEvent event)
//    {
//        super.processTREENDOEAction(event);
//        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
//        {
//            BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
//            OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance("Drop was received","Drop Info = " + baed.getDragInfo());
//            if (baed.getDragInfo().startsWith("WPINFO:"))
//            {
//                // add a new node behind the dropped one
//                FunctionNode newNode = new FunctionNode(getParentNode(),"/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp");
//                newNode.setText("NEW: " + baed.getDragInfo().substring(7)); newNode.setStatus(FunctionNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
//                getParentNode().moveSubNodeBehind(newNode,this);
//            }
//        }
//    }
//}

Immediately opening popup

The content page is opened as popup, inside the content page there is another popup that is internally opened when starting the content page.

The opening of the page is done within the workplace tree (workplace/WPFunctionTreeGeneral.java):

public class PpopupImmediateOpenFunctionNode extends FunctionNode
{
public PpopupImmediateOpenFunctionNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode, String page)
{
super(parentNode,page);
}
@Override
public void onRowExecute()
{
IWorkpage wp = loadContentPage(getWorkpageStartInfo());
DemoPopupImmediateOpen pip = (DemoPopupImmediateOpen)wp.getDispatcher().getDispatchedBean(DemoPopupImmediateOpen.class);
pip.prepare();
}
}

and:

sub = new PpopupImmediateOpenFunctionNode(top,"/workplace/demopopupimmediateopen.jsp"); sub.setOpenAsPopupByDefault(true);
sub.setText("Immediately opening popup"); sub.setStatus(FunctionNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);



There are some rules you need to pay attention to:

(.) The opening of the popup should be done within the invoke phase of the request processing. It is not a good idea to open the popup as part of the constructor processing of the page that is opened within the workplace.

Background: the constructor typically is called (when being accessed first time) within the rendering phase - at this phase you should not manipulate the current page anymore (parts of it may already be rendered!), and opening a popup means an update for the page. This can lead to "funny" situations, in which a popup is opened within the constructor of the opended workpage-bean, but becomes visible one roundtrip later.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:beanmethodinvoker id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupImmediateOpen.onOpenPopup}" jsfphase="renderBegin" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowheader id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupImmediateOpen.onCloseWorkpage}" text="Close this workpage" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_5" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupImmediateOpen}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="No content - this page immediately opens a modal popup when opened." />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupImmediateOpen}")

public class DemoPopupImmediateOpen 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    ModalPopup m_popup;

    public DemoPopupImmediateOpen(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    /*
     *  The prepare is called from the workplace processing (workplace/WPFunctionTreeGeneral.java).
     */
    public void prepare()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Preparing popup");
        m_popup = getOwningDispatcher().createModalPopup();
        m_popup.open("/workplace/demopopupimmediateopen2.jsp","Title of Popup",400,300,new DefaultModalPopupListener(m_popup));
        m_popup.setLeftTopReferenceCentered();
    }

    public void onCloseWorkpage(ActionEvent event)
    {
        getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpage(getWorkpage());
    }
    
    public void onClose(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Closing popup");
            m_popup.close();
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
        }
    }

    
}

Inter Workpage Events

Receiving Page

This is the "receiver" part of the demo. It contains a grid, which is empty at the beginning. Open the "sender" part of the demo and press the corresponding button in the sender screen. Every time you press the button in the "sender" screen then a new item will be generated within the "receiver" screen.

What's all this about? - This example demonstrates how two workpages that run isolated from one another can and should talk to one another: through workpage eventing. The one workpage throws an event, the other one receives it and reacts correspondingly.

This demo is a quite technical one: typical examples of the real world are: in the one workpage you see a list of objects, in a second you see the detail of one object. When saving the detail the list needs to be updated. Instead of hard-wiring the pages you couple the pages through eventing.

Please, do not get confused: the workpage events have nothing to do with thw JSF events!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpReceive}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpReceive.rows}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageProcessingEventListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageProcessingEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpReceive}")

public class DemoWpReceive
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyWorkpageProcessingEventListener
        implements IWorkpageProcessingEventListener
    {
        public void processEvent(WorkpageProcessingEvent event)
        {
            if (event instanceof DemoWpAddItemEvent)
                addNewItem();
        }
    }
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
        
        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoWpReceive(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        getWorkpage().addWorkpageProcessingEventListener(new MyWorkpageProcessingEventListener());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void addNewItem()
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.setFirstName("New first name");
        row.setLastName("New last name");
        m_rows.getItems().add(row);
    }
    
}

Sending Page

This is the "sender" part of the workpage eventing demo. Please check the documentation of the "receiver" part for more information.

The demo runs best if you open the sender part in a window on its own, i.e. if you isolate it from the workplace window.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpSend}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Create Item" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpSend.onCreateItem}" text="Execute!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpSend}")

public class DemoWpSend 
    extends PageBean // extends WorkpageDispatcherBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoWpSend(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onCreateItem(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        DemoWpAddItemEvent workpageEvent = new DemoWpAddItemEvent();
        getWorkpage().throwWorkpageProcessingEvent(workpageEvent);
    }
}

Close all others on open

This example shows how to remove "all other" work pages by page that is opened in the workplace environment.

Please take a look into the Java Code for more information.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpRemoveOthersOnOpen}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" border="0" text="Maybe you did notice? All other work pages were removed when opening this page?" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Number of removed workpages:" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoWpRemoveOthersOnOpen.numberOfRemovedWorkpages}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpage;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpRemoveOthersOnOpen}")

public class DemoWpRemoveOthersOnOpen
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    protected int m_numberOfRemovedWorkpages;
    public int getNumberOfRemovedWorkpages() { return m_numberOfRemovedWorkpages; }

    public DemoWpRemoveOthersOnOpen(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        removeOthers();
    }
    
    private void removeOthers()
    {
        List<IWorkpage> wps = getWorkpageContainer().getAllWorkpagesIncludingSubWorkpageContainers();
        for (IWorkpage wp: wps)
        {
            if (wp == getWorkpage()) continue; // do not remove myself...
            if (wp.isCloseSupported() == false) continue; // do not remove the ones that are fix
            getWorkpageContainer().closeWorkpageForced(wp);
            m_numberOfRemovedWorkpages++;
        }
    }

}

Modify Function Tree at Runtime

This demo shows how to update the function tree of the workplace using the corresponding Java API.

The workplace receives an object (WorkPlaceFunctionTreeInfoNode hierarchy). The top hierarchy layer is the one to create the outtlookbar-items. The follow on layers are directly transferred into the corresponding tree.

The XML configuration of the workplace is a 1:1 mapping of the object passed via the API into XML using JAX-B serialization.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Using API..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree.onShowDynamicallyCreatedTree}" text="Set dynamically created Tree" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_7" coldistance="Using XML..." >
<t:label id="g_8" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Using API..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree.onShowDefaultXml}" text="Show default.xml" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree.onShowModifiedDefaultXml}" text="Show modified default.xml" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree.onShowComponentsXml}" text="Show components.xml" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ThreadData;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageContainer;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWpSetFunctionTree}")

public class DemoWpSetFunctionTree
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructor
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoWpSetFunctionTree(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /*
     * Update of the function tree with some dynamic structure.
     */
    public void onShowDynamicallyCreatedTree(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode n1 = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode n2 = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
            n2.setText("Node Level 1 / Instance " + i);
            n1.getSubNodes().add(n2);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode n3 = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
                n3.setText("Node Level 2 / Instance " + j);
                for (int k=0; k<5; k++)
                {
                    WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode n4 = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
                    n4.setText("Node Level 3 / Instance " + k);
                    WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
                    n4.setWorkpageStartInfo(wpsi);
                    wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp");
                    n3.getSubNodes().add(n4);
                }
                n2.getSubNodes().add(n3);
            }
        }
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().importWorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode(n1);
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().setObIndex(0);
        // the following line is only required if using performance optimization (isoaltion of update areas)
        ThreadData.getInstance().registerChangeUpdatingAllAreas();
    }

    /*
     * Update of the function tree by using the XML definition contained in the "components"-file.
     * The file is epxected to be located in the stream store in /ccworkplace/functiontrees/components.xml.
     * The XML of the file is parsed using JAX-B and the result of this parsing is padded into the workplace. 
     */
    public void onShowComponentsXml(ActionEvent event)
    {
        WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode node = WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager.loadFunctionTreeInfo("components");
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().importWorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode(node);
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().setObIndex(0);
        // the following line is only required if using performance optimization (isoaltion of update areas)
        ThreadData.getInstance().registerChangeUpdatingAllAreas();
    }
    
    public void onShowDefaultXml(ActionEvent event)
    {
        WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode node = WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager.loadFunctionTreeInfo("default");
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().importWorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode(node);
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().setObIndex(0);
        // the following line is only required if using performance optimization (isoaltion of update areas)
        ThreadData.getInstance().registerChangeUpdatingAllAreas();
    }
    
    public void onShowModifiedDefaultXml(ActionEvent event)
    {
        WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode node = WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager.loadFunctionTreeInfo("default",true);
        modifyNodes(node);
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().importWorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode(node);
        ((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer()).getFunctionsManager().setObIndex(0);
        // the following line is only required if using performance optimization (isoaltion of update areas)
        ThreadData.getInstance().registerChangeUpdatingAllAreas();
    }
    
    public void onShowDefaultForUser(ActionEvent event)
    {
        getWorkpageContainer().prepareWorkplaceForCurrentUser();
        // the following line is only required if using performance optimization (isoaltion of update areas)
        ThreadData.getInstance().registerChangeUpdatingAllAreas();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Just some "stupid" modification as demo: all nodes starting with "A", "H", "F"
     * are taken out of the function tree.
     */
    private void modifyNodes(WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode node)
    {
        List<WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode> subNodes = node.getSubNodes();
        for (int i=subNodes.size()-1; i>=0; i--)
        {
            WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode subNode = subNodes.get(i);
            String text = subNode.getText();
            if (text != null && (text.startsWith("A") || text.startsWith("H") || text.startsWith("F")))
            {
                subNodes.remove(i);
            }
            else
            {
                modifyNodes(subNode);
            }
        }
    }

    
}

Call Functions from Tree

Switch to "OnlyContent"
Switch to "DemoWorkplace"

Redirect client to URL/page

There are two components that redirect the client to a complete different page.

CLIENTREDIRECTURL navigates to a new URL - the client will be closed as consequence.

CLIENREDIRECTPAGE navigates to a different dialog of your project. You may decide if this navigation should happen within the existing session or if a new session is to be created.

Please pay attention: the purpose of redirecting is NOT to implement normal, logic-driven page navigation. The normal page navigation should be properly done by structuring page beans using the ROWPAGEBEANINCLUD component! (!!!)

The navigation via redirecting to a URL or page is used for exceptional cases only:
(.) you want to navigate to an error page
(.) you want to close the current client and navigate to some normal URL

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:clientredirecturl id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoRedirect.urlTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoRedirect.url}" />
<t:clientredirectpage id="g_3" keepsession="#{d.DemoRedirect.keepSession}" page="#{d.DemoRedirect.page}" trigger="#{d.DemoRedirect.pageTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRedirect}">
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Redirect to URL" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="URL" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_9" text="#{d.DemoRedirect.url}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoRedirect.onRedirectURLAction}" text="Redirect" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Redirect to Page" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Page" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_18" text="#{d.DemoRedirect.page}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_21" selected="#{d.DemoRedirect.keepSession}" text="Keep session" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoRedirect.onRedirectPageAction}" text="Redirect" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRedirect}")

public class DemoRedirect
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    boolean m_keepSession = false;
    String m_page = "/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp"; 
    String m_url = "http://www.captaincasa.com";
    Trigger m_pageTrigger = new Trigger();
    Trigger m_urlTrigger = new Trigger();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRedirect(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoredirect.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRedirect}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public boolean getKeepSession() { return m_keepSession; }
    public void setKeepSession(boolean value) { this.m_keepSession = value; }

    public String getPage() { return m_page; }
    public void setPage(String value) { this.m_page = value; }

    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }
    public void setUrl(String value) { this.m_url = value; }

    public Trigger getPageTrigger() { return m_pageTrigger; }
    public Trigger getUrlTrigger() { return m_urlTrigger; }

    public void onRedirectPageAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        DemoHelloWorld dhw = (DemoHelloWorld)getOwningDispatcher().getTopOwner().getDispatchedBean(DemoHelloWorld.class);
        dhw.setName("Captain");
        m_pageTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onRedirectURLAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_urlTrigger.trigger();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Semi modal popup dialogs

Update workplace layout

By pressing one of the buttons the workplace layout is updated accordingly.

The workplace layout either is defined as XML configuration (in /eclntjsfserver/config/ccworkplace/perspectives) or it is passed as configuration object at runtime.

The API "WorkplaceTileManager.importWorkplaceTileInfo(...)" provides two parameters:

(.) the first one to pass the workplace layout configuration
(.) the second one that decides if exsiting pages are close before switiching, of if they are left open

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_11" text="The following two layouts are part of the demo project&#39;s XML configuration (eclntkjsfserver/config/ccworplace/perspectives):" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout.onOneContentAreaAction}" text="One content area" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout.onNavigationLeftAction}" text="Navigation left" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:textpane id="g_15" text="The following layout is created by coding:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout.onSearchRightAction}" text="Navigation and Search separated" width="300+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileInfoSplitPane;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout}")

public class DemoWorkplaceTileLayout
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoWorkplaceTileLayout(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoworkplacetilelayout.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoWorkplaceTileLayout}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onOneContentAreaAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().importWorkplaceTileInfo("OnlyContent",false);
        getWorkpageContainer().switchToWorkpage(getWorkpage());
    }
    
    public void onNavigationLeftAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().importWorkplaceTileInfo("DemoWorkplace",false);
        getWorkpageContainer().switchToWorkpage(getWorkpage());
    }
    
    public void onSearchRightAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        WorkplaceTileInfo tileInfo = buildWorkplaceLayout();
        getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().importWorkplaceTileInfo(tileInfo,false);
        getWorkpageContainer().switchToWorkpage(getWorkpage());
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private WorkplaceTileInfo buildWorkplaceLayout()
    {
        WorkplaceTileInfo result = new WorkplaceTileInfo();
        {
            // outest area is a split pane, horizontally divided
            WorkplaceTileInfoSplitPane splitOutest = new WorkplaceTileInfoSplitPane();
            result.setSplit(splitOutest);
            splitOutest.setOrientation("horizontal");
            splitOutest.setDividerLocation("300");
            {
                // left split area is a split pane, vertically divided
                WorkplaceTileInfoSplitPane splitLeft = new WorkplaceTileInfoSplitPane();
                splitOutest.setSubSplit1(splitLeft);
                splitLeft.setOrientation("vertical");
                splitLeft.setDividerLocation("50%");
                {
                    // left split is providing two content areas
                    {
                        WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer functionContent = new WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer();
                        functionContent.setId("FUNCTIONS");
                        splitLeft.setSubContainer1(functionContent);
                    }
                    {
                        WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer functionContent = new WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer();
                        functionContent.setId("SEARCH");
                        splitLeft.setSubContainer2(functionContent);
                    }
                }
                // right area is the content area
                WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer mainContent = new WorkplaceTileInfoPageContainer();
                splitOutest.setSubContainer2(mainContent);
            }
            // start default pages
            {
                WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
                wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/wpfunctiontrees.jsp");
                wpsi.setId("wpfunctionbar");
                wpsi.setDecorated(false);
                wpsi.setCloseSupported(false);
                wpsi.setStartSubWorkpageContainerId("FUNCTIONS");
                result.getStartViews().add(wpsi);
            }
            {
                WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
                wpsi.setJspPage("/workplace/wpfunctionsearch.jsp");
                wpsi.setId("/workplace/wpfunctionsearch.jsp");
                wpsi.setDecorated(false);
                wpsi.setCloseSupported(false);
                wpsi.setStartSubWorkpageContainerId("SEARCH");
                result.getStartViews().add(wpsi);
            }
        }
        return result;
    }
}

Workplace functions as component (PBC)

Since update 20210118 the workplace function tree is available as proper page bean component within the addons.

The interface is nearly the same as the one that you might know from existing workplace functions, but now the page is available as real page bean. Which means: you can define multiple instances on one or several pages which run completely separated from one another.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="10" >
<t:pane id="g_4" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_6" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions.searchFirst}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_8" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions.first}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_9" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_11" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions.searchSecond}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_13" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions.second}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCWorkplaceFunctions;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode;

@CCGenClass(expressionBase = "#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions}")

public class DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions 
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCWorkplaceFunctions m_first;
    CCWorkplaceFunctions m_second;
    CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup m_searchFirst;
    CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup m_searchSecond;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_first = new CCWorkplaceFunctions(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_second = new CCWorkplaceFunctions(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_searchFirst = new CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup(getOwningDispatcher());
        m_searchSecond = new CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup(getOwningDispatcher());
        {
            // read from configuration
            WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode root = WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoManager.loadFunctionTreeInfo("default");
            m_first.prepare(root,null);
            m_searchFirst.prepare(m_first,null);
        }
        {
            // assemble via API
            WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode root = buildFunctionTree();
            m_second.prepare(root,null);
            m_searchSecond.prepare(m_second,null);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName()
    {
        return "/workplace/demopbcccworkplacefunctions.jsp";
    }

    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage()
    {
        return "#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkplaceFunctions}";
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCWorkplaceFunctions getFirst() { return m_first; } 
    public CCWorkplaceFunctions getSecond() { return m_second; } 
    public CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup getSearchFirst() { return m_searchFirst; }
    public CCWorkplaceSearchViaPopup getSearchSecond() { return m_searchSecond; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode buildFunctionTree()
    {
        WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode root = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode top = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
            top.setText("Top " + i);
            root.getSubNodes().add(top);
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode sub = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
                sub.setText("Sub " + i);
                top.getSubNodes().add(sub);
                for (int k=0; k<5; k++)
                {
                    WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode node = new WorkplaceFunctionTreeInfoNode();
                    node.setText("Node " + i);
                    WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
