                    node.setWorkpageStartInfo(wpsi);
                    wpsi.setPageBeanName("DemoHelloWorld");
                    sub.getSubNodes().add(node);
                }
            }
        }
        return root;
    }

}

Titlebar with extensions (PBC)

The page bean component "CCWorkpageTitle" builds a title bar on top of your workpage that you can extend by own components.

You need to start the corresponding workpage in undecorated mode (WorkpageStartInfo.decorated to be defined as "false").

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle}" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_24" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle.titleUI}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCWorkpageTitle" shownullcontent="true" >
<t:pane id="g_25" exitid="TITLEBAR_RIGHT" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:menubar id="g_8" background="#00000000" >
<t:menu id="g_9" foreground="#F0F0F0" text="Menu 1" >
<t:menuitem id="g_10" text="Item 1" />
<t:menuitem id="g_21" text="Item 2" />
<t:menuitem id="g_22" text="Item 3" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
<t:icon id="g_7" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_light_16x16.svg" />
<t:coldistance id="g_31" width="20" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:pagebeancomponent>
</t:row>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle}" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_2" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="20%" />
<t:textpane id="g_17" text="Please check the title bar of this workpage on the top - it contains additional items: a menu and an icon." width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_28" width="20%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_29" height="100%" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCWorkpageTitle;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle}")

public class DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCWorkpageTitle m_titleUI;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_titleUI = new CCWorkpageTitle(getOwningDispatcher());
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccworkpagetitle.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCWorkpageTitle}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCWorkpageTitle getTitleUI() { return m_titleUI; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Multiple workplaces

Base functions

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.onStart2ndWorkplaceAction}" text="Start 2nd workplace" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.onStartPageAction}" text="Start &#34;Hello world&#34;" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:field id="g_15" labeltext="First name" text="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.firstName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:field id="g_17" labeltext="Last name" text="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.lastName}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.onStartPageAndPassDataAction}" text="Start and pass data" width="200+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace.onStartTestPageAction}" text="Start event test" width="200+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.MultiWorkplaceConnector;
import org.eclnt.workplace.MultiWorkplaceConnector.WorkplaceConfiguration;
import org.eclnt.workplace.MultiWorkplaceWorkpageDefaultProcessingEventListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageProcessingEvent;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace}")

public class DemoMultiWorkplace
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_startURL;
    Trigger m_startURLTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_firstName = "Captain";
    String m_lastName = "Casa";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMultiWorkplace(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        getWorkpage().addWorkpageProcessingEventListener(new MultiWorkplaceWorkpageDefaultProcessingEventListener()
        {
            @Override
            public boolean checkIfEventIsRelevant(WorkpageProcessingEvent event)
            {
                if (event instanceof DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.MyEvent)
                    return true;
                else
                    return false;
            }
            @Override
            public void processEvent(WorkpageProcessingEvent event)
            {
                if (event instanceof DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.MyEvent)
                {
                    DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.MyEvent e = (DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.MyEvent)event;
                    Statusbar.outputSuccess("Received event: " + e.getEventMessage());
                }
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomultiworkplace.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMultiWorkplace}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Trigger getStartURLTrigger() { return m_startURLTrigger; }
    public String getStartURL() { return m_startURL; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; } 
    public void setFirstName(String firstName) { m_firstName = firstName; }
    
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String lastName) { m_lastName = lastName; }

    public void onStart2ndWorkplaceAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            WorkplaceConfiguration wpconfig = new WorkplaceConfiguration();
            wpconfig.setWindowFeatures("left=100,top=100,width=1000,height=800");
            wpconfig.setWorkplaceURL("/workplace.workplaceMWPBlank.risc");
            MultiWorkplaceConnector.instance().startWorkplace
            (
                getOwningDispatcher(),
                "SECOND",
                wpconfig,
                null
            );
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public void onStartPageAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setPageBeanName(DemoHelloWorld.class.getSimpleName());
            wpsi.setText("Hello!");
            MultiWorkplaceConnector.instance().startWorkpage(getOwningDispatcher(),"SECOND",null,wpsi,false);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    public void onStartPageAndPassDataAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setPageBeanName(DemoWpPassData.class.getSimpleName());
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(false);
            wpsi.setText("Pass data");
            wpsi.setParam("firstName",m_firstName);
            wpsi.setParam("lastName",m_lastName);
            wpsi.setId(DemoWpPassData.class.getName());
            MultiWorkplaceConnector.instance().startWorkpage(getOwningDispatcher(),"SECOND",null,wpsi,false);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public void onStartTestPageAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = new WorkpageStartInfo();
            wpsi.setPageBeanName(DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.class.getSimpleName());
            wpsi.setOpenMultipleInstances(false);
            wpsi.setText("Test");
            wpsi.setId(DemoMultiWorkplaceTest.class.getName());
            MultiWorkplaceConnector.instance().startWorkpage(getOwningDispatcher(),"SECOND",null,wpsi,false);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

List-detail scenario
Isolate parts of a page

This example shows how to isolate a certain page bean of an existing screen and start it in some own browser window.

The detail window is connected to the starting window by using the "DialogMessageBus" with its feature of cross client messaging. The detail screen gets notified when the user selected a person from the list - and vice versa the list screen gets notified when the detail is closed.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail}" >
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="20" >
<tpbc:datagridview2 id="g_17" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.dataGrid}" shownullcontent="true" >
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_19" propertyName="firstName" title="First name" />
<tpbc:datagridview2column id="g_11" propertyName="lastName" title="Last name" />
</tpbc:datagridview2>
<t:pane id="g_13" height="100%" rendered="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.renderedDetail}" width="100%" >
<t:rowheader id="g_21" rendered="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.renderedDetail}" >
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.onIsolateAction}" rendered="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.renderedDetail}" text="Isolate detail into own browser" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_15" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.detailUI}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.datagridview2.CCDataGridView2;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.messages.CrossDialogMessage;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.messages.DefaultDialogMessageBusListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.messages.DialogMessageBus;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.MultiWorkplaceConnector;
import org.eclnt.workplace.MultiWorkplaceConnector.WorkplaceConfiguration;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageStartInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.eximport.WorkplacePageBeanStateExtractor;

import workplace.logic.Person;
import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail}")

public class DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public static final String PARAM_NOTIFYONCLOSE = "notifyOnClose_" + DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.class.getName();
    
    public static final String MESSAGETYPE_DETAILCLOSED = "detailClosed_" + DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.class.getName();
    public static final String MESSAGETYPE_UPDATEDETAIL = "updateDetail_" + DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail.class.getName();
    
    CCDataGridView2<Person> m_dataGrid = new CCDataGridView2<Person>(Person.class);
    DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetailDetail m_detailUI;
    boolean m_detailIsIsolated = false;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        List<Person> ps = new ArrayList<Person>(RandomLogic.getAllPersons().values());
        m_dataGrid.prepare(ps,new CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<Person>() 
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnGridSelect(Person object)
            {
                showPersonDetail(object.getId());
            }
        });
        m_detailUI = new DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetailDetail(workpageDispatcher);
        DialogMessageBus.instance().addListener(new DefaultDialogMessageBusListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnMessage(Object o)
            {
                if (CrossDialogMessage.checkIfMessageMatches(o,MESSAGETYPE_DETAILCLOSED))
                {
                    m_detailIsIsolated = false;
                }
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoworkplaceisolatedetail.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetail}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCDataGridView2 getDataGrid() { return m_dataGrid; }
    public DemoWorkplaceIsolateDetailDetail getDetailUI() { return m_detailUI; }

    public boolean getRenderedDetail() 
    { 
        return m_dataGrid.getSelectedObject() != null && m_detailIsIsolated == false; 
    }
    
    public void onIsolateAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        WorkpageStartInfo wpsi = WorkplacePageBeanStateExtractor.instance().extractWorkpageStartInfo(m_detailUI);
        wpsi.setText("Person Detail");
        wpsi.setCloseSupported(false);
        wpsi.setParam(PARAM_NOTIFYONCLOSE,"true");
        wpsi.setDecorated(false);
        WorkplaceConfiguration wpconfig = new WorkplaceConfiguration();
        wpconfig.setWorkplaceURL("/workplace.workplaceMWPBlank.risc");
        wpconfig.setWindowFeatures("left=250,top=250,width=500,height=800,toolbar=no,menubar=no,resizable=yes");
        MultiWorkplaceConnector.instance().startWorkpage
        (
            Dispatcher.getDialogSessionInstance(),
            "PERSONDETAIL",
            wpconfig,
            wpsi, 
            true
        );
        m_detailIsIsolated = true;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void showPersonDetail(String personId)
    {
        CrossDialogMessage cdm = new CrossDialogMessage(MESSAGETYPE_UPDATEDETAIL,personId);
        DialogMessageBus.instance().publishMessageToAllClientDialogs(cdm);
    }
}

Export / Import current workplace

For various reasons you might export the current workplace settings - and import them at a later point of time.

Example: you want that the user sees the same workplace that he/she left when logging on next time to the system.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport.onExportAction}" text="Export" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport.onImportAction}" text="Import" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textarea id="g_12" height="100%" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport.xml}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.streamstore.StreamStore;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageContainer;
import org.eclnt.workplace.eximport.WorkplaceExporter;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport}")

public class DemoWorkplaceExImport
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_xml;
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoWorkplaceExImport(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoworkplaceeximport.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoWorkplaceExImport}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getXml() { return m_xml; }
    public void setXml(String value) { this.m_xml = value; }

    public void onImportAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_xml = StreamStore.getInstance().readUTF8("ccdemos/workplaceeximport/workplace.xml",false);
        if (m_xml != null)
            new WorkplaceExporter().importWorkplaceFromXML((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer(),m_xml);
    }

    public void onExportAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_xml = new WorkplaceExporter().exportCurrentWorkplaceToXML((WorkpageContainer)getWorkpageContainer());
        StreamStore.getInstance().writeUTF8("ccdemos/workplaceeximport/workplace.xml",m_xml,true);
    }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

API to access sizing

This demo shows how to access the tile arrangement of the current workplace.

The API allows e.g. to read (and to set) the divider location of the workplace splitpanes.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing.onAnalyzeAction}" text="Analyze" width="100+" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="50" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing.onSetTop300Action}" text="Set top divider location to 300" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textarea id="g_8" enabled="false" height="100%" labeltext="Result of analysis" text="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileManager.WorkplaceTile;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileManager.WorkplaceTileSplit;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkplaceTileManager.WorkplaceTileWorkpageContainer;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing}")

public class DemoWorkplaceAPISizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_protocol;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoWorkplaceAPISizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        WorkplaceTileSplit top = (WorkplaceTileSplit)getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().getTopTile();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoworkplaceapisizing.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoWorkplaceAPISizing}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onAnalyzeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        analyze(sb);
        m_protocol = sb.toString();
    }

    public void onSetTop300Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            // assume top tile is split pane
            // this is dependent on the workplace configuration and must not be true! A workplace can
            // also consist out of a workpage container only.
            WorkplaceTileSplit top = (WorkplaceTileSplit)getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().getTopTile();
            top.setDividerLocation("300");
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("Problem occurred: " + t.toString(),ValueManager.getStackstraceString(t));
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void analyze(StringBuffer sb)
    {
        WorkplaceTile top = getWorkpageContainer().getTileManager().getTopTile();
        if (top == null)
        {
            sb.append("Not in a workplace environment.");
        }
        else
        {
            analyzeTile(0,sb,top);
        }
    }

    private void analyzeTile(int level, StringBuffer sb, WorkplaceTile tile)
    {
        String prefix = "\n" + ValueManager.createEmptyString(level*4);
        sb.append(prefix);
        if (tile == null)
        {
            sb.append("null");
        }
        if (tile instanceof WorkplaceTileSplit)
        {
            WorkplaceTileSplit split = (WorkplaceTileSplit)tile;
            sb.append("SPLIT: Horizontal:" + split.isHorizontal() + ", DividerLocation:" + split.getDividerLocation());
            analyzeTile(level+1,sb,split.getSplit1());
            analyzeTile(level+1,sb,split.getSplit2());
        }
        else if (tile instanceof WorkplaceTileWorkpageContainer)
        {
            WorkplaceTileWorkpageContainer container = (WorkplaceTileWorkpageContainer)tile;
            sb.append("CONTAINER: Id:" + container.getContainerId());
        }
    }

}

Client Integration

Mini Browser

The JBROWSER component is the Java-base HTML browsert that comes with the Java runtime. Well, to be honest, you should not compare this browser with any type of native browser (Internet Explorer, Firexfox, etc.) - it only renderes basics HTML. But typically it's good enough to render static HTML, e.g. help texts within the online help.

There is a "real browser" component as well: the BROWSER. This component integrated the native browser of the environment, and as consequence is able to render any HTML. But: it requires the availability of the so called swt.jar on client side, which integrated the real browser into the Java processing. The size of the swt.jar is 2 MB approximately.

So in many cases it makes sense to use JBROWSER for uncritical, static HTML text.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoJbrowser}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="URL" width="80" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoJbrowser.url}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoJbrowser.onShowURL}" text="Load" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:jbrowser id="g_8" height="100%" url="#{d.DemoJbrowser.shownURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLink;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoJbrowser}")

public class DemoJbrowser
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoJbrowser(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    protected String m_shownURL;
    public String getShownURL() { return m_shownURL; }
    public void setShownURL(String value) { m_shownURL = value; }

    protected String m_url = "/workplacehelp/de/lastName.html";
    public void setUrl(String value) { m_url = value; }
    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }

    public void onShowURL(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_shownURL = m_url;
    }
}

Mini Browser with Actions

The JBROWSER component allows to embed "special" links, that call a server side action listener.

These special links must be defined in the way "<a href='ACTION:anyfurtherinfo'>Text</a>", i.e. the reference must start with "ACTION:".

On server side an action listener is called, receiving a BaseActionEventLink event object.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoJbrowserAction}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="URL" width="80" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoJbrowserAction.url}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoJbrowserAction.onShowURL}" text="Load" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:jbrowser id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoJbrowserAction.onBrowserAction}" height="100%" url="#{d.DemoJbrowserAction.shownURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLink;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoJbrowser}")

public class DemoJbrowserAction
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoJbrowserAction(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    protected String m_shownURL;
    public String getShownURL() { return m_shownURL; }
    public void setShownURL(String value) { m_shownURL = value; }

    protected String m_url = "/html/firstName.html";
    public void setUrl(String value) { m_url = value; }
    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }

    public void onShowURL(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_shownURL = m_url;
    }
    
    public void onBrowserAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventLink)
        {
            BaseActionEventLink e = (BaseActionEventLink)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Action was sent to server side: " + e.getLinkId());
        }
    }
}

Embedded Browser

The BROWSER component embeds some page within your dialog. Internally an IFRAME is used to embed the page.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoBrowser}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:field id="g_3" text="#{d.demoBrowser.url}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="2" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoBrowser.onLoad}" text="Load Page" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:browser id="g_7" height="100%" url="#{d.demoBrowser.browserUrl}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoBrowser extends PageBean
{
    public DemoBrowser(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

//    String m_url = "/pdf/pdftest1.pdf";
    String m_url = "http://www.captaincasa.com";
//    String m_url = "http://www.poksundo.com";
    String m_browserUrl = m_url;
    
    public void setUrl(String value) { m_url = value; }
    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }
    
    public void setBrowserUrl(String value) { m_browserUrl = value; }
    public String getBrowserUrl() { return m_browserUrl; }
    
    public void onLoad(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_browserUrl = m_url;
    }
}

Embedded Browser - Send/receive event messages

Even though a page is not located at the same origin (server:port) than an including page, it is possible to communicate via message-events into both directions.

The message events are created in the client using "window.postMessage(...)".

The BROWSER component provides the following features:

1. You can send an event object to the page included. The event message is defined as JSON string in attribute BROWSER-SENDEVENTMESSAGE. The actual sending of the event is triggered by using BROWSER-SENDEVENTMESSAGETRIGGER.

2. You can listen to events from the included page. For not receiving all potencial message events you have to specify a filter, in which you define the event-attributes and event-values that you are interested in.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_23" coldistance="10" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_24" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Send into page" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" height="120" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.message}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.onSendEventAction}" text="Send" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_26" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Recevied from page" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:textarea id="g_21" height="120" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.receivedMessage}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_5" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_30" text="Browser page" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:pane id="g_17" border="left:2;right:2;top:2;bottom:2;color:#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@baseColor@&#39;]}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:browser id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.onBrowserAction}" height="100%;300" receiveeventmessagefilter="mswp_type:mess;app_event:orderSaved" sendeventmessage="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.message}" sendeventmessagetrigger="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.eventMessageTrigger}" url="/workplace/browserevents/demo1.html" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_31" text="HTML source" >
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:textarea id="g_33" height="100%" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage.pageSource}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage}")

public class DemoBrowserEventMessage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_message;
    Trigger m_eventMessageTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_pageSource;
    String m_receivedMessage = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBrowserEventMessage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        readPageSource();
        buildMessage();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobrowsereventmessage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBrowserEventMessage}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getMessage() { return m_message; }
    public void setMessage(String value) { this.m_message = value; }

    public Trigger getEventMessageTrigger() { return m_eventMessageTrigger; }
    
    public void onSendEventAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_eventMessageTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onBrowserAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage)
        {
            BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage e = (BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage)event;
            m_receivedMessage += e.getEventMessageAsJSON() + "\n";
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Message received from browser: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
        }
    }

    public String getPageSource() { return m_pageSource; }
    public void setPageSource(String value) { this.m_pageSource = value; }

    public String getReceivedMessage() { return m_receivedMessage; }
    public void setReceivedMessage(String value) { this.m_receivedMessage = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildMessage()
    {
        Map<String,String> data = new HashMap<String,String>();
        data.put("mswp_type","message");
        data.put("app_command","showOrder");
        data.put("app_customer","4711");
        data.put("app_order","4500002434");
        Gson gs = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_message = gs.toJson(data);
    }

    private void readPageSource()
    {
        m_pageSource = WebResourceReader.readUTF8FileIntoString("workplace/browserevents/demo1.html");
    }

}

Pooled browser

The POOLEDBROWSER from a first perspective looks like a normal BROWSER component: there is an area in which a browser instance (iframe) is started.

...but: this browser instance is not managed as child of the corresponding area! It is managed on a top level within the client side component tree.

Reason: when switching from one workplace content page to the next then the internal browser instance is not removed from the component tree and then re-created when being shown again, but it stays stable at the top level so that the navigation state does not get lost.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPooledBrowser}" padding="0" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:field id="g_3" enabled="false" labeltext="URL that was passed by bean" text="#{d.DemoPooledBrowser.url2Show}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_5" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:pooledbrowser id="g_8" height="100%" poolid="#{d.DemoPooledBrowser.poolId}" url="#{d.DemoPooledBrowser.url2Show}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.POOLEDBROWSERUtil;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPooledBrowser}")

public class DemoPooledBrowser
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ensure that the URL is "new" for the pooled browser; the pooled browser
    // only updates its conent if there is a change in the URL that is sent
    final static String URL = "/html/firstName.html"; 
    String m_url2Show = URL+"?now="+UniqueIdCreator.createUUID();
    String m_poolId = "HARRY";

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPooledBrowser(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                // it's important to explicitly remove the pool instance on client side
                // when the browser instance is not required any more
                POOLEDBROWSERUtil.removePooledBrowserInClient(m_poolId);
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopooledbrowser.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPooledBrowser}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getUrl2Show() { return m_url2Show; }
    public void setUrl2Show(String value) { this.m_url2Show = value; }
    public String getPoolId() { return m_poolId; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Pooled browser - Send/receive event messages

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_23" coldistance="10" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_24" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Send into page" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" height="120" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.message}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.onSendEventAction}" text="Send" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_26" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Recevied from page" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:textarea id="g_21" height="120" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.receivedMessage}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_5" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_30" text="Browser page" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:pane id="g_17" border="left:2;right:2;top:2;bottom:2;color:#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@baseColor@&#39;]}" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:pooledbrowser id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.onBrowserAction}" height="100%;300" poolid="TEST" receiveeventmessagefilter="mswp_type:mess;app_event:orderSaved" sendeventmessage="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.message}" sendeventmessagetrigger="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.eventMessageTrigger}" url="/workplace/browserevents/demo1.html" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_31" text="HTML source" >
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:textarea id="g_33" height="100%" linewrap="false" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.pageSource}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage}")

public class DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_message;
    Trigger m_eventMessageTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_pageSource;
    String m_receivedMessage = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        readPageSource();
        buildMessage();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPooledBrowserEventMessage}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getMessage() { return m_message; }
    public void setMessage(String value) { this.m_message = value; }

    public Trigger getEventMessageTrigger() { return m_eventMessageTrigger; }
    
    public void onSendEventAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_eventMessageTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onBrowserAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage)
        {
            BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage e = (BaseActionEventBrowserEventMessage)event;
            m_receivedMessage += e.getEventMessageAsJSON() + "\n";
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Message received from browser: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
        }
    }

    public String getPageSource() { return m_pageSource; }
    public void setPageSource(String value) { this.m_pageSource = value; }

    public String getReceivedMessage() { return m_receivedMessage; }
    public void setReceivedMessage(String value) { this.m_receivedMessage = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildMessage()
    {
        Map<String,String> data = new HashMap<String,String>();
        data.put("mswp_type","message");
        data.put("app_command","showOrder");
        data.put("app_customer","4711");
        data.put("app_order","4500002434");
        Gson gs = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_message = gs.toJson(data);
    }

    private void readPageSource()
    {
        m_pageSource = WebResourceReader.readUTF8FileIntoString("workplace/browserevents/demo1.html");
    }

}

Start Browser

The component JSHOWURL allows to open up a URL within a native browser, that shows up as separate window.

By default you should switch JSHOWURL-USEDESKTOP to "true", so that on client side the Java Desktop API is used for opening the browser. There are other modes as well, that are only applicable with the Enterprise client being used in an applet environment. Please read the Developer's Guide for more information.

The component JSHOWURL is an invisible client component. On the one hand you pass the value of the URL that you want to open, on the other hand you start a trigger which makes the component start the browser.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:jshowurl id="g_2" target="#{d.DemoJshowurl.target}" trigger="#{d.DemoJshowurl.browserTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoJshowurl.url}" windowfeatures="#{d.DemoJshowurl.windowFeatures}" usedesktop="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoJshowurl}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_6" labeltext="URL" text="#{d.DemoJshowurl.url}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:radiobuttongroup id="g_12" labeltext="Target" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoJshowurl.targetVVS}" value="#{d.DemoJshowurl.target}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_29" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:combobox id="g_21" labeltext="Window features" value="#{d.DemoJshowurl.windowFeatures}" width="100%" withnullitem="true" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_22" text="width=800,height=600,left=100,top=100" value="width=800,height=600,left=100,top=100" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" text="width=800,height=200,left=400,top=400" value="width=800,height=200,left=400,top=400" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" text="width=100,height=100" value="width=100,height=100" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textpane id="g_27" font="weight:default" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="If setting features then the URL will be opened in some own brwoser instance - and not as browser tab." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoJshowurl.onOpenBrowser}" text="Open URL" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoJshowurl}")

public class DemoJshowurl
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_windowFeatures = null;
    protected Trigger m_browserTrigger = new Trigger();
    protected String m_url = "http://www.captaincasa.com";
    ValidValuesBinding m_targetVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_target;
    
    
    public DemoJshowurl(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_targetVVS.addValidValue(null,"normal");
        m_targetVVS.addValidValue("test","test");
        m_targetVVS.addValidValue("popup","popup");
    }
    
    public Trigger getBrowserTrigger() { return m_browserTrigger; }
    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }
    public void setUrl(String value) { m_url = value; }
 
    public void onOpenBrowser(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_browserTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public ValidValuesBinding getTargetVVS() { return m_targetVVS; }

    public String getTarget() { return m_target; }
    public void setTarget(String value) { this.m_target = value; }

    public String getWindowFeatures() { return m_windowFeatures; }
    public void setWindowFeatures(String value) { this.m_windowFeatures = value; }
    
}

Hyperlink

The HYPERLINK components is a link, opening a certain URL within the browser.

Core parameters are:

(.) the TEXT to be shown
(.) the URL to be opened when the user clicks the text

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHyperLink}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:hyperlink id="g_3" font="size:16" text="CaptainCasa Web Site" url="http://www.CaptainCasa.com" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:hyperlink id="g_5" text="http://www.google.com" url="http://www.google.com" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoHyperLink}")

public class DemoHyperLink
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoHyperLink(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }
}

Dynamic browser content

The TempFileManager is a server side utility to store files within some temporary directory that is associated with a session.

Due to a specific servlet the content of this temporary directory is access-able by URL. When saving a file in the TempFileManager then a URL is returned that can be passed back to the browser.

The content of the directory is removed once a session is destroyed.

Thie TempFileManager is a much easier to use variant to store dynamically created data on server side that is available by URL than e.g. using BufferedContentMgr. ...but: it is only useful to use in scenarios in which the URL that is provided is actually used!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTempFileAccess}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textarea id="g_3" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoTempFileAccess.html}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoTempFileAccess.onCreateFileAction}" text="Preview HTML" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:browser id="g_8" height="100%" url="#{d.DemoTempFileAccess.url}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTempFileAccess}")

public class DemoTempFileAccess
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_url = null;
    String m_html = "<html>\n<body>\n<h1>Some headline</h1>\n<p>\nSome content.\n</p>\n</body>\n</html>";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTempFileAccess(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotempfileaccess.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTempFileAccess}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }

    public String getHtml() { return m_html; }
    public void setHtml(String value) { this.m_html = value; }

    public void onCreateFileAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            byte[] bytes = m_html.getBytes("UTF-8");
            String path = "demo.html";
            m_url = TempFileManager.saveTempFile(path,bytes);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.getMessage());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Start Browser, dynamic content

This demo shows how to pass content dynamically into the browser that is opened up by the JSHOWURL component.

Either you pass HTML text, or you pass some content, e.g. a PDF byte array. When passing non-HTML content it is recommended to also pass the extension of the content ("pdf") so that the browser is able to select the right application to internally load.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:jshowurl id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent.trigger}" url="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent.browserURL}" usedesktop="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent.onPDF}" text="Start with PDF" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent.onHTML}" text="Start with HTML" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.BufferedContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageLifecycleListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent}")

public class DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class ResourceBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        String i_resourceName;
        public void passContent(String resourceName, String extension)
        {
            i_resourceName = resourceName;
            setExtension(extension);
        }
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            return (WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray(i_resourceName));
        }
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return null;
        }
    }
    
    public class HTMLBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            try
            {
                StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
                sb.append("<html>");
                sb.append("This page was dynamically created on server side.<br>");
                sb.append("This page was dynamically created on server side.<br>");
                sb.append("This page was dynamically created on server side.<br>");
                sb.append("This page was dynamically created on server side.<br>");
                sb.append("This page was dynamically created on server side.<br>");
                sb.append("</html>");
                return sb.toString().getBytes("UTF-8");
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                return ("Error occurred: " + t.toString()).getBytes();
            }
        }
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return null;
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoStartBrowserDynamicContent(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedContent1);
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedContent2);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener()
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                BufferedContentMgr.remove(m_bufferedContent1);
                BufferedContentMgr.remove(m_bufferedContent2);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    String m_url = null;
    ResourceBufferedContent m_bufferedContent1 = new ResourceBufferedContent();
    HTMLBufferedContent m_bufferedContent2 = new HTMLBufferedContent();

    public String getBrowserURL() { return m_url; }
    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }

    public void onPDF(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_bufferedContent1.passContent("/pdf/pdftest1.pdf","pdf");
        m_url = m_bufferedContent1.getURLForBROWSERUsage();
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onHTML(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_url = m_bufferedContent2.getURLForBROWSERUsage();
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

}

Copy content of client clipboard

The component BUTTONCOPYCLIPBOARD copies the client side clipboard content to the server side. After pressing the button a corresponding action-listener will be called on server side, the content of the client clipboard is transferred within the event.

The content is defined by a "type" (e.g. "text/plain", "text/html", "image/png", ...).

The content is represented by a String. If the content is byte data (e.g. image) then the String is a hexadecimal representation of the byte data. You can access the byte data by the method BaseActionEventCopyClipboard.getClipboardContentAsDecodedByteArray().

Pay attention on security issues: the browser requests the right to access the client side clipboard when calling the component. The component is only use-able in https scenarios!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:buttoncopyclipboard id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.onClipboardAction}" text="Send client clipboard content to server" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_8" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" labeltext="Content type" text="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.type}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_12" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:textpane id="g_14" labeltext="Content as text" text="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.content}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_29" rendered="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.availableImage}" />
<t:row id="g_18" rendered="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.availableImage}" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_23" background="#00000000" text="Content as image" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_24" >
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="100%" />
<t:heximage id="g_21" height="200" hexdata="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard.content}" width="200" />
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventCopyClipboard;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard}")

public class DemoButtonCopyClipboard
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_content;
    String m_type;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonCopyClipboard(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttoncopylcipboard.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonCopyClipboard}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onClipboardAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventCopyClipboard)
        {
            BaseActionEventCopyClipboard e = (BaseActionEventCopyClipboard)event;
            m_type = e.getClipboardContentType();
            m_content = e.getClipboardContentAsString();
        }
    }

    public String getContent() { return m_content; }
    public void setContent(String value) { this.m_content = value; }

    public String getType() { return m_type; }
    public void setType(String value) { this.m_type = value; }

    public boolean getAvailableImage() 
    { 
        return m_type != null && m_type.startsWith("image/"); 
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Start Mail Client

The MAILTO component is an interface to the client side mail system. Internally the data is passed by building a "mailto:..."-URL and sending this via the client side Desktop interface.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:mailto id="g_2" body="#{d.DemoMailTo.body}" receiver="#{d.DemoMailTo.receiver}" subject="#{d.DemoMailTo.subject}" trigger="#{d.DemoMailTo.sendTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMailTo}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Receiver" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_6" text="#{d.DemoMailTo.receiver}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Subject" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_9" text="#{d.DemoMailTo.subject}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Body" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_12" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoMailTo.body}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoMailTo.onOpenMail}" text="Open Client Mail" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMailTo}")

public class DemoMailTo
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoMailTo(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    protected Trigger m_sendTrigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getSendTrigger() { return m_sendTrigger; }

    protected String m_body = "Some body text.";
    public String getBody() { return m_body; }
    public void setBody(String value) { m_body = value; }

    protected String m_subject = "Some subject text";
    public String getSubject() { return m_subject; }
    public void setSubject(String value) { m_subject = value; }

    protected String m_receiver = "info@captaincasa.com";
    public String getReceiver() { return m_receiver; }
    public void setReceiver(String value) { m_receiver = value; }

    public void onOpenMail(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_sendTrigger.trigger();
    }

}

Embed Flash Player (Java Client only)

This example demonstrates how easy it is to integrate the Adobe Flash Player via ActiveX.

You just need to specifiy the PROGID (which is "ShockwaveFlash.ShockwaveFlash") and need to set the "Moview"-property of the ActiveX component!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoActivexFlashPlayer}" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_2" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="50%" />
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoActivexFlashPlayer.onSlides1}" text="Slideset 1" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="5" />
<t:link id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoActivexFlashPlayer.onSlides2}" text="Slideset 2" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="5" />
<t:link id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoActivexFlashPlayer.onSlides3}" text="Slideset 3" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="50%" />
<t:activex id="g_14" command="#{d.DemoActivexFlashPlayer.activexCommand}" height="300" progid="ShockwaveFlash.ShockwaveFlash" width="400" />
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" align="center" text="The slides that you can see actually are SWF files that are executed by natively integrating the Adobe Flahs player." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="50%" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoActivexFlashPlayer extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_activexCommand = "set(Movie,http://www.captaincasa.com/tours/eclnt_tour_statement.swf)";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoActivexFlashPlayer(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getActivexCommand() { return m_activexCommand; }
    
    public void onSlides1(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_activexCommand = "set(Movie,http://www.captaincasa.com/tours/eclnt_tour_statement.swf)";
    }
    
    public void onSlides2(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_activexCommand = "set(Movie,http://www.captaincasa.com/tours/eclnt_tour_statement_technology.swf)";
    }
    
    public void onSlides3(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_activexCommand = "set(Movie,http://www.captaincasa.com/tours/eclnt_tour_captaincasa.swf)";
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
}

Start Client Program (Java Client only)

Using the STARTPROCESS component you can launch a client side program "by commandline". You need to pass the command line string, the working directory (optional) and a trigger in order to activate the launching.

The user will get a notification before the program gets executed - in order to avoid an uncontrolled execution of client logic.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:startprocess id="g_2" commandline="#{d.DemoStartProcess.commandLine}" commandlineargumentscsv="#{d.DemoStartProcess.arguments}" trigger="#{d.DemoStartProcess.trigger}" workingdirectory="#{d.DemoStartProcess.workingDirectory}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStartProcess}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Command Line" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_6" text="#{d.DemoStartProcess.commandLine}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Arguments (CSV)" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_9" text="#{d.DemoStartProcess.arguments}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Working Directory" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_12" text="#{d.DemoStartProcess.workingDirectory}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoStartProcess.onStart}" text="Start" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStartProcess}")

public class DemoStartProcess
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_arguments;
    public String getArguments() { return m_arguments; }
    public void setArguments(String value) { m_arguments = value; }

    public DemoStartProcess(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void onStart(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

    protected Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }
    public void setTrigger(Trigger value) { m_trigger = value; }

    protected String m_workingDirectory;
    public String getWorkingDirectory() { return m_workingDirectory; }
    public void setWorkingDirectory(String value) { m_workingDirectory = value; }

    protected String m_commandLine;
    public String getCommandLine() { return m_commandLine; }
    public void setCommandLine(String value) { m_commandLine = value; }

}

Generic Subdevice (Java Client only)

The CLIENTSUBDEVICE component is a bridge to an implementation of the client side interface "ISubDevice".

ISubDevice is a simple, generic interface to a subdevice (e.g. Scanner, Card Reader, ...). The technology how the client actually communicated to the subdevice (serial port? USB?) is completely hidden by the interface and is part of the concrete implementation.

The subdevice is created, initialized - and then both receives messages from the server side processing (SENDVALUE, SENDTRIGGER) and sends messages back to the server (calling the ACTIONLISTENER). A subdevice can be re-initizaled (INITVALUE,INITTRIGGER) or explicitly closed (CLOSETRIGGER).

In the demo the concrete subdevice implementation outputs information (e.g. when being initialized) to the client's console. And it regularly sends messages to the server side.

The communication to the subdevice is based on a "one-String-only" protocol. E.g. you may pass one INITVALUE to the subdevice. The content and format of this string (e.g. XML) is completely up to you.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:clientsubdevice id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.onSubDeviceAction}" initvalue="Some init value" sendtrigger="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.sendTrigger}" sendvalue="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.sendValue}" subdeviceclassname="org.eclnt.client.util.subdevice.TestSubDevice" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice}">
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Value to send" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_6" text="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.sendValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.onSendAction}" text="Send!" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Protocol" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:textarea id="g_14" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoClientSubDevice.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;
