The component only sends updates! It does not regularly trigger the server - but only if some data change happened.<

The user needs to allow the access to the location information when using this component, otherwise some error message will be sent to server side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:geolocation id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.onGeoLocationUpdate}" scandelay="5000" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGeoLocation}">
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="GPS Sensor Information" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="10" >
<t:pane id="g_7" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Accuracy" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_10" align="right" enabled="false" format="double" value="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.accuracy}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Longitude" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_13" align="right" enabled="false" format="double" formatmask="dec7" value="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.longitude}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Latitude" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" align="right" enabled="false" format="double" formatmask="dec7" value="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.latitude}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:textarea id="g_17" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:osmviewer id="g_19" height="100%" latitude="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.latitude}" longitude="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.longitude}" osmzoom="14" width="100%" >
<t:osmviewerwaypoint id="g_20" hideinfopopup="true" latitude="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.latitude}" longitude="#{d.DemoGeoLocation.longitude}" text="Here I am!" />
</t:osmviewer>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventGeoLocationUpdate;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGeoLocation}")

public class DemoGeoLocation
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_protocol = "Protocol:\n";
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onGeoLocationUpdate(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventGeoLocationUpdate)
        {
            BaseActionEventGeoLocationUpdate e = (BaseActionEventGeoLocationUpdate)event;
            m_protocol += "Event: " + e.getStatus() + " at " + new Date().toString() + "\n";
            m_accuracy = e.getAccuracy(); 
            m_longitude = e.getLongitude(); 
            m_latitude = e.getLatitude(); 
        }
    }

    double m_accuracy;
    public double getAccuracy() { return m_accuracy; }
    public void setAccuracy(double value) { this.m_accuracy = value; }

    double m_latitude;
    public double getLatitude() { return m_latitude; }
    public void setLatitude(double value) { this.m_latitude = value; }

    double m_longitude;
    public double getLongitude() { return m_longitude; }
    public void setLongitude(double value) { this.m_longitude = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGeoLocation(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogeolocation.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGeoLocation}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Insert JavaScript

This component is usabled within the RISC Client only.

You may pass a JavaScript text which is executed when the component is triggered.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:scriptinsert id="g_2" scripttext="#{d.DemoScriptInsert.scriptText}" trigger="#{d.DemoScriptInsert.scriptTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScriptInsert}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textarea id="g_5" height="200" text="#{d.DemoScriptInsert.scriptText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoScriptInsert.onButtonAction}" text="Trigger" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoScriptInsert}")

public class DemoScriptInsert
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Trigger m_scriptTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_scriptText = "alert(\"Harry\");";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoScriptInsert(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);     
        onButtonAction(null);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoscriptinsert.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoScriptInsert}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onButtonAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_scriptTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public Trigger getScriptTrigger() { return m_scriptTrigger; }
    public void setScriptTrigger(Trigger value) { this.m_scriptTrigger = value; }

    public String getScriptText() { return m_scriptText; }
    public void setScriptText(String value) { this.m_scriptText = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Insert HTML

This client is only usable within the RISC Client.

The HTML that is passed by the TEXT attribute is directly inserted into the rectangle area that is defined by the component's WIDTH and HEIGHT definition.

The sizing of the component is independent from the content that you pass!

PLEASE NOT - AND PLEASE PAY ATTENTION:
This component by intention directly moves the HTML into the corresponding area. You are responsible for checking the HTML for sanity (e.g. that it does not contain embedded scripting). Only use this component if you are 100% sure that the HTML that is passed is coming from some trusted source.

This component must be used with extreme care from security point of view!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHtmlInsert}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textarea id="g_3" height="200" text="#{d.DemoHtmlInsert.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" text="Update" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:directhtmlinsert id="g_7" background="#00000010" border="#c0c0c0" height="200" text="#{d.DemoHtmlInsert.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoHtmlInsert}")

public class DemoHtmlInsert
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_htmlText = "<ol>\n  <li>First</li>\n  <li>Second</li>\n</ol>";
    public String getHtmlText() { return m_htmlText; }
    public void setHtmlText(String value) { this.m_htmlText = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoHtmlInsert(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demohtmlinsert.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoHtmlInsert}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Keyboard Scanner

Either connect a barcode reader (or other device) and scan a value - or type come characters in quick order. When interrupting the keyboard input the key sequence will be sent to the server side.

The KEYBOARDSCANNER is a visible component that receives keyboard input and passes it to the server side if the keyboard input is interrupted for 400ms.

The component is useful for scnearios in which barcodes or other ids are scanned via a technical device that is internally transferring its data into keyboard events.

In order to receive keyboard events the component must be focused. As consequence it provides an attribute REQUSTFOCUSTIMER by which you can define a duration in ms, after which the component tries to request the focus in case of user inactivity.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:keyboardscanner id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner.onScanAction}" requestfocus="creation" requestfocustimer="5000" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_4" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Scanned Value" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner.scannedValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventScan;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}")

public class DemoKeyboardScanner
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_scannedValue;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoKeyboardScanner(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demokeyboardscanner.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onScanAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventScan e = (BaseActionEventScan)event;
            m_scannedValue = e.getScannedValue();
        }
    }

    public String getScannedValue() { return m_scannedValue; }
    public void setScannedValue(String value) { this.m_scannedValue = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Combination: Scanner <=> Field input

This demo shows a combination out of "scanned input" and "keyboard input".

By default the KEYBOARDSCANNER component is shown - reqeusting the focus regularly and waiting for scanner input (which is a fast sequence of keyboard events).

The user may change to manual keyboard input: in this case the KEYBOARDSCANNER component is not rendered anymore (and thus also not requesting the focus), so the user can use a field to key in the value.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_3" background="#00000010" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="400" >
<t:captureanimator id="g_4" animationtype="hidetoleft" trigger="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.renderedScanner}" />
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="10" rendered="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.renderedScanner}" >
<t:keyboardscanner id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.onScanAction}" requestfocus="creation" requestfocustimer="3000" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.onManualInputAction}" text="Manual input" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" rendered="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.renderedField}" >
<t:field id="g_9" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.fieldValue}" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.onFieldOKAction}" image="/images/icons_16/ok_16x16.png" text="OK" width="1%;100" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.onFieldCancelAction}" image="/images/icons_16/cancel_16x16.png" text="Cancel" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_12" />
<t:row id="g_13" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="25" />
<t:label id="g_15" font="weight:bold" text="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField.scannedValue}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventKeySequence;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventScan;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField}")

public class DemoKeyboardScannerWithField
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_fieldValue;
    String m_scannedValue;
    boolean m_renderedScanner = true;
    boolean m_renderedField = false;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoKeyboardScannerWithField(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demokeyboardscannerwithfield.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerWithField}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getFieldValue() { return m_fieldValue; }
    public void setFieldValue(String value) { this.m_fieldValue = value; }

    public void onScanAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventScan e = (BaseActionEventScan)event;
            m_scannedValue = e.getScannedValue();
        }
    }

    public String getScannedValue() { return m_scannedValue; }
    public void setScannedValue(String value) { this.m_scannedValue = value; }

    public void onFieldCancelAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_renderedScanner = true;
        m_renderedField = false;
        m_fieldValue = null;
    }

    public void onFieldOKAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_renderedScanner = true;
        m_renderedField = false;
        m_scannedValue = m_fieldValue;
        m_fieldValue = null;
    }

    public void onManualInputAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_renderedScanner = false;
        m_renderedField = true;
    }

    public boolean getRenderedScanner() { return m_renderedScanner; }
    public boolean getRenderedField() { return m_renderedField; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Subpage

A CaptainCasa dialog can be embedded either by using the general BROWSER components - or by using the SUBPAGE component.

In the SUBPAGE component you directly pass the URL of the layout definition that you want to embed.

The embedding of the page is done using the HTML-iframe element. Please pay attention: some configuration is required to embed pages that are not loaded from the same origin (protocol + server + port) than the outside page. Please check the document "CaptainCasa Security Guide", section "Content Security Protocol / CSP".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSubpage}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:combobox id="g_4" editable="true" labeltext="Layout URL of contained sub-page" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoSubpage.subpageURLVVS}" value="#{d.DemoSubpage.subpageURL}" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_5" text="Show" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Embedded layout" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" font="weight:normal" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="The result might not be shown due to security settings or non-availability of servers behind the selected URL!" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:subpage id="g_11" height="100%" subpagesessionid="#{d.DemoSubpage.subPageSessionId}" url="#{d.DemoSubpage.subpageURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSubpage}")

public class DemoSubpage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static final String PORT = "50000"; 
    ValidValuesBinding m_subpageURLVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_subpageURL;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSubpage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientJavaTypeIsRisc())
            this.m_subpageURL = "http://localhost:"+PORT+"/demos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp";
        else if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientJavaTypeIsFX())
            this.m_subpageURL = "http://localhost:"+PORT+"/demos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp?ccstyle=ccmetrofx";
        else if (HttpSessionAccess.checkIfCurrentClientJavaTypeIsSwing())
            this.m_subpageURL = "http://localhost:"+PORT+"/demos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp?ccstyle=default";
        m_subpageURLVVS.addValidValue(this.m_subpageURL,this.m_subpageURL);
        m_subpageURLVVS.addValidValue("http://www.captaincasa.online/ccdemos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp",
                                      "http://www.captaincasa.online/ccdemos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp");
        m_subpageURLVVS.addValidValue("https://www.captaincasa.online/ccdemos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp",
                                      "https://www.captaincasa.online/ccdemos/faces/workplace/demohelloworld.jsp");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosubpage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSubpage}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getSubpageURLVVS() { return m_subpageURLVVS; }

    public String getSubpageURL() { return m_subpageURL; }
    public void setSubpageURL(String value) { this.m_subpageURL = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Iframe inclusion with JS interface

The component IFRAMEINCLUDE is a generic component to integrate an HTML-page that resides on the same server.

You can talk to this HTML-page by sending commands via a JavaScript API that the HTML page has to implement.

Please check the file <webcontentcc>/eclnt/risc/ext_iframeinclude_ccexample/example.html - which explains by example how to do the JavaScript integration.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoIframeInclude}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textarea id="g_3" height="75" text="#{d.DemoIframeInclude.configuration}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoIframeInclude.onSendCommandAction}" text="Send configuration" />
<t:label id="g_6" align="center" dragsend="AAAA:1" text="Drag this label" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_8" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:iframeinclude id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoIframeInclude.onCallbackAction}" dropreceive="AAAA;article" height="100%" iframeconfiguration="#{d.DemoIframeInclude.configuration}" iframepage="/eclnt/risc/ext_iframeinclude_ccexample/example.html" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventIframeIncludeCallback;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPdfprinterNotification;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoIframeInclude}")

public class DemoIframeInclude
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_configuration = "Some configuration.";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoIframeInclude(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoiframeinclude.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoIframeInclude}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getConfiguration() { return m_configuration; }
    public void setConfiguration(String value) { this.m_configuration = value; }

    public void onSendConfigurationAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
    }
    
    public void onCallbackAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventIframeIncludeCallback)
        {
            BaseActionEventIframeIncludeCallback e = (BaseActionEventIframeIncludeCallback)event;
            String paramString = e.getCallbackParam();
            Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup(paramString);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Playing videos

The VIDEO component is a representation of the HTML "video" element - and plays videos.

Please pay attention: check the documentation of the HTML "video" element in order to find the exact video formats that are supported on various platforms!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoVideo}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some video examples" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="/videos/sample.webm" text="/videos/sample.webm" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="http://www.html5videoplayer.net/videos/toystory.mp4" text="http://www.html5videoplayer.net/videos/toystory.mp4" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_9" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="http://mirrors.standaloneinstaller.com/video-sample/jellyfish-25-mbps-hd-hevc.mp4" text="http://mirrors.standaloneinstaller.com/video-sample/jellyfish-25-mbps-hd-hevc.mp4" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:pane id="g_12" border="#808080" height="300" width="400" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:video id="g_14" height="100%" videosrc="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_15" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" align="center" cutwidth="true" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoVideo}")

public class DemoVideo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_videoSrc ="/videos/sample.webm";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoVideo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demovideo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoVideo}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getVideoSrc() { return m_videoSrc; }
    public void setVideoSrc(String value) { this.m_videoSrc = value; }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Videos with tracks (sub-titles)

Below the VIDEO component you may place one or several TRACK elements - e.g. for adding sub-titles to the video.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}">
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:video id="g_4" height="100%" videosrc="/videos/sample.webm" width="100%" >
<t:track id="g_5" default="true" kind="subtitles" label="Subtitles for video" src="/videos/sample.vtt" srclang="en" />
</t:video>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}")

public class DemoVideoWithTrack
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoVideoWithTrack(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demovideowithtrack.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}"; }

}

Playing Youtube movies

This demo just shows how to use the BROWSER component to render Youtube-videos.

Each Youtube-video can be embedde via a URL. The BROWSER component internally opens up an HTML "iframe" instance, in which the URL is opened.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoYoutube}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_3" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/N_rOS7a7JO0" text="Hot Deployment" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D27cv5GPASs" text="Creating a Gradle project" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" rendered="false" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8Q0WwIWOri8" text="Web UI for Business Applications" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:browser id="g_10" allowfullscreen="true" height="350" url="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" width="500" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" align="center" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" width="500" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoYoutube}")

public class DemoYoutube
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_youtubeLink = "https://www.youtube.com/embed/N_rOS7a7JO0";
    
    public DemoYoutube(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoyoutube.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoYoutube}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getYoutubeLink() { return m_youtubeLink; }
    public void setYoutubeLink(String value) { this.m_youtubeLink = value; }

}

Client info

The CLIENTINFOBUTTON is a button that outputs certain client information into an alert window.

The button is useful for analyzing problems that may occur on client processing side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoClientInfo}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClientInfo}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:clientinfobutton id="g_4" text="Client info" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClientInfoUI}")

public class DemoClientInfo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoClientInfo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democlientinfo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoClientInfoUI}"; }
}

System icon

The component SYSTEMICON is an icon that directly executes dedicated client functions.

The function is passed by setting attribute SYSTEMFUNCTION.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSystemIcon}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSystemIcon}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Whole window related" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:systemicon id="g_21" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/maximize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="maximize" text="maximize" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:systemicon id="g_19" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/minimize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="minimize" text="minimize" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:systemicon id="g_23" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/minmaximize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="maximizeMinimize" text="maximizeMinimize" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Popup related" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:textpane id="g_5" text="Open this demo as popup dialog prior to invoking one of the following functions." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:systemicon id="g_28" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/close_16x16.svg" systemfunction="closePopup" text="closePopup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:systemicon id="g_32" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/maximize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="maximizePopup" text="maximizePopup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:systemicon id="g_30" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/minimize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="minimizePopup" text="minimizePopup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:systemicon id="g_34" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/minmaximize_16x16.svg" systemfunction="maximizeMinimizePopup" text="maximizeMinimizePopup" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSystemIcon}")

public class DemoSystemIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoSystemIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosystemicon.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSystemIcon}"; }
}

Update browser title and image

The component CLIENTCONFIG contains an attribute TITLE and an attribute TITLEIMAGE by which you can update the information that is shown inside a "browser tab".

The component either can be directly embedded in your layout - or you can use its default representation which is automatically added - by using the "Client"-class.

The API is:

1. Client.instance().setTitle(...)
2. Client.instance().setTitleimage(...)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle}" >
<t:clientconfig id="g_3" title="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.browserTitle}" titleimage="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.browserTitleImage}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="Observe the &#34;title tab&#34; of your browser while updating the definitions below...:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:image id="g_2" image="/images/pictures/browsertab.png" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:field id="g_8" labeltext="New browser title" text="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.inputTitle}" width="100%;100" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.onChangeBrowserTitle}" text="Change browser  title" width="150+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:combobox id="g_11" labeltext="New browser title" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.inputImageVVS}" value="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.inputImage}" width="100%;100" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle.onChangeBrowserImage}" text="Change browser  icon" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Client;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBrowserTitle}")

public class DemoBrowserTitle
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_inputTitle = "Some new title";
    String m_inputImage = null;
    ValidValuesBinding m_inputImageVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBrowserTitle(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_inputImageVVS.addValidValue("/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/calendar_16x16.svg","/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/calendar_16x16.svg");
        m_inputImageVVS.addValidValue("/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/color_16x16.svg","/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/color_16x16.svg");
        m_inputImageVVS.addValidValue("/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/bulb_16x16.svg","/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/bulb_16x16.svg");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobrowsertitle.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBrowserTitle}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getInputImageVVS() { return m_inputImageVVS; }

    public String getInputImage() { return m_inputImage; }
    public void setInputImage(String value) { this.m_inputImage = value; }

    public String getInputTitle() { return m_inputTitle; }
    public void setInputTitle(String value) { this.m_inputTitle = value; }

    public void onChangeBrowserTitle(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Client.instance().setTitle(m_inputTitle);
    }

    public void onChangeBrowserImage(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Client.instance().setTitleimage(m_inputImage);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}
